About Us
Seventh Sense is an Edge-AI startup, democratizing AI. At Seventh Sense, we are solving the problem of running computationally intensive deep learning (AI) without the need for costly GPUs or Cloud. We make it possible to get GPU-class machine vision performance on commoditized hardware such as ubiquitous CPUs, mCPUs, embedded systems, and compute-constrained devices. This technology enables us to build our products which help in making our world a safer place.
Our Face Recognition engine accuracy is ranked amongst the top in NIST, LFW, IJB-C, and other benchmarks.
Co-founders have 2-decades of experience, each, and have a track record which includes successful exits one was acquired by McAfee/Intel, and second was registered on a Stock Exchange.
We are backed by well-known US based VC investors and recognized local investors, such as CapVista (the strategic investment arm of Singapore's Defense, Science and Technology Agency within Ministry of Defense).
Job Description
The UX/UI Designer will work on optimising the user experience and interface of all Seventh Sense products, and will focus on making user interactions effective, efficient and satisfying, from all our web applications, mobile and desktop applications. This is a collaborative work that would require communication your design to our engineers and some 3rd-party developers, as well as explaining design decisions to our clients.
Background
At least 5 years of hands-on experience in design projects
Collaborate with the product and engineering team to plan optimal solutions to design problems that balance customer needs, business constraints and technological realities
Should have knowledge of design and prototyping software like InVision (required), Sketch, AdobeXD, Figma
Provide creative design works for branding, corporate identity, for marketing purposes
Online design portfolio for review
Experience with data science, machine learning, and AI product sets, especially training and deployment platforms and pipelines (preferred)
Data visualization skills (preferred)
Ability to define product requirements based on user and stakeholder research (preferred)
Strong understanding of web technologies such HTML, CSS and JavaScript (preferred)
Benefits
Health Care Plan
Paid Time Off (Vacation, Sick & Public Holidays)
Family Leave (Maternity, Paternity)
Short Term & Long-Term Disability
Training & Development
Work From Home
Stock Option Plan

Our reputable client in Singapore is looking for Lead Software Engineer (.Net Core) to join their team in Singapore.
Job Purpose Analyze, design, develop and maintain of IT applications, including documentation and post-implementation customer support.
Job Responsibilities & Duties Analyze, design, program, test, document and maintain IT systems / applications

Design and build integration between multiple on premises and/or cloud hosted systems.
Provide maintenance support to customers (internal and/or external) by investigating and rectifying reported systems shortcomings.
Analyse requests for enhancements/changes and write amendment/program specifications.
Perform and manage stages of the SDLC and participate in the systems review with Project Lead/Manager.
Understand the interdependencies of the services (application, system and database) and able to pin-point problem areas accurately to improve overall efficiency.

Use development tools to develop applications for better productivity.

Experienced in both Agile and waterfall methodologies

ASP.NET/ ASP.NET CORE
C#, HTML5, CSS, JQuery, JavaScript, Bootstrap, Kendo UI, Web Services and Web APIs.

SQL Database Server

S & I Systems, S & I Systems, established in 1998, is a leading service provider offering end-to-end IT services. We lead digital transformations for clients by modernising their mainstream IT and deploying digital solutions at scale to drive growth and performance.
Job Responsibilities
Lead small to medium Dynamics 365 implementation team inclusive of both technical and functional consultants.
Provide in-depth knowledge of the Microsoft Dynamics 365 (CRM) and PowerApps platform and evaluate customer's requirements against the standard COTS functionality.
Perform a fit-gap analysis to come up with a proposed solution architecture to address requirements.
Lead sessions with business users and client IT teams during project implementation.
Ability to orchestrate design and solutioning of components from a modularized design perspective. Implementation of MS CRM data migration jobs, plug-in development and custom reports using SSRS.
Good understanding of CRM entity & Object model, data and reporting using SSRS. Familiarity with Power BI is an added advantage.
Leverage Object-Oriented Programming and Design experience and work with functional and technical consultants during design and build phases to come up with scalable/reusable solution.
Job Requirements
Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, or equivalent.
Certifications in Microsoft Technologies preferably in Dynamics 365 (CRM).
Proficient in Microsoft Dynamics 365(CRM) and Power Platform.
Minimum 5 years of working experience in CRM projects for enterprise customers.
Working knowledge of at least three of the following: C#, ASP.Net, JScript, XML, HTML, SharePoint, SQL, Windows Server 2003/SBS 2003 related technologies, data migration & application integration techniques.
Experienced with on-premise, private cloud and public cloud deployment models for Dynamics 365 and Power Platform components (Public SaaS).
Communication skills: Ability to effectively communicate technical & business concepts to clients on all levels, good presentation skills, objective to rationalize points of conflict and confidently put forward team's point of view.
Project management: Familiar with project management methodologies and ability to manage smaller projects where a dedicated project manager is not assigned. Sound understanding on other project management methodologies such as Agile (Scrum) and ability to utilize it effectively.
Leadership skills: Lead the team by example. Passionate about technology and takes ownership for action, seeks feedback and takes direction. Takes pride in delivering excellent results. Drives issues to resolution.
Team player: Ability and willingness to motivate and mentor team members and develop good working relationships with clients & team members.
Resourcefulness: Ability to perform issues analysis, develop creative/unique approaches to issue resolution, recognize problems and opportunities. Ability to analyze requirements and translate them into priorities and action plans. Solution with a scalability and Microsoft supported best practices in mind.

column7:
SISLEY IN A FEW WORDS:
Established in 1976, Sisley is a French premium beauty brand with production, administration, and research laboratories in France. Today, Sisley's skincare, makeup, fragrances and haircare products are present in more than 90 countries worldwide. In APAC region, Sisley covers more than 10 countries with a fast-expanding digital and ecommerce footprint to serve the needs of our high-end cliental. The APAC regional office in Singapore is looking for a Regional E-Merchandiser to animate & ensurethe luxurious Sisley experience throughout our many brand sites and ecommerce channels.
ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES
Coordinate the rollout of Salesforce Commerce Cloud brand sites and ecommerce channels in APAC.
Maintain the functional aspects of our brand sites and ecommerce sites in APAC countries to optimize and enrich the total brand presentation including:
o Web mastering: Managing content integration, page design and copywriting inside our brand site backend system.
o Publishing brand content & marketing pages for SEO
o Launch experiential omnichannel campaigns to drive interest and purchases.
o Coordinate the rollout of ecommerce sales campaigns by creating enticing promotion rules and campaign banners.
Create and implement online/offline marketing activities such as launch campaign pages, EDMs, sign-up forms to drive consideration, sampling and purchase.
Lead projects for designing online brand store experience for e-retailers and e-department stores throughout APAC countries.
Analyse site performance and apply learnings from A/B testing to drive customer experience and sell-through.
Collaborate and align closely with marketing, digital and creative teams in local markets and Headquarters to deliver the right content at the right time.
JOB EXPERIENCES & QUALIFICATIONS NEEDED:
2-4 years of working experience in ecommerce, digital media or digital marketing.
Cosmetic products and beauty industry experience (preferred)
Hands-on experience with Salesforce Commerce Cloud or similar (preferred)
Graphical skills for pack shots and banners (preferred)
Web layout and page builder tool experience (preferred)
Coding basic knowledge in HTML, CSS (preferred)
This is a position to support the e-commerce of our Asia Pacific region. The China market is our largest market segment in the Asia Pacific region, therefore, the person should preferably be fluent in Chinese language speaking and reading.
DESIRED CHARACTERISTICS:
Self-starter and highly driven individual
Ability to identify and go after opportunities
Strong analytical skills
Ability to work well in a team
Strong cross-cultural communication skills
Fast learner and ability to multi-task
Versatile and adaptable to changes
Passionate about cosmetics and skincare business

Farallon Capital Management, L.L.C. is a global institutional asset management firm. Founded in 1986 and headquartered in San Francisco, Farallon has offices in London, Singapore, Hong Kong, Tokyo, and So Paulo and employs approximately 210 employees. The firm's investments include public and private debt and equity securities, direct investments in private companies, and real estate.
Position Overview
We are expanding our team in Singapore and we are looking for software engineers to help us develop solutions across all teams in our organization. Our initial focus is on supporting our Asia offices (Singapore, Hong Kong, and Tokyo), and our team collaborates with the US team as well to solve problems for the firm.
What you'll do
Partner with our end users to develop applications that improve efficiency.
Build data visualization and analytic tools on web and mobile technologies.
Explore and implement alternative low code and no code platforms to deliver solutions quickly where appropriate.
Collaborate with the US based team[AI1] to ensure technical alignment and interoperation of applications.
Bring in industry standard practices and modern application architecture patterns to the overall solution.
What we look for
8+years of experience in building software using agile methodologies with .NET and C#.
A degree in computer science or an equivalent related field (bachelor's/master's).[AI3]
Software architecture experience working on small and medium size projects while keeping an overall architectural vision.
Experience with cloud services development, preferably Azure.
Experience with web and mobile technologies.
Experience with SQL Server (data modeling and query optimization).
Knowledge of Enterprise Reporting and Data Visualization tools (Qlik, Power BI, Tableau, etc) desired.
Knowledge of hedge funds/financial terminology desired.
Experience with WinForms development desired.
Compensation is competitive and commensurate with experience and expertise. The firm offers an attractive benefits package including medical, dental, and vision insurance plans and a retirement savings plan. We offer a training and growth plan.

About Us
Seventh Sense is an Edge-AI startup, democratizing AI. At Seventh Sense, we are solving the problem of running computationally intensive deep learning (AI) without the need for costly GPUs or Cloud. We make it possible to get GPU-class machine vision performance on commoditized hardware such as ubiquitous CPUs, mCPUs, embedded systems, and compute-constrained devices. This technology enables us to build our products which help in making our world a safer place.
Our Face Recognition engine accuracy is ranked amongst the top in NIST, LFW,IJB-C, and other benchmarks.
Co-founders have 2-decades of experience, each, and have a track record which includes successful exits one was acquired by McAfee/Intel, and second was registered on a Stock Exchange.
We are backed by well-known US based VC investors and recognized local investors, such as CapVista (the strategic investment arm of Singapore's Defense, Science and Technology Agency within Ministry of Defense).
Job Description
We are looking for a frontend engineer to work closely with our product and machine learning teams to build front end for web-based/mobile dashboard. As a frontend engineer, you should be comfortable with front-end coding languages, development frameworks, and third-party libraries. If you are someone who wants to contribute to solving challenging technical problems with exposure to the forefront of deep learning, this is the role for you.
The role will also require collaborating with project and product teams to transfer ideas into product solutions and applications.

Strong programming skills with proven experience implementing Angular and React-based frontend applications

Familiarity with automated testing platforms and writing unit tests

Working days : Monday- Friday: 9 am to 6 pm
Work location: Jalan Bukit Merah
Salary: $4000 - $6000
JOB SUMMARY:
Reporting to Presales Manager, the Presales Consultant combines deep technical subject matter expertise with a keen understanding of how to address the critical business needs of customers through ICT products and Solutions.
Externally, this role works closely with the Sales team to close deals, supporting the team through the full sales process of solution engineering, such as architectural design, solution presentation, standard and customized solution demonstration, customer workshop, proposals development, and work with sales team to answer RFI/RFP.
Internally, this role works with the Technical team to ensure smooth transition to post sales implementation. This role also actively engages and collaborates with the product team to provide field product feedback.
A successful candidate must maintain in-depth product knowledge of key ICT products, possess excellent communication skills to deliver presentation, and manage customer requirements to ensure the scope of solution can be delivered.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Become an expert with our focused product, able to deliver standard and customized presentations of solutions, as well as solution demonstration to customers from business owners of SME to C-level executives in enterprise accounts.
Architect and design custom solution based on customer's requirement using suite of focused products, apply industry best practice, to ensure the proposed solution can meet customer's business objective and can be delivered by Technical team.
Partner with sales and work on presentation materials for opportunity progression.
Work on complex deals and provide response to RFPs related to product, integration, delivery, Installation and maintenance.
Support sales and marketing events, conferences and exhibitions.
Provide support to sales materials development.
QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE:
Min. 5 years of presales experience in SME/ enterprise ICT Solution; ideally Windows or cloud-based Infrastructure offerings.

column1: Solution Lead (Security Technical Sales Lead), New Markets
column7:
Microsoft is on a mission to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. Our culture is centered on embracing a growth mindset, a theme of inspiring excellence, and encouraging teams and leaders to bring their best each day. In doing so, we create life-changing innovations that impact billions of lives around the world. You can help us to achieve our mission.

The Small, Medium, and Corporate team helps businesses achieve their digital transformation goals by matching customer challenges with Microsoft solutions. Located in either a Digital Sales center, or a local subsidiary, you will help our managed customers across industries, company s and territories to identify their needs and opportunities. One of the fastest growing customer segments in the technology industry, you will help customers get to the cloud across Microsoft solution areas like Modern Workplace, Business Applications, Applications and Infrastructure, and Data and AI.

We are looking for a highly motivated and passionate Security Technical Sales Solution Lead to develop a team that drives customer transformation. This is a customer-facing role, managing the team that is the face of overall technical relationship and strategy between the customer and Microsoft.
As the Solution Lead (Security Technical Sales Lead), New Markets you will be leading a team of Digital Specialists to provide and sell the best-in-class cloud service and platforms to our managed customers, building the momentum for digital transformation for our customers and partners as well as Microsoft itself. The Solution Lead (Security Technical Sales Lead), New Markets is a great sales coach and leader, has a challenger mentality, is savvy in sales-leadership practice and contributes with vision and flawless execution of solution sales across solution areas.
The new markets regional coverage include Bangladesh, Bhutan, Brunei, Cambodia, Laos, Maldives, Myanmar, Nepal and Sri Lanka

To learn more about Microsoft's mission, please visit:
Check out all of our products at:

The Solution Leader (Security Technical Sales Lead), New Markets is a proven sales leader, purposeful planner, people leader, sales challenger, market maker and a social seller:

Sales Leader:
Disciplined in business-management adaptable to a culture of accountability meets sales targets and operational standards.
The Solution Lead (Security Technical Sales Lead), New Marketsis consistent and predictable in managing the Solution-led businesses.
As the Security Consulting Specialist Sales Leader, you will have the ability to: Articulate security subject matter expertise and be skilled in communicating value propositions, executing defined sales motions & leveraging priority sales scenarios to meet the customer needs.


Purposeful Planner:
Builds a purposeful sales plan with a bold ambition to identify and capitalize on transformational shifts in the market.
Ensure appropriate 4 quarter qualified pipeline in place by workload/solution area: Solution sellers directly leading 50%+ of the cloud opportunities, with 50%+ partner attach rate to qualified opptys.


People Leader:
Develops a high-performing team by hiring diverse talent, prioritizing development, leading by example and preparing people for more senior positions in other parts of the organization.
Successful teams and team members are recognized and rewarded, both within the Solution Sellers and at the subsidiary, regional or Corporate levels.


Sales Challenger:
Coaches Seller's with a challenger mentality by prompting Seller's to engage early and lead with new insights on how to grow the customers business.


Market Maker:
Transforms markets with solutions that change the game by co-selling with partners that make deals bigger and faster, and change the risk profile.
Lead from the front, personally engaging at CxO level to support and coach teams on opportunity discovery and acceleration Lead Solution sellers to drive end-to-end business solutions (drive solution area thinking and behaviors), increasing customer and partner satisfaction and average deal s YoY.


Social Seller:
Builds a strong and active business network that stretches and influences far beyond themselves.
Business transformation: Lead STU sellers and technical-sellers to drive cloud businesses growth at or above targets, and lead cross-team to ensure consumption of cloud services sold.
Partner Engagement: Bring together Microsoft solutions with Partner solutions, fully leverage the synergy effect with our partners, and co-sell with them to make deals bigger and faster.

10 years of related senior sales experience in the advanced bdm workloads and bs/ba degree is required. mba preferred.
demonstrated experience and expertise selling to senior business leaders, specifically ciso, by aligning & reinforcing the value of cybersecurity solution to the customer's overall business pain and/or strategic opportunities and decision criteria.
industry certifications including but not limited to: pmi, selling, local technology associations, etc. a plus.
8+ years of related experience: senior sales leadership roles, managing high performance sales and technical-sales teams, coaching solution sales and account development strategies
experience driving organizational transformations while delivering on short-term results
strategic planner with track record driving results faster than competition in new markets/solution areas (preferred: cloud services growth and consumption)
solid interpersonal skills, coaching skills, cross-group collaboration and proven ability to influence across organizational boundaries
talent attractor: proven history attracting and developing new leaders
meaningful non-microsoft prior sales leader experience at it consulting and services or cloud services company.
success-driven, works well in a diverse team and enjoy a dynamic and changing environment

Responsibilities
Work with business and IS team to define appropriate SLA for production incidents and service requests, so that issues can be resolved in a timely manner that minimizes impact to customers and business.
Identify long-term resolutions to persistent production issues, in order to minimize impact and decrease daily operational work.
Manage and establish strong working relationship with business user and vendor for the system(s) you are working on.
Work with business teams to identify new opportunities/initiatives and provide a joint roadmap.
Refine business requirements, propose innovative/efficient/quick solutions which will help to achieve tangible business outcomes.
Perform technical impact assessment of new initiatives.
Manage projects, coordinate and perform system integration and acceptance testing with business users and vendors.
Provide full support until post go-live/deployment and ensure that Operations team is kept informed of the changes so that Operations team can provide effective support.
Identify, communicate and drive improvement initiatives for the processes and tools relating to the role.
Keep abreast of mobile technology and industry developments to ensure technical knowledge remains current to support the system(s).
Participate in Proof-Of-Concept initiatives to identify suitability of commercially-off-the-shelf tools for the business and IS teams.
Participate in audit activities.
Be on rotation standby duty, if required, in the event of major business events or production downtime.
Qualification
Degree in IT / Engineering related field with at least 3 years working in a Support or Services role
Candidate with working experience in Telco environment would have added advantage
Technical skillset preferred (not all mandatory)
- IT and Web Service Protocols (SOAP, REST)
- Scripting languages (Python, Perl, BASH)
- OS and Programming (Red Hat Enterprise Linux, Java, C++)
- Monitoring Applications and Visualization (Prometheus/Dynatrace/PRTG)
- Monitoring protocols (SNMP, JMX)
- IP network design (routing/switching, load balancing, resilience concepts)
- Cloud/Virtualisation (VMware, Azure, AWS, Google Cloud Platform, Kubernetes/Docker, Openshift, KVM)
- MongoDB
- MySQL
- Apache Kafka and Apache ActiveMQ
Good communication and interpersonal skills
* real time payment charging system experience

column7:
Main Responsibilities and Tasks:
Work on nominated South East Asia (SEA) accounts, and support neighbouring regions within Asia-Pacific as and when required
Enable and support the Account Executives for success by managing discovery, end-to-end solution design, technical and architectural needs within the accounts (including responding to RFI, RFP, etc.)
Analyse complex customer EIM requirements and translate the requirements into solutions addressable by our software platform this includes pro-actively working with customers to identify major business pains across the customer's organization, providing resolutions and surfacing tangible business values for the customer
Develop aligned strategies (low hanging, high value, forward-thinking) with the customer, for mid-level and C-level consumptions and acceptance of the overall value propositions
Be a trusted advisor and a thought leader to our customers, partners and across the OpenText organisation
Desired Capabilities:
Has a strong working knowledge of Enterprise Information Management (EIM) solution lines, with the ability to articulate how the complete EIM solution lines work together, architecting a complete EIM offering which showcases the business values the suite offers, for the customer's current and future needs
Has the domain knowledge & experience in in cloud-related technologies, ECM & content services generally, capture/OCR-related technologies, business processes automation and low-code development solutions
Has experience and understanding of other technical domains, including leading systems of record applications (such as ERP, HRMS, PLM etc), analytics & big data, customer/digital experience, text mining, integration, mobility, security, information governance (Records, PII, archiving, etc).
Has the ability to communicate complex concepts and issues resolutions (problem-solving) aggressively and effectively, selecting language, tone, and format perfectly targeted to the audience/stakeholders, showcasing the skills to make compelling tailored presentations to get the buy-in from the abovementioned audience/stakeholders
Has the technical competency to research, develop, showcase and articulate, through comprehensive presentations, high-quality demonstrations and POCs, the amalgamate perspective of the overall EIM suite, closely working together with the extended teams
Is intrinsically curious, passionate and driven to be constantly up to date with the necessary knowledge/skills on current and emerging technologies, and in developing innovative solutions, for a rapidly changing environment and evolving customer demands
Required Experience and Skills:
Minimum of 10 years of relevant work experience in business and/or software sales environment, and minimum of 5 years of relevant work experience in solution suite architecting
Bachelor's Degree in relevant field(s)
Solution & value-based selling experience, with the ability to demonstrate complex EIM concepts into customer needs, business models and IT solution strategies, supported with strong communication, presentation and documentation skills
Knowledge of software industry relating to all aspects of EIM solutions, with preferably experience in specific vertical/industries (FSI, E&E, etc.)
Have led a team of solution experts, in designing/weaving the various solution focuses into an end-to-end solution offering to the targeted stakeholders, internal (management, other disciplines, etc.) and external (customers, partners, etc.)
Ability to travel as required, when cross-border travels are allowed in future

DESCRIPTION

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is seeking an experienced, self-motivated content builder who possesses a unique balance of Financial Services industry knowledge, elite communication abilities, and strong interpersonal skills to join our Financial Services Content team. This role, which is part of a global team, is based in Asia and is focused on helping grow AWS's business in the region.

The Content Builder for Financial Services will enable execution of content strategy, development, and distribution for our AWS Financial Services team. This includes working directly with Marketing, Sales, Sales Enablement, Business Development, and Solutions Architects focused on Financial Services to (1) understand the concerns and objectives of AWS customers and (2) develop relevant content such as articles, presentations, websites, blog posts, and videos for both internal and external consumption.

Content generation will also require direct interactions with AWS customers and partners to develop narratives related to their respective cloud journeys. Responsibilities include outreach and education of Marketing, Sales, and Business Development counterparts in other regions to effectively use these assets and deliver them to customers.

Roles & Responsibilities:
. Working with AWS Financial Services leadership to manage and expand our customer reference and resource library, including executive presentations
. Working with individuals from Marketing, Sales, Sales Enablement, Business Development, Engineering, Compliance, and Security departments to develop relevant content
. Enhancing AWS communication mechanisms to drive awareness (both internally and externally) of AWS offerings and use cases related to Financial Services
. Working with Marketing to maintain and improve AWS Financial Services external communication channels, such as websites, email campaigns, blogs, whitepapers, and webinars
. Coordinating directly with customers to develop and publish customer case studies and event presentations
. Attending relevant events and facilitating event speaking opportunities
. Designing and managing ongoing metrics and measurements of the program and customer progress

A day in the life

About the hiring group

Job responsibilities

Key job responsibilities include rapidly building the strong internal and external relationships needed to create compelling content that help AWS scale cloud adoption across the Asia Pacific region. Success in this role depends on the ability to build sales materials from scratch, establish a robust internal communication plan, distribute materials effectively, and measure the impact of content campaigns.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

. Bachelor's degree
. MBA or Master's degree in relevant field a plus
. 4-6 years of relevant work experience in communications / content management
. Relevant industry experience in a highly technical environment
. Superior writing and editing skills
. Strong graphic design sense and attention to detail

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

. Work ethic based on a strong desire to exceed expectations. Experience working successfully in a very fast-paced, results-oriented environment. Hands-on.
. Experience in generating automated metrics to measure success of communications / content management campaigns.
. Understanding of cloud computing services/deployment architecture.
. Experience with video editing and production
. Familiarity with enterprise productivity tools, such as SharePoint, trouble ticketing systems, etc.

column6: Kubernetes  Scripting  System Design  Python  Continuous Integration  Docker  Integration Testing  Ansible  Java  Linux  Software Development  Currency  Adaptable  Architecture Design  Team Player  Financial Services
column7:
We are
YouTrip is Southeast Asia's 1st and leading multi-currency wallet. As a regional financial technology startup, YouTrip is dedicated to creating the best mobile financial services by simplifying foreign currency payments and offering the best exchange rates. Launched in 2018, YouTrip has been voted the #1 multi-currency account in Singapore with the largest user base in the region following its successful launch in Thailand in partnership with Karsikornbank in 2019.
YouTrip is a Major Payment Institution licensed under the Monetary Authority of Singapore and awarded the Top FinTech Leaders 2020 by the Singapore FinTech Association, and ASEAN's Best Fintech Startup 2019 by the Rice Bowl Startup Awards.
Our culture is entrepreneurial, open & inclusive, and teamwork-oriented. We are looking for talents with the aspiration to thrive in a rapidly growing business in the exciting FinTech space.
You Will
? Create robust yet reliable highly transactional and event-driven application and infrastructure architectures
? Design, create and run automated unit and integration testing for Microservices and supporting systems/infrastructure
? Collaborate with the engineering and infrastructure team to define, design, and maintain our infrastructure and software development
? Ensure our AWS cloud platform is highly scalable, reliable, runs efficiently
? Participate in the architecture design, maintain and administer our development environments with CI/CD tools with Kubernetes and Dockers
You are
? Passionate about technology - regardless of working experience, you have hands-on experience in software development or DevOps engineering. You have a strong interest in working with microservices and AWS cloud technologies.
? Adaptable with a growth mindset - you want to grow and you learn by doing. You always value opportunities to improve. Obstacles and failures only motivate you to move forward.
? A respectful and open team player - you are transparent about your work. You enjoy contributing to the team and you are also open to receiving and giving feedback in a respectful manner. Having experience in technical initiatives and leadership is also a great plus.
? Excited about high-quality work - thoughtful and forward-thinking about system design and programming. You are resilient and you find satisfaction in overcoming challenges and solving puzzles.
What we offer
An innovative culture that encourages talents to work highly collaboratively in a respectful, friendly environment
Multi-cultural co-working space environment in CBD area
Direct report to the Head of Engineering and be part of the growth team of the Singapore business
Access to a deep bench of technical and business experts to work together
Working with an entrepreneurial team of people in Singapore, Thailand and Hong Kong
To apply
If you are interested in this position, please send your resume along with your salary expectation to [HIDDEN TEXT].

column1: SA, Senior Application Developer / Software Engineer, Technology & Operations (210000AF)
column6: Pcf  Git  CSS  HTML  Test Driven Development  Kotlin  Software Engineering  Agile Methodologies  Agile  Javascript  Information Technology  Maven  Continuous Integration  Java  Software Development  Banking
column7:
Business Function
Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels.
Responsibilities
Technical Competency: Contribute towards development activities as an individual or be part of the team for successful project delivery
In-house capability
Maintain high standards of software quality within the team by following good practices and habits while delivering solutions on-time and on-budget.
Learning: Should be able to deliver consistent results and scale on new technologies faster.
Design and build applications using Java, JavaScript, Typescript and related technology.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features.
Build micro-services using SpringBoot, single page application using React and others.
Implement core practice of Agile, leveraging cloud native architecture pattern using Test Driven Development (TDD), continuous integration/continuous delivery, in an on-premise or public-cloud environment, where everything is automated.
Work on bug fixing and improving application performance.
Continuously discover, evaluate, and implement new technologies to maximize development efficiency.
For senior positions, you will lead teams of developers or mentor the team via pair programming and coaching. Instill and engineering culture within the team.
Requirements
A degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Information Technology or related fields
5+ years of proven software development experience. Good experience in design and build micro-services.
Hands on Java multi-threading, distributed architectures.
Experience of Backend frameworks like Spring Boot with Java or Kotlin language.
Experience in front-end development such as HTML, CSS, Javascript (Reactjs,etc), Typescript and any frontend framework
A teamplayer with excellent communication skill, sharp analytical abilities with proven design skills, able to think critically of the current system in terms of growth and stability.
Good to Have
Knowledge of build tools Maven, Gradle and DevOps environment using tools such as Git (Bitbucket), Continuous Integration (Jenkins) and Continuous Deployment (Fastlane). Working with code quality tools such as Sonar, Fortify or NexusIQ will be advantageous.
Strong experience in agile methodologies and test-driven development.
Experiences building microservices with 12 factor app.
Experiences with PaaS e.g. PCF, Openshift, and container technology.
Understand the fundamental design principles behind a scalable application.
Ability to build highly re-usable, performance optimized services.
Codes with security and data protection.
Apply Now
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

As trustee of the nation's retirement savings, the Central Provident Fund (CPF) Board helps 4 million CPF members save for their retirement, healthcare and housing needs. Every CPF Ambassador plays a vital role in helping Singaporeans save for a secure retirement. So long as you have the passion and commitment to serve the public, you will find your niche in our big family.
Information Technology
IT systems form the backbone of our operations. We are looking for individuals with passion and IT expertise, to help us improve the delivery of our systems and services. The Board's IT systems support a high daily volume of financial transactions for CPF members. In addition to keeping the lights on, the Board also keeps pace with the external environment through innovation in its IT systems.
Responsibilities
You will be responsible for addressing the security posture for web applications. You will also be involved in software development lifecycle activities such as analysis, design, development, implementation and maintenance of a variety of mission-critical web applications using Microsoft and cloud technologies.

Identify app security lapses in a system and mitigation methods
Familiar with technologies like SAST, DAST or IAST

Define app security practices for one or multiple systems/applications
Analyse scan results and address possible app security loopholes and threats
Anticipate and prepare for the next evolution of app security testing trends
Develop techniques to ensure development teams find flaws before they are introduced into production

Oversee the security posture of web applications

A challenging and rewarding career where you can contribute to national objectives
A friendly work environment with like-minded colleagues to co-create and collaborate together

Comprehensive rewards package
Annual leave and pro-family leave

Rida is a Singapore-headquartered startup that is transforming e-commerce fulfillment and same-day delivery.
Today, consumers want everything, as of yesterday. But for various reasons, fulfillment and deliveries have not kept pace with changing consumer expectations. Rida's integrated approach to fulfillment and same-day delivery is changing all that.
Our platform helps merchants to simplify their processesfrom fulfillment to delivery. Our batching and routing capabilities lower delivery costs significantly. And a single frontend unifies order management and interactions with multiple e-commerce platforms.

column7:
See yourself at Twilio
Join the team as our next Growth Account Executive, Indonesia!
Who we are & why we're hiring
Twilio powers real-time business communications and data solutions that help companies and developers worldwide build better applications and customer experiences.
Although we're headquartered in San Francisco, we're on a journey to becoming a globally antiracist company that supports diversity, equity & inclusion wherever we do business. We employ thousands of Twilions worldwide, and we're looking for more builders, creators, and visionaries to help fuel our growth momentum.
About the job
Twilio is growing rapidly and seeking a Growth Account Executive (AE) to play a key role in further growing the business. As our new Growth AE you will be responsible for prospecting, solution selling, and closing our Growth accounts (1-100 employees) including some of the most successful startups! This position reports to a Manager - Growth Sales, Rest of Asia
Responsibilities
In this role, you'll:
Be responsible for new customer acquisition and driving new revenue for a specific territory while being assigned a quota for net new ARR and maintaining the highest levels of customer satisfaction
Work with customers across all verticals to understand their business and technical requirements
Understand the capabilities of Twilio's communications API platform so that together you can craft a solution for their specific use case needs
Work diligently with cross-functional teams in Accounting, Finance, Legal, Pricing, and Operations to design mutually beneficial contracts to address customer requirements and balance the needs of our business
Have the ability to balance competing priorities and manage multiple project/deals at the same time. As an added bonus, you've previously sold cloud or B2B enterprise software.
Qualifications
Not all applicants will have skills that match a job description exactly. Twilio values diverse experiences in other industries, and we encourage everyone who meets the required qualifications to apply. While having desired qualifications make for a strong candidate, we encourage applicants with alternative experiences to also apply. If your career is just starting or hasn't followed a traditional path, don't let that stop you from considering Twilio. We are always looking for people who will bring something new to the table!
Required:
2+ years of demonstrated success in being responsible for your own book of business and directly selling a product or service in a technical SaaS/Telco space
An understanding (or interest to understand) of the cloud computing/communications business model. You are passionate about the prospect of selling to a technical audience and have a passion for a solution and value driven approach to selling.
You are able to easily lead complex contractual, technical, and financial details sound simple. You are technically savvy and experience with the cloud, APIs, communications, enterprise software, devices, and mobility is a plus.
Desired:
Experience outbound prospecting into install base, greenfield prospecting into new accounts, and executing strong QBR strategy for territory penetration within Asia.
Location
This role will be based in our Singapore office.
What We Offer
There are many benefits to working at Twilio, including, in addition to competitive pay, things like generous time-off, ample parental and wellness leave, healthcare, a retirement savings program, and much more. Offerings vary by location.
Twilio thinks big. Do you
We like to solve problems, take initiative, pitch in when needed, and are always up for trying new things. That's why we seek out colleagues who embody our values something we call Twilio Magic. Additionally, we empower employees to build positive change in their communities by supporting their volunteering and donation efforts.
So, if you're ready to unleash your full potential, do your best work, and be the best version of yourself, apply now!
If this role isn't what you're looking for, please consider other open positions.
Due to the current health crisis related to COVID-19 and the escalating visa / travel restrictions in effect, we may only be extending offers to individuals who (a) are currently physically resident in Singapore, (b) have a legal right to work in Singapore, or (c) candidates who can start in this location by the expected hire date. We're keeping the situation under review and will adjust our position should the restrictive measures be removed later on. Additionally, Twilio will require evidence of vaccination, medical ineligibility for vaccination or recovery from Covid-19 within the past 180 days, for employees going into the office as employees will not be able to access our offices from 15 January 2022 (unless such employee will complete the vaccination by 31 January 2022) without vaccination. In accordance with applicable law, we may also collect evidence of vaccination as a condition of employment for employees who require work passes as of 1 February 2022.

column1: Partner Portfolio Manager, APJ , Strategic Partner Engagements APJ
column7:
Job Description :
Job summary
AWS is seeking an experienced Portfolio Manager to support the growth of our AWS Partner Strategic Initiatives team. The Portfolio Manager role must drive scale of the initiative across a diverse Partner base, a growing team, and large group of internal stakeholders. The level of ambiguity in the Portfolio Manager role is high, driven by our expanding scope, and pioneering of new business requirements in the areas of business planning, contracting, business approvals, project governance, and reporting. As a result, the Portfolio Manager must have a deep understanding of the business and end user's needs, and proficiently translate those needs into the right solution.

In addition, the Portfolio Manager must be skilled in identifying and leveraging internal/external tools to capture status of ongoing engagements, report on status to key internal/external stakeholders, and enable leadership the ability to easily audit the results of the overall business. As a global initiative with a broad scope, breaking new ground will allow and require the Portfolio Manager to recommend improvements to the way projects/programs are scoped, built, tested and deployed across the organization. The Portfolio Manager will be tasked with defining an operating model and supporting business objectives in order to deliver the best product or process with the most efficient use of resources and technologies. Automation of our key processes will be critical to our ability to scale effectively.

The Portfolio Manager is tasked with influencing key stakeholders across AWS. As new stakeholders join the initiative, the Portfolio Manager may be active in the training and/or development of others. The Portfolio Manager must also be skilled in Earning Trust and understanding the needs and objectives of a variety of roles within the team and the larger organization. The Portfolio Manager establishes and maintains an overall governance of their partner portfolio and can support critical relationships with our internal stakeholders. The Portfolio Manager must bring a department and company-wide perspective to decision making supported by strong business acumen. Given the limited resources it is critical that the Portfolio Manager operates with significant autonomy and discretion. This is especially critical when considering when to escalate critical business issues, as the frequency, and manner of escalation must demonstrate good judgment and appropriate prioritization. The ideal candidate will be comfortable in a fast-paced, multi-tasked, high energy environment. They will be a creative and analytical problem solver with a passion for delivering results.

Key job responsibilities
* Monitor performance of portfolio and provide guidance on path-to-green for underperforming partners
* First-level escalation point for partner-raised and AWS-raised risks and issues
* Build and continuously improve our library of assets and templates in support of all functions across an engagement
* Serves as an authority on project issues to business managers, and other project/program managers
* Perform customer/partner needs and task analysis, scope projects, and evaluate existing processes to support the expansion of virtual operations in multiple global locations
* Can properly prioritize competing projects across departments
* Can make difficult tradeoff decisions and defend those decisions to the different participating teams
* Drives significant communication across departments, to front line and executive level managers

A day in the life
Mentorship & Career Growth:
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we're building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Our senior members enjoy one-on-one mentoring and thorough, but kind, code reviews. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded engineer and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

About the team
Work/Life Balance:
Our team also puts a high value on work-life balance. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here, which is why we aren't focused on how many hours you spend at work or online. Instead, we're happy to offer a flexible schedule so you can have a more productive and well-balanced life-both in and outside of work.
Basic Qualifications :
* 5+ years experience in large-scale operations program or project management
* Experience managing program implementations
* AWS certification or equivalent knowledge of cloud technology business value
Preferred Qualifications :
* Ability to make decisions guided by policies, procedures, and business plan with limited guidance
* Results-oriented, prioritizes work activities, plans and stays organized in order to meet commitments
* Presentation, communication (oral & written), and relationship building skills across all levels of management
* Negotiation and issue resolution capabilities
* Familiarity with office software programs and web-based applications
* Bachelor's degree in engineering or computer science

We are looking for a Solution Architect for our Digital Insight team. As the Solution Architect, you should be able to draw the blueprint of a grand data cathedral, whilst at the same time, understand the engineering for the blueprint to come to pass. You will be the Technical go-to person, the Technology Influencer, the Product Advocate.

Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, or related fields.
Possess a high Data Quotient (DQ)
Creative mind to think out of the box to design both on-premise or cloud data & analytical solutions, eg Data Warehouse, Data Lake, Analytics / ML landscape.
Able to distill and translate customers requirements into a simple yet elegant solution.
Be the trusted advisor to customers and be the voice of the customer within the team.
Have the grit to lead the project team to solve difficult technical challenges; able to roll up your sleeves if necessary.
Worked with Big Data, Apache Hadoop Ecosystem and their integration, eg Cloudera, Map-R, Zookeeper, Spark, Keycloak etc.
Knowledge on On-premise and Cloud data security.
Experience in a cloud provider, eg AWS, Azure, GCP.
Hands on SQL, Data Ingestion, Data Modeling and Data Visualisation.
Excellent cooperation and communication skills; able to work with colleagues and customers from different cultures and countries.

CI/CD, DevOps
ETL - Pentaho, Data Governance - Lumada Data Catalog
SQL / NoSQL - PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Cassandra, Graph Database.
Experience Docker, Kubernetes.
Experience in Machine Learning, MLOps will be added advantage.
Cloud certification desirable not necessary.
We are an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.

Description

Help prioritise requests and workload of team members.
Identify training needs, and trains team members as required on Workday, change control process, overall customer experience and service excellence.
Facilitate development and manages performance of direct reports.
HRIS Operations:
Architect/develop/lead PL Re HR System deliverables.
Work with global HR Business Unit Leaders, HR Systems teams in our parent company Pacific Life, pro-actively optimizes processes, policies and procedures.
Monitor and oversees HRIS inbox items/requests, ensuring resolution of tickets to SLAs, actioning any required changes.
Ensure overall data integrity and accuracy for PL Re, and collaborates with HR team to implement process and procedure improvements.
Act as the bridge between the various PL and PL Re functions and stakeholders in delivering projects and process/system improvements, as well as in developing and executing the technology roadmap.
System Fixes & Enhancements:
Partner with HR and the Business to identify, recommend, implement improvements to both systems and processes.
Manage and update Project/Enhancements Tracker (prioritization, issue definition, status)
Assist HRIS Team in documenting requirements/design specifications, system, data and process flows.
Ensure that system fixes/enhancements align to the PL and PL Re system/change control and audit processes.

Act as Project Manager for key projects and initiatives (includes new functionality, new countries, release changes), involved throughout all project phases analysis, testing, change management, cutover, post-go-live
Ensure projects align with PL Re project management methodology and guidelines.
Lead all Steering Committee meetings and updates to Senior Management and extended HR Team
Budgeting, Planning, and Team Logistics/Tools:
Facilitate and completes PL Re Technology Roadmap, ensuring that current systems are meeting HR goals and aligns with HR strategy.
Complete and monitors PL Re budget for system support and projects.
Set and manage PL Re/PL meeting governance structure: Coordinate and lead PL Re meetings (regional, country specific as applicable) and ensure meeting minutes and actions are documented, communicated, and planned for.
Release Management:
Following Workday's new releases, works with PL team in: assessing impact to PL Re; coordinates and assists in execution of regression and user acceptance testing for PL Re; partners with PL Re stakeholders to manage implementation of changes.
Manage new functionality roll-out by aligning 3-year systems roadmap and HR readiness.

Excellent knowledge / experience of implementing and/or supporting HRIS with strong exposure to HR business processes

column7:
Celestica's Global Supply Chain operates as a unified virtual system with our customers and suppliers by acting as seamless extensions of their operations. We offer customized, flexible and integrated supply chain solutions, supported by a global technology platform and a dedicated, market-focused team.
We are currently seeking an Analyst, Material Pricing to manage material pricing activities within our Capital Equipment segment.
Responsibilities:
Accountable for delivering competitive material pricing solutions to support growth and margins as per company objectives.
Typically manages multiple projects across 10+ support employees per project.
Collaborate with global customer unit, customer, program management, business proposal lead, finance and/or sales to determine material pricing strategy. (Awareness)
Align on trade-offs between proposal cycle-time, solution precision and scope with clients to deliver agreed to pricing strategy. (Awareness)
Project manage supply chain solution with commodity management, costing teams, engineering teams to deliver desired pricing and margin solutions. (Proficient)
Prepares material pricing solutions for new business opportunities (bids) and manage ongoing pricing through the lifecycle of the product (re-pricing) including generation of Bill of Material, cost competitive analysis, margin recommendations. (Proficient)
Provide insight and recommendations to support external (customers or suppliers) negotiations. (Intermediate)
Presents proposed solution to key stakeholders. (Awareness)
Perform take-down trends analysis and modeling to leverage insight in service requests. (Intermediate)
Conduct market research and generate product teardowns to enable competitiveness assessments in service request. (Awareness)
Provide supply chain internal or external consulting / solutioning. (Awareness)
Provide value engineer proposals (Awareness)
Develop annual material margin build-up plan, obtain alignment with key stakeholders and proactively project manager during the year. (Proficient)
Consolidates, tabulates, analyzes and reports on various commitment and performance metrics as per reporting schedule. (Intermediate)
Proactively drive continuous improvement in margin expansion, cycle-time, pricing competitiveness, pricing tactics and process efficiency. (Intermediate)
Requirements:
1 to 3 years of applicable experience
Bachelor's degree in related field (Business or Engineering, I.e. Mechanical engineering for industrial products), or consideration of an equivalent combination of education and experience. Educational requirements may vary.
Costing / pricing experience in the market segment including industry pricing, technology and market trends.
Strong systems skills, including common office platforms such as MS Office and Access. Ability to consolidate, manipulate and analyze large quantities of data.
SCM expertise with an understanding of finance and supply chain.
Technically inclined. Able to read BTP drawings and understand different expects of the BTP requirements.
Good communication, negotiation, presentation, client management and influence skills.
Demonstrated ability to handle multiple tasks while maintaining attention to detail and accuracy and working under tight time deadlines.
Demonstrated ability to evaluate, prioritize and problem solve a variety of tasks to exceed client / customer expectations.
Work Location: Blk 35, Marsiling Industrial Estate Road 3 Woodlands Ave 5 Singapore 739257
-------------------------------------------------------
Celestica is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on any protected status (including race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran or disability status or other characteristics protected by law).
At Celestica we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. Special arrangements can be made for candidates who need it throughout the hiring process. Please indicate your needs and we will work with you to meet them.
COMPANY OVERVIEW:
Celestica (NYSE, TSX: CLS) enables the world's best brands. Through our recognized customer-centric approach, we partner with leading companies in Aerospace and Defense, Communications, Enterprise, HealthTech, Industrial, Capital Equipment and Energy to deliver solutions for their most complex challenges. As a leader in design, manufacturing, hardware platform and supply chain solutions, Celestica brings global expertise and insight at every stage of product development from drawing board to full-scale production and after-market services for products from advanced medical devices, to highly engineered aviation systems, to next-generation hardware platform solutions for the Cloud.
Headquartered in Toronto, with talented teams spanning 40+ locations in 13 countries across the Americas, Europe and Asia, we imagine, develop and deliver a better future with our customers.
Celestica would like to thank all applicants, however, only qualified applicants will be contacted.
Celestica does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruitment agencies or fee based recruitment services.

Job Description :

Dell Technologies is a leader in providing technology infrastructure to its customers in an era increasingly being driven by digital and data. Enabling Dell to satisfy its customers needs hinges on executing a world class supply chain, connecting together sales orders with a complex ecosystem of partners and suppliers. Data plays an integral role in this as we digitize and modernize our supply chain. Join our Data Analytics & Automation team within Supply chain as a Senior/Data Scientist to solve our most challenging business problems with statistical, predictive and prescriptive approaches, making our decision making faster and more sophisticated. We offer a competitive remuneration package.

As part of Dell Technologies Global Operations Data Science team, you will

Advance our supply chain modernization efforts by working closely with other Data, Analytics and Automation professionals and supply chain domain experts to understand complex business problems and co-create digital solutions driven by data science models

See your algorithms and solutions get scaled and deployed, while learning from your mistakes

Join and contribute to a community of data scientists by sharing industry best practices and lessons learnt from past and ongoing projects

Identify opportunities to innovate across the supply chain through team challenges, to collaborations with external industry disruptors

Craft and execute a personalized development plan with your manager to ensure you will continuously grow in your career aspirations, whether it be technical leadership or people leadership


We seek data scientists with a passion to

Deep dive into data to find answers to yet unknown questions and have a natural desire to go beneath the surface of a problem

Ask and answer questions in large datasets and have a strong desire to create strategies and solutions that challenge and expand the thinking of everyone around you

Collaborate in cross functional teams to co-create solutions to business problems, bringing a combination of data science expertise with business acumen to drive pragmatic, business driven value.

Keeping abreast of latest developments in the field and identifies opportunities to apply within our organization

Train/guide data science enthusiasts across the organization

Essential Requirements

Bachelor's / Master's / PhD degree in a relevant field such as Engineering, Statistics, Computer Science, Data analytics or Data Sciences with 5 - 8+ years of experience

Relevant work experience applying data science/machine learning/statistical techniques to quantitative problems in a business environment, demonstrating ability to experiment, develop and deploy solutions into production environments.

Expertise in buildingsupervised/unsupervisedsolutions leveraging but not limited to regression, classification, clustering, time series forecasting & NLP techniques.

Ability to optimize code for performance, scalability and readability.

Strong communication skills with the ability to flex style to suit the audience, ranging from technical to non technical.

Highly desirable skills:

Experience working in distributed computing environments like Spark (PySpark and/or SparkR).

Hands on experience with docker and other relevant CICD tools desirable but not required.

Our team's way of working

We are uncovering ways to impact every key decision in Dell's supply chain with a data science solution.

We use our curiosity to find latent opportunities by experimenting together.

We work in an agile methodology and have the autonomy to suggest and work on optimal approaches.

We target decisions that achieve our company objectives. Our solutions address important prevailing business problems and we continuously keep this in mind while progressing through our projects.

We excel when we collaborate. Data scientists are encouraged to seek feedback from others and have open discussions while progressing through the data science lifecycle.

Here's our story now tell us yours
Dell Technologies helps organizations and individuals build a brighter digital tomorrow. Our company is made up of more than 150,000 people, located in over 180 locations around the world. We're proud to be a diverse and inclusive team and have an endless passion for our mission to drive human progress.

What's most important to us is that you are respected, feel like you can be yourself and have the opportunity to do the best work of your life -- while still having a life. We offer excellent benefits, bonus programs, flexible work arrangements, a variety of career development opportunities, employee resource groups, and much more.

We started with computers, but we didn't stop there. We are helping customers move into the future with multi-cloud, AI and machine learning through the most innovative technology and services portfolio for the data era. Join us and become a part of what's next in technology, starting today.

You can also learn more about us by reading our latest Diversity and Inclusion Report and our plan to make the world a better place by 2030 .

Dell is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Dell are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Dell will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Dell encourages applicants of all ages. Read the full Equal Employment Opportunity Policy .

column6: Application Architecture  Scalability  Azure  Cloud Computing  Enterprise Architecture  Infrastructure Architecture  Togaf  Saas  Orchestration  Virtualization  Pipelines  Architect  Architectural  technology solutions  Strategy  Project Management
column7:
We are looking for a passionate and professional Cloud Architect to join our Technology Architecture & Policy team to develop Singapore Pools Cloud vision, strategy and architecture.
Based in our Head Office in Middle Road and reporting to Deputy Director, Enterprise Architecture & Insights Platform, the incumbent will be ensuring that the architecture meets SPPL business and enterprise technology strategy and architecture requirements. This role covers architecture aspects of Cloud including network, systems and application services, compute strategies and virtualization strategies.
We also recognize that each individual has a unique blend of skills. Whether your strength is in project management or solutioning, we want to talk to you.
What You'll Do
You will define Cloud Architecture vision and strategy for domains such as infrastructure architecture, application architecture, Realtime and Batch processing.
You will develop solutions architecture and evaluate architectural alternatives for private, public and hybrid cloud models, including IaaS, PaaS, and other cloud services
You will partner with key stakeholders and proactively consult to projects regarding Cloud Architecture concerns and direction including the deployment of cloud services, automation and continuous delivery pipelines
You will utilize or develop reference architectures that fit within the overall architectural blueprint for Cloud Architecture.
You will participate in Architecture Reviews as required to promote alignment to Cloud Architecture requirements.
You will establish best practices for cloud across the company
You will lead analysis of complex production support issues that are related to Cloud Architecture.
You will assess new technologies and develop solutions appropriate to business requirements for Cloud Architecture, and that leverage architecture standards.
You will actively support scalability, skills transfer and organizational change management by ensuring Cloud Architecture members are rotated to promote cross-training and professional development.
Who You Are
You like to have a Degree Computer Science / Engineering, Information Science / Related IT Discipline
You are certified in AWS Cloud Solution Architect, Azure Solution Architect, TOGAF
You have a minimum 10 years of experience in multiple IT disciplines, including 5 years in building a cloud infrastructure and architecture discipline in a large enterprise and 2+ years in architecting & integrating PaaS, IaaS SaaS, DaaS for the enterprise
You demonstrate knowledge of cloud architecture and implementation features (OS, multi-tenancy, virtualization, orchestration, elastic scalability)
You demonstrate knowledge of DevOps tool chains and processes
You demonstrate knowledge of Security on Cloud
You have a proven track record of translating organizational strategy into actionable cloud technology solutions that drive operational excellence while enabling synergistic growth and organizational scale
You have a strong understanding of design for cloud computing, network and storage to meet business application system qualities
You have excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to work effectively with diverse teams within and outside of IT
Benefits
Competitive salaries
Flexi Benefits
Staggered working hours
Medical Insurance
Learning & Development Opportunities
Singapore Pools welcomes you not for how you look, where you come from, or differences you may have. We want you here for who you are. Diversity at the company helps us see a greater picture represented by different voices, helping us in contributing back to the society. So, feel free to express who you are, and be proud of your heritage and personal experience as you begin your journey with us!
Singapore Pools was established by the Government on 23 May 1968 to provide safe and trusted betting to counter illegal gambling. As a not-for-profit organisation, all of Singapore Pools surplus is channeled to Tote Board to fund a wide range of causes in social service, community development, sports, the arts, education and health. Currently, Singapore Pools contributes about $2 billion annually to the Government in the form of taxes and duties, and for the funding of good causes.

Job Title: Designer Structural, Senior Designer
Structural
Working Title: Designer Structural, Senior
Designer Structural
Reports to: Lead Engineer Structural, AE Business Unit Leader
Supervises: N/A
Job Code: SE110, SE110/G00
FLSA: Non-Exempt
Revised 12/201G
Scope of Position
Performs design, detailing, and analysis under the supervision of licensed professional.
Job Responsibilities
1. Application of Knowledge of Building Systems:
a. Effectively applies discipline design and detailing fundamentals in developing designs under the supervision of, and subject to, final approval by the Licensed Professional.
b. Participates in the development of group and corporate standards committees.
2. Design
a. Produces well organized construction documents of good appearance, accuracy, clarity and correctness, adhering to team and discipline standards.
b. When assigned design-related activities, prepares presentation drawings, and other deliverables as required by theLicensed Professional.
c. Maintains orderly work file, prepares clear well-written memos/correspondence.
d. Participates in design reviews with the design team at 30% and 100% on all assigned projects.
Sr. Designer additional responsibilities
e. Assists with drawing planning, production, management and adherence to schedule.
f. Performs analysis or calculations as required.
g. Coordinates work with other disciplines related to dimensions and interferences to minimize deficiencies, errors and omissions.
h. Assists the Licensed Professional with production of specifications.
3. Construction Support
a. Responds to all RFI's and reviews submittals for compliance in a timely manner.
b. Responds promptly when dealing with field requests/issues.
Sr. Designer additional responsibilities
c. Performs site visits and prepares observation/follow-up phase reports documenting progress and deficiencies.
d. Prepares field orders; addenda and record drawings.
4. Project Management
a. Attends project meetings as requested.
b. Adheres to established company standards and policies.
Sr. Designer additional responsibilities
c. Makes presentations to internal and external customers.
5. Planning, Scheduling and Profitability
a. Works independently on a variety of projects - from simple to complex, small to large.
b. Provides required information in a timely manner, keeping his/her supervisor apprised as to the progress of the work.
c. Produces well organized construction documents of good appearance, accuracy, clarity and correctness, adhering to team and discipline standards.
Sr. Designer additional responsibilities
d. Monitors projects for scope creep and report changes to the Structural Engineer of Record.
G. Professional Development
a. Attends seminars and conferences as necessary to maintain professional competency.
b. Provides training to staff from base knowledge and seminars/conference attended.
Sr. Designer additional responsibilities
c. Keeps apprised of new technologies and assists in their incorporation into the A/E practice.
7. Leadership
a. Mentors Technicians/Senior Technicians.
Sr. Designer additional responsibilities
b. Mentors Designers.
Education/Experience
High school degree (technical/associates degree preferred) with experience in applicable design work.
Specific Knowledge, Skills, License, Certifications Etc.
1. Building System Knowledge:
a. Knowledge of various building/construction types/complexities.
b. Understanding of structural design process from concepts through construction.
c. Ability to quickly develop structural documentation.
Sr. Designer additional knowledge/skills
c. Understanding of standard details/specs.
d. Ability to perform thorough interdisciplinary coordination.
2. Good written and verbal communication skills.
3. Computer Skills
a. Ability to access project information remotely when working outside the office using VPN and/or Citrix.
b. Proficiency with Microsoft Office programs: Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook.
c. Ability to utilize Newforma Programs: Newforma Project Center, Newforma Cloud, Project Teams, Capture,Tasks, and Plans.
d. AutoCAD and Revit or other 3D modeling software proficiency.
Sr. Designer additional knowledge/skills
e. Higher level of AutoCAD and Revit or other 3D modeling software proficiency including an ability to assist in the development of productivity tools and templates.
Core Competencies
1. Accountability: Accepting responsibility that results in anticipation/prevention of problem areas from actions, and problem solving inside and outside the department/organization.
2. Customer Focus: Makes service to internal and external customers a priority; focuses on exceeding customer expectations,not just meeting them; recognizes and values all key stakeholders; applies and develops service excellence skills.
3. Effective Communication: Listens for understanding and appreciation, encourages open feedback; presents clearly and effectively one on one, and in small and large group settings; considers the audience in preparing messages and in choosing theappropriate communication channels; creates and encourages open channels of communication.
4. Execution/Empowerment: Demonstrates the ability to get results; manages competing demands in fast paced environmentwith effective results; identifies and creates contingency solutions to ensure timely execution.
5. Learning & Development: Learning new skills and increasing capabilities a high priority; takes action to address developmentneeds in self and others, if applicable; identifies gaps and learning opportunities to ensure complete technical job proficiency; takes responsibility for own development and skills improvement.
Values
1. Team: Collaborate and demonstrate respect for team members, partners and everyone with whom we do business; opencommunication.
2. Excellence: Strive for quality and safety; executed best in class; creative and innovative; dedicated for continuousimprovement.
3. Service: Passionate about customer service internal and external and to the community; and creates superior value.
4. Trust: High standards of ethics and personal accountability; transparency; credibility; fairness
Environmental Factors and/or Physical Requirements
While performing the duties of this job, this position is required to have ordinary ambulatory skills sufficient to visit other locations; and the ability to stand, walk, stoop, kneel, crouch, and manipulate (life, carry, move) light to medium weights of 10-50 pounds. Requires good hand-eye coordination, arm, hand and finger dexterity, including ability to grasp, and visual acuity to use a keyboard, operateequipment and read application/form information. The associate frequently is required to sit, reach with hands and arms, talk and hear.
