DESCRIPTION

Job summary
Amazon's Legal Department is looking for a talented technology lawyer in Singapore to fill the position of Senior Corporate Counsel to support Amazon Web Services (AWS), a dynamic and rapidly growing business within Amazon.com. AWS is at the forefront of the cloud computing and service industry, providing IT services such as on-demand compute capacity, storage, content delivery, databases, IOT, AI/ML services, and more.

This Senior Corporate Counsel will lead the legal team that supports AWS's Commercial Sales, Marketing and Business Development activities across South-East Asia. This Senior Corporate Counsel will negotiate enterprise and technology licensing agreements and other high value agreements with customers and partners ranging from startups to large multinationals. This Senior Corporate Counsel will also advise on marketing and business development initiatives, global expansion, regulatory issues, pre-litigation legal disputes and inquiries, and other matters that arise for AWS's business in South-East Asia.

In this role, you will have primary drafting and negotiation responsibilities on deals, and provide day-to-day advice for senior executives and other leaders. The successful candidate will be proactive, entrepreneurial, enjoy being challenged, have strong written and oral communication skills, and demonstrate sound, pragmatic judgment in ambiguous situations. Compensation will be based on experience and includes equity compensation.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

. Law degree (LLB, JD or equivalent) from a leading law school.
. Qualified to practice law in Singapore, Australia, US, UK or other common law jurisdiction.
. 10+ years of legal experience.
. Strong transactional experience.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

. Experience at a leading law firm.
. Experience at a technology company.
. Familiar with IT infrastructure, outsourcing, telecommunications or cloud computing contracts.
. Familiar with privacy and data protection laws.
. Management experience.

column1: Partner Development Manager, SAP APJ Leader
column7:
DESCRIPTION

Job summary
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is leading the next paradigm shift in computing and is looking for an experienced Partner Development Manager (PDM) to lead one of our strategic Global System Integrators (GSI). As a PDM within AWS, you will have the exciting opportunity to deliver on our strategy to build mind share and adoption of the AWS cloud computing platform with one of our largest partners.

Responsibilities include: development and execution of SAP partner strategy owning the executive relationships with key partners, creating pipeline, driving sales execution, empowering large cloud practices and much more.

By establishing and growing business and technical relationships, along with managing the day-to-day interactions, you will be responsible for driving our SAP top line revenue growth and overall market adoption.

The ideal candidate will possess SAP business/channel sales background that enables them to engage at the MD/ VP/ CEO level, as well as a sales background that enables them to grow pipeline. The ideal candidate will also have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, products and technical challenges, with the ability to build and convey compelling value propositions.

Roles & Responsibilities:
. Experience working with enterprise large partners to develop and execute a partnering strategy, training, and joint sales and Go to Market (GTM) programs for our SAP business.
.
. Engage the partner field sales organization, channels and end customers to create and drive revenue opportunities for both parties.
.
. Define a strategic SAP Partner Plan and ensure it's in line with the AWS strategic direction. This includes developing establishing a process to track the progress toward goals.
.
. Set and manage revenue targets and work with the partners and AWS sales organizations to achieve/exceed goals.
.
. Identify specific customer segments and industry verticals to approach with a joint value proposition for using SAP on AWS.
.
. Experience with CRM systems, data warehousing and other analytic tools to establish detailed metrics for tracking purposes.
.
. Deliver strategic business reviews to the senior leadership team.
.
. Manage complex contract negotiations involving legal, marketing and business terms.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

. 10+ years of sales and/or partner development experience in the software/technology industry.
. Demonstrated ability to engage and influence C-level executives
. Influence and manage internal & external stakeholders to work together for a common goal
. Consistently exceeds quota and key performance metrics, with hands on experience negotiating enterprise contracts
. Strong language (English) public speaking and writing skills and the ability to articulate complex concepts to cross functional audiences
. Strong SAP technical and/or business solutions acumen, with a demonstrated track record of driving emerging/ disruptive technologies
. Ability to think and work creatively to develop unique joint value propositions and product strategy within AWS and in the partner's organization
. Ability to think big, be bold, set clear multi-year partnership direction

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

. Prior experience in large scale, enterprise sales, partner/channel sales and/or business development roles
. Prior experience working with/for GSIs in customer facing roles
. Understands software technologies, including SaaS and Cloud
. Experience using Salesforce.com, Excel, Tableau and other data & analytics business tool
. Post Graduate IT or MBA degrees
. AWS Certified
Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

Job Category
Customer Success GroupJob Details

The CSG Account Partner (AP) Director for Success Cloud Sales is a proven, passionate, strategic sales leader.The AP is responsible for selling the full portfolio of Success Cloud offerings to designated accounts. The AP must be a strategic thinker with exceptional enterprise, commercial, and cross-functional skills, demonstrate high energy, and have strong sales management experience. The AP is responsible for earning the right to be a trusted advisor to the customer, with the primary goal of helping customers generate significant business value from their Salesforce investment. This individual will be expected to understand and manage our customers throughout their lifecycle, driving adoption through sales activity for new and existing customers this will include pipeline generation and delivering sales presentations to C-level clients. The primary measurement of success for this role will be YOY growth in overall services bookings and revenue.
Responsibilities:
Exceed CSG Success Cloud growth and bookings, ensure organizational health and customer satisfaction goals as a regional leader
Utilize industry expertise and business acumen to understand a customer's motivation, business drivers, strategic goals and objectives, and desired business outcomes
Engage customers, especially C-Level,using a consultative selling approach that positions Salesforce and yourself as a long-term trusted advisor relationship
Create a compelling vision and clearly communicate our transformative solutions with the goal of generating significant success and business value from a customer's investment in the Salesforce Platform
Develop and manage a territory plan and a personalized account plan for each customer, which aligns with their business goals. Forecast accurately and timely, build a pipeline and progress opportunities to deliver Success Cloud YOY revenue growth
Form a strong relationship with the License Sales organization and regional Alliances/Partner organizations that are instrumental to success
Be a recognized role model for collaboration, leadership and overall business results

As an Account Partner Director,you:
are internally and externally recognized as business contributor, industry or product specialist.
have high level of knowledge of emerging business / industry trends, competitive direction and product direction.
determine the best customer success approach based on general direction from senior management.
work on complex business issue and initiatives that require business or industry knowledge.
act as an advisor on complex issues and initiatives, exercising discretion and latitude in reaching their goals. Leads cross functional teams and mentors others.

Preferred Qualifications & Skills:
10+ years of consultative sales experience with a proven record of consistently exceeding quota
Of which, 5+ years experience selling and/or delivering professional services for a strategic consulting firm or large scale system integrator
BA/BS or equivalent MBA is a plus
Demonstrated ability to develop and maintain C-level relationships where you are recognized as a trusted advisor
Experience growing accounts with large and complex pursuits ($M+)
Highly collaborative and excels in a complex, matrixed environment
Team player with strong interpersonal skills
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, unpredictable environment
Strong relationships within the Singapore market
Local language skills would be an advantage

Leadership Qualities:
PASSION: Passionate about Customer Success
BEGINNERS MIND: Always learning, approaches each interaction with open mind, great listener and hands-on
THOUGHT LEADER: Strong point of view and executive presence. Confident, but not arrogant, great storyteller
URGENCY: Ability to move fast and drive business value and results
OHANA: Embodies Aloha culture: A team player that everyone enjoys working with and has a generous heart
TRUST: Trust the company's core values
ADAPTABLE: Excels in high levels of uncertainty and change

About Salesforce:
Salesforce, the Customer Success Platform and world's #1 CRM, empowers companies to connect with their customers in a whole new way. The company was founded on three disruptive ideas: a new technology model in cloud computing, a pay-as-you-go business model, and a new integrated corporate philanthropy model. These founding principles have taken our company to great heights, including being named one of Forbes's World's Most Innovative Company five years in a row and one of Fortune's 100 Best Companies to Work For eight years in a row. We are the fastest growing of the top 10 enterprise software companies, and this level of growth equals incredible opportunities to grow a career at Salesforce. Together, with our whole Ohana (Hawaiian for family) made up of our employees, customers, partners and communities, we are working to improve the state of the world.Accommodations

If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this .Posting Statement

At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits.
and are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. and do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. and will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with or .
Salesforce welcomes all.

column2: Singapore University Of Technology And Design
column6: Cloud Computing  Software Engineering  Python  Data Science  Web Development  urban redevelopment  Written English  Urban Design  Urban Planning  computational design  characterization  Statistics  Publications  evidence  Sustainable Design  Laboratory
column7:
Post-doctoral Research Fellow : Computational Urban Design
contact: [HIDDEN TEXT]
Singapore University of Technology and Design, Assistant Professor Peter Ortner (Architecture and Sustainable Design) and his research lab are seeking a Post-doctoral Research Fellow (RF).
The position will support research on next-generation optimization of urban design and planning including web-based tools. Research is in direct collaboration with Singapore's Urban Redevelopment Authority (URA) as well as SUTD's Information Systems Technology and Design Pillar. Expected start date is 15 May 2022.
The successful candidate will have a background in computational design and urban planning, design, or architecture, with a doctoral degree and research experience demonstrated through scholarly publication. The candidate must evidence strong spoken and written English skills.
This is a multi-year position, with a minimum hire period of one year. Candidates will have the opportunity to co-publish with the research team and work closely with URA colleagues on innovative technologies for urban design and planning.
Research Fellow Duties & Responsibilities
Coordinate development of urban design software tools and their deployment to web platform.
Co-lead drafting of scientific papers, including reviewing work of junior colleagues.
Develop and evaluate design space exploration (DSE) tools using Python or Javascript.
Develop surveys and workshops for users of computational design tools.
Research Fellow Requirements & Skills
Doctoral degree or equivalent in urban planning, urban design, architecture, or software engineering/ computer science.
Demonstrated history of contribution to scientific publications.
Demonstrated excellence in computational design.
Experience with data science, computational statistics, and/or urban analytics.
Knowledge of Python and/or Javascript.
Experience or keen interest in web development and cloud computing.
Strong spoken and written English skills required.

column2: Oracle Capac Services Unlimited Company (singapore Branch)
column6: Solutioning  Solution Selling  Solution Architecture  ANSYS  Customer Relationship  Converge  Autodesk Maya  Selling  Public Speaking  ABAQUS  high performance computing  Presentation Skills  Benchmarking  Business Development  motions
column7:
OCI offers an industry best ecosystem to deploy HPC applications to achieve superior performance. The HPC business is a very strategic focus area for Oracle and to drive market success of this offering, we are investing in building a team of highly talented technical business development professionals in Asia Pacific.
The Role
The role advertised is an individual contributor position focussed on building a strong community awareness and customer momentum of OCI HPC solutions across APAC.
We are hiring talented individuals having a passion for promoting HPC to the community and customers. The ideal candidate should be good at facilitating cloud strategy discussions, working with ISVs across various domains to build GTM motions, creating attention with blogs or other social media, and authoring whitepapers.
And should have strong solution selling and technical experience of HPC applications in any of the industry spaces like automotive, manufacturing, Healthcare, Earth sciences, AL/ML.
Requirements of the Role
Proven business development expertise on selling the value (business & technical) of HPC solutions and Cloud Platform (preferable) with prior experience in presales or as an implementation specialist.
Good experience in building business with a broad range of HPC applications like Ansys Fluent, Mechanical Icepack, LS Dyna, Powertherm, Powerflow, Altair Nano FluidX, Abaqus, Star CCM, Converge, Gromacs, Autodesk, Maya, Moe, etc., and in one or more domain like Automotive, Manufacturing, life science, financial services, material sciences, earth sciences etc.)
Experience in creating joint GTM solutions with ISVs/ Partners ( Altair, Ansys, Dassault, Autodesk, MSc etc. )
Good understanding of the competitive landscape (on-premises HCI solutions, hyperscale cloud vendor solutions to overcome customer objections on moving HPC workloads to OCI
Highly respected HPC expert in the market with proven track record of using social media to promote HPC
Experience in public speaking, authoring blogs promoting HPC.
Strong ability to work with teams Work Crosslines of business within Oracle to develop TCO analysis and OCI based solution blueprints to deploy/migrate customers HPC workloads to Oracle cloud supporting the strategic business needs of the customer.
Responsibilities of the Role
Business Development and Sales/Opportunity Support
Help defining the overall GTM strategy for HPC in APAC
Apply in-depth HPC expertise to collaborate with customer key stakeholders
Build and maintain an ecosystem of ISVs , partners and drive the GTM motion
Demonstrate a combination of deep technical expertise and business development skills.
Create technical articles or customer stories to articulate OCI HPC differentiators/ value proposition, and share them in blogs or other social media. Present on conferences, public speaking events , HPC community forums promoting OCI HPC
Work with customers on the cloud economics business case to migrate /burst to OCI for HPC workloads.
Work extensively across APAC with the regional field teams and customers on OCI HPC value positioning, discovery & workload qualification, POC scoping, architecture planning, OCI Bill of Material preparation, customer objection handling etc. to maximize win rate.
Work with the regional teams and HQ Product Management team to provide inputs for building repeatable assets such as Customer facing POVs, high impact use cases, POC checklists, reference architectures etc.
Work with local presales teams in pre & post sales stages like Solutioning, RFx responses, Solution Architecture approach and other required support.
Scale the business by leveraging best practices & repeatable assets supporting the effectiveness of the GTM of High Performance Computing in APAC.
Build and track customer wins & references
Candidate Experience and Profile
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related field with excellent computing knowledge
Strong passion to articulate and evangelize OCI HPC value proposition in communities, with very strong communication skills
Strong business development expertise with a background working in presales, architecture or consulting role on HPC solutions
Extensive experience in solution selling/ architecture and or deploying various HPC applications . Proven and demonstrable product knowledge of various HPC ISV solutions
Desirable to have benchmarking and performance tunings skills of HPC applications
Exposure to Oracle Cloud Platform and/or cloud offerings from other vendors such as AWS, Azure, IBM Softlayer or Google
Strong internal and customer relationship building & presentation skills
Self-motivated team player with ability to work as an independent contributor but also as a team player in a matrixed organization
Innovation starts with inclusion at Oracle. We are committed to creating a workplace where all kinds of people can be themselves and do their best work. It's when everyone's voice is heard and valued, that we are inspired to go beyond what's been done before. That's why we need people with diverse backgrounds, beliefs, and abilities to help us create the future, and are proud to be an affirmative-action equal opportunity employer.

column6: Api Development  Scalability  Azure  Google Cloud Platform  Software Engineering  Agile  Api  Software Development  Service Delivery  Strategic Planning  Leadership  Program Management  Product Management  Team Building  Teamwork Skills  Facilitation
column7:
This role is for the Digital Technologies department of Singtel. Digital Technologies is front-runner within Singtel featuring self-organizing development teams deploying workloads both on-premise and cloud services such as AWS, Azure, and Google Cloud Platform.
Our Digital Technology stack focuses on scalability and performance of business workloads. We aim to loosen the IT architecture, increase organizational agility and enable an API driven digital ecosystem.
Key Responsibilities
You are responsible for articulating the API strategy and execution for API platform
You will work closely with various internal stakeholders team to develop API roadmap and manage all aspects related activities
You are responsible for development of API platform roadmap which include features which are part of API development and standards across company.
You will be able to manage platform costs within approved timeframe and budget
You will be able to help to resolve issue and mitigate risks, escalating issues when appropriate to leadership.
You will be able to collect data tied to project deliverables and collating into comprehensive presentations for executive leadership team.
You will be able to jump into workstreams already underway to help ensure on-time delivery of projects.
Establish and track appropriate agile metrics for the API program (i.e. capacity, velocity, burndown charts)
You mustbe able to work across vertical processes, making connections to drive results and collaboration.
Serve as the integration point between the Digital Technology's API delivery team, API Core Engineering team and any consuming internal or external customers to ensure successful delivery of API solutions through multiple delivery channels
Ensure alignment of API requirements design and delivery across all solutions based on industry's best practices and standards
Manage stakeholder communication with business and technology senior management
Drive roadmaps and overall design and delivery alignment
Ensure delivery is timely and of high standards
Drive adoption of common delivery framework across various technology teams
Ensure increase of delivery efficiency through each sprint
Able to identify and secure resources and support from senior leaders across the company Intellectual curiosity, data/fact driven, and ability to connect dots across the enterprise
The ideal candidate should possess:
BSc in Computer Science or similar technical
Minimum 10 years of experience in technical program management including planning, estimating, dependency mapping, and status reporting
Strong technical background in digital technologies with an extensive knowledge of all aspects of the software development lifecycle (able to code)
Enjoys working in a fast-paced work environment and overcoming technical and business challenges comfortable pivoting focus quickly
Previous client facing project, product management and/or implementation experience in API Delivery is desired.
Some experience in strategic planning and execution in a matrix organization.
Skills in meeting objectives through influence, inspiration, facilitation and team building or business degree in Computer Science or Software Engineering.
Excellent teamwork skills preferably with experience of working in teams spread across boundaries.
We are committed to a safe and healthy environment for our employees & customers and will require all prospective employees to be fully vaccinated.

column6: Quality Assurance  Agile  SAP  Networking  Test Design  Partner Management  Test Strategy  Software Development  Management Skills  Administration  Channel  Product Management  Accountability  Presentation Skills  Team Player  customer communication
column7:
SUMMARY
The SAP Procurement Product Team drives innovation and thought leadership across the source to pay processes. This benefits buyers and suppliers by enabling companies to sell physical, digital, and subscription-based goods as a service and by monetizing subscriptions and real-time usage-based services. SAP S/4HANA is the single source of information for customers on their digital journey: planning, execution and analysis, prediction to simulation, all in real-time within one system, integrated with SAP C/4HANA, SAP Ariba, and Fieldglass.As we develop the next generation of integrated spend management cloud solutions, the SAP S/4HANA Procurement Engineering unit seeks to be a frontrunner in cloud and agile mindset to software development. Openness, honesty, supportiveness, respect, fairness, accountability, empathy, and trust are ingrained in our team spirit and key to our success.
The person is expected to work in a team of colleagues with the goal to boost the successful adoption of our Procurement products. The chosen candidate will be responsible to identify the most important product capabilities from both customer and strategic perspective and will bring these topics into the product as part of the regular 4-quarter planning with the Product Management team. At the same time the person in this role will be responsible to create a sustainable and reliable communication channel towards our customer success and partner management organization as well as towards partners and customers directly to ensure partners and customers are well informed about our strategic direction, product news and opportunities to collaborate (such as Customer Engagement Initiatives, Partner Events.
In this role the person will closely collaborate with the team members who are working in the roles of Product Experts, Communication & Strategic Customer Management as well as with the respective Product Management teams. This role combines a strong strategic understanding of our SAP Procurement product portfolio with a deep understanding of the customer's situation and point of view and excellent planning and communication skills. The person working in this role will be working as a multiplier and enabler making SAP Procurement products better understood and easier to consume for our customers. The person works also closely together with the global market units to identify region specific requirements to streamline communication and input for prioritization towards the product management team.
ROLE
In this role you will
Close collaboration with Customer Success, Partner Management, Partners and Strategic Customers
Enable customer-facing team to consult customers on our prouct directions & plans
Actively support adoption & successful utilization of our products in the market
Ensure excellent content for customer communication collaterals
EXPECTATIONS AND TASKS
Analyzes, defines, implements and executes quality and test related activities according to a given quality- and test strategy for the product area.
Creates a detailed test design incl. test system landscape requirements and product standards, prepares tests (customizing & master data), authors and executes manual and/or automated tests.
Analyzes test results (issues) and takes appropriate follow-up actions.
Is subject matter expert in the team in terms of quality assurance and test related processes, methods and tools.
Has basic product domain knowledge including relevant business processes & scenarios and a basic understanding of customer needs.
Active participation in Scrum meetings and demos.
Has proficient knowledge about relevant product and process standards, important legal requirements as well as quality assurance and test related tools.
Has basic knowledge and technical competencies of relevant programming languages and related development tools and processes
ROLE REQUIREMENTS
Procurement: Supplier risk, Supplier Management or Central Invoice Management
A Post Graduate Degree in Business Administration or similar
Excellent presentation, communication and networking skills, ideally combined with a strong sense for influencing and messaging
Strong and proven expectation management skills
Strategic analytical thinking and decision-making skills
Entrepreneurial and can-do attitude, capable of continuously adapting to changes and adjusting focus in a fast-moving changing environment
A strong motivator, mindful & inclusive team player with a humble and positive mindset
Excellent written, verbal, communication and presentation skills in English
7+ years of work experience including a proven track record of customer-facing experience with proven understanding of implementation support
Experience in working with customer-facing groups and customers
Strong enablement and multiplier skills
Excellent understanding of SAP's Procurement product strategy and product portfolio

DESCRIPTION

Amazon is looking for a results-oriented individual to lead our APAC Renewable Energy strategy and grow our investments into Renewable Energy assets across the region. In this role, you will be responsible for deploying innovative solutions to unlock new renewable energy opportunities, negotiating and executing power supply contracts to deliver low-cost renewable energy supply to AWS data centers, powering our operations with 100% renewable energy by 2025. The candidate will need to be able to identify key market conditions, regulations, and market structures to develop and deliver on a comprehensive energy procurement and policy strategy across APAC. The optimal candidate will have a results orientated approach, analytical skill set, strong financial acumen, an extensive network with developers, IPPs, utilities, funds, financiers, and regulators across the energy industry value chain and a strong track record of Renewable Energy transactions in APAC.

. Lead investment activities into Renewable Energy assets through market transaction origination, structuring, project and financial diligence.
. Develop and execute a comprehensive power procurement and renewable energy strategy for AWS data centers. Work collaboratively with other AWS teams to support the development of strategic energy sourcing opportunities.
. Analyze trends and regulations in the energy space to proactively identify opportunities that benefit Amazon.
. Work with utility regulators to develop policies and guidelines that enable broader AWS strategies and objectives.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

. At least 15+ years of experience working in energy/infrastructure/finance industry
. A proven experience in structured energy transactions and complex contract negotiations
. Deep understanding of the links between PPAs, investment models and project finance documentation
. Deep experience in APAC power markets
. Proven track record for cultivating and maintaining strong relationships with stakeholders, senior executives and stakeholders in high-impact situations
. Strong written and communication skills
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

. Master's Degree (MBA/MS) preferred
. Strong background in finance, investment in utility scale renewable projects, energy innovations projects and infrastructure development.
. Experience working with public utility commissions and other energy regulators
. Experience with IT infrastructure, data centers and cloud services
. Prior experience working with market operators and regulators globally
. Ability to converse in Japanese, Korean is advantageous

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

column6: Git  Cloud Applications  Web Services  Kubernetes  AWS  Agile  Scripting  Python  Continuous Integration  Automation  Java  Orchestration  Shell  Software Development  Technical Operations  Investments  Securities  Financial Markets  Hedge Funds  Technology
column7:
Who are we
Here at ADDX, we believe in a future where everybody can access financial ecosystems easily, fairly, and safely. That is why we've built the world's first fully regulated platform for digital securities, licensed by the Monetary Authority of Singapore.
In 2021, we raised USD 50 million in Series A funding led by Japan Investment Corporation and Development Bank of Japan. Among other esteemed investors, we are backed by Singapore Exchange and Heliconia, a subsidiary of Temasek.
We have gone through a total re-brand and promise this to be an exciting time. An integral part of a fast-growing team enabling investments in unicorns, pre-IPO companies, and hedge funds, your role is to innovate and discover new solutions.
If you believe in a future of fair financial markets, just like we do, we've been waiting for you at ADDX.
Who are we looking for
We are looking for a DevOps Engineer to join our Technology Team. You will work alongside the DevOps team to automate and integrate the different components of AWS services.
Responsibilities
Design, build and implement automation frameworks for the deployment, management, and monitoring of software applications and features using Infrastructure as Code
Perform continuous integration and continuous deployment to optimize operational environments by expanding monitoring capabilities and managing technical operations
Troubleshoot existing infrastructure stack to identify errors and develop solutions to reduce the risk of failure
Develop Proof-of-Concepts for new ideas as part of the continuous improvement efforts to introduce technical best practices to the CI/CD pipeline
Infrastructure provisioning for AWS using Terraform
Requirements
Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in DevOps
Automation and scripting skills with Shell, Python, etc.
Working knowledge of AWS Cloud Services and their capabilities
Familiarity with Terraform
Experience with container hosting and orchestration services
Deep understanding of Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (Amazon EKS)
Certification from AWS and container management (Kubernetes) would be a plus
Why you will love working here
Meaningful work you will be able to contribute to ongoing projects and experience what it is like as a full-time employee with us.
Fun and collaborative culture we have open-door meetings that anyone can join, and other groups that hang out outside of work (e.g. our jogging club, pet-friendly)
Access to Cofounders and C-suite our lean and agile culture allows for easier access to C-suite executives who are friendly and always open for a chat
Flexible working arrangements work from home or work from office! (centrally located in Aperia mall)
Interested applicants can apply via ADDX - DevOps Engineer (lever.co)
Due to our limited capacity, we regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

column2: Amazon Web Services Singapore Private Limited

column7:
Job summary
AWS is where innovation, risks, and ideas are celebrated. We are builders, we try new things, and imagine big dreams. It is still Day 1 for us, and we are looking for curious and passionate people to be part of our diverse teams of thinkers, testers, and doers. Come join us and work with the latest cloud technologies that enable our customers to adopt cloud-based solutions. At AWS, we refer to ourselves as builders. We are looking for more builders to join our growing and diverse teams within the Cloud Sales Center (CSC). AWS is committed to be the most customer obsessed organization on the planet.
ABOUT THE TEAM
This role is within the ASEAN CSC team. The CSC is the Inside Sales organization of AWS and is focused on new customer acquisitions across ASEAN at scale. You will have the exciting opportunity to work cross-functionally and cross-geographically, as you collaborate with internal stakeholders across sales, operations, partner, and marketing teams, while being part of an entirely new concept at AWS.
ABOUT US
Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon's culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.
Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn't about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it's about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.
Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we're building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.
THE ROLE
As an Enterprise Sales Executive focused on Telco Sell-through/GTM, you will have the exciting opportunity to help promote the growth and shape the future of Cloud adoption in Singapore. Your responsibilities include teaming with SingTel/NCS to drive Cloud sales for Singapore SMB and Enterprise customers. You will focus on new customer acquisition, develop partnerships with our customers and work in close collaboration with SingTel Enterprise and NCS teams.
The ideal candidate will possess both a sales and technical skillsets that enable him/her to successfully build and maintain relationships with customers, generate demand across a defined set of customers, and develop innovative approaches to drive adoption. He/she will work with external contacts (prospects, customers, partners) and collaborate with internal account teams (Enterprise Account Managers, Solution Architect, Technical Account Managers, Customer Success Managers) to consistently meet and exceed sales goals and earn customer trust every day.
CULTURE AND COMMITMENT TO INCLUSION, DIVERSITY & EQUITY
As a trusted advisor, you'll use your interpersonal skills to influence a variety of stakeholders. You'll help ensure their short-term technology decisions are aligned with their long-term goals. Speeding up the adoption of our services will be part of your day to day. You'll also act as an evangelist in the wider community. This includes taking part in educating and sharing best practices. You won't just want to be part of an industry movement; you'll want to be leading it.
Key job responsibilities
Develop and maintain partnerships with key telecommunications customers in Singapore
Drive demand generation activities to accelerate adoption ofCloud services that run on AWS cloud by SMB/Enterprise customers
Acquire new customer contacts, earn trust and engagement with new lines of business groups within the defined Accounts
Create/Manage a sales funnel of opportunities from start-to-finish and track in CRM (Salesforce)
Collaborate with customers and AWS Singapore SMB and Enterprise sales teams on Account Planning & Strategy, and execution of strategic targets
Work in a team environment with internal and external stakeholders
Collaborate with partners to extend reach & drive adoption
Manage response & delegation of inbound sales leads
Evangelize customer success stories
Track & measure customer engagement to improve sales messaging
Create a high-level network for events and follow-up, working closely with Marketing resources

column6: Windows Azure  Cloud solutions  AWS  System  Java  Agile Development  Soft Skills  Challenging  Environment  development of applications
column7:
Cloud Engineer
Technology team is looking for Cloud Engineers to join the cloud transformation journey. We are looking for strong cloud engineers who have worked on large scale migration and cloud native development of applications. The candidate must have experience migrating workloads to public cloud such as AWS or Azure. We are looking for strong individuals that have proven experience of getting large scale projects delivered on public cloud solutions, with the experience of successfully overcoming the challenge associated with legacy systems in the context of large transformation programs and accomplishing great things in an Agile environment.
On the soft-skills side, we are looking for the ability to moderate tone and technical depth based on audience and strong ability to pick-up on non-verbal communication. On the personal attributes side, we are looking for individuals who are passionate about technology and have the drive and capability to absorb and retain vast amounts of deep technical information continuously. People that can influence, deliver, overcome issues associated with legacy systems and can successfully win-over and inspire those who show adversity to change would do well here.
Key Roles & Responsibilities
Planning, designing and developing cloud based services for application development
Designing and developing applications on cloud
Designing and developing container based applications
Designing and developing using multiple programming languages to build cloud native applications
Building dynamically scalable, highly available, fault-tolerant and reliable distributed applications on cloud
Analyze technical and business requirements to choose the right cloud service provider and services
Migrate traditional applications to cloud using 6R migration strategies
Establish best engineering practices & design patterns for cloud
Build infrastructure as code and implement architecture and design for application components
Develop and design multi cloud platform systems, including DNS integration, cloud connectivity, service discovery and secret management
Design and build the continuous integration & delivery pipeline on cloud
Building logging, monitoring and alerting capabilities for applications
Measuring spend and implement cost-control techniques
Building end to end encryption across all the architecture layers
Configure network security to manage ingress/egress traffic on the application
Build services to take advantage of auto scaling
Technology Competencies
Required expertise Software Defined compute, storage, networks (SDDC).
Required expertise with RDBMS and No-SQL database/in memory database services on cloud.
Required expertise in networking, VPC, DirectConnect, ELB, Route 53, Cloud Front
Required expertise in cloud security, policies, IAM
Required expertise on container-based solutions and orchestration such as EKS, AKS and others
Required experience in Continuous Integration / Continuous Deployment practise, tooling and techniques (Jira, Confluence, BitBucket, git; Jenkins, Artifactory, Terraform, Packer, Rundeck, Ansible)
Required experience with at least one of data analytics tools such as Splunk and/or ELK.
Required experience as full stack developer in designing and delivering large scale applications
Advantageous - deep experience in multi-tier application architecture, development, deployment and support
Required ability to write code. Ideally in Python or Java
Personal and Inter-personal skills
Delivers by possessing productivity, professionalism, customer service attitude, attention to detail and quality; ability to multitask; strong interpersonal skills, strong verbal and written communication skills and adherence to standard operating procedures.
Demonstrates ability to adapt to a rapidly changing environment and ability to take direction from multiple areas.
Comfortable in an agile and fast-moving environment.
Developing Self & Others through Coaching, Contributing to Team, continuously learning and sharing knowledge.
Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree with minimum of 10 years of software delivery and business experience in the financial services industry with at least 5 years of experience on cloud technologies
Industry certifications on Cloud architecture & technologies
Domain knowledge in Consumer, Private and Business Banking is useful however not mandatory
Ability to understand business goals and connect them with technology capabilities and solutions
Demonstrated ability to engage with 3rd party vendors and select and integrate major vendor software.
Experience with adopting and executing technical standards, process and governance across a broad project portfolio.
Preferred demonstrated capability in automation, cloud and open source technologies
Extensive experience with formal SDLC methodologies and Agile
Demonstrated experience in modern technologies, cloud, API's, and open source

Job Description :
Job summary
Would you like to engage with the world's largest enterprises to accelerate their business success using cloud technology The Solutions Architecture team are looking for an enthusiastic technologist to join our team in Singapore. You'll possess a good technical background, strong interpersonal skills, with an eye on achieving business outcomes.

Do you have experience in driving technical conversations with customers Are you able to build a technical proposition, run an enablement session and build a technical architecture to achieve a business outcome You'll be part of an elite team of trusted customer advocates, dealing with cutting edge AWS services to help our customers build new solutions and products, often exploring new technical grounds.

You will collaborate with customers, partners and other AWS teams to craft architectures that work back from customer's business needs and accelerate the adoption of appropriate AWS technology. As a Solutions Architect, you will be seen as the trusted advisor to our customers and make key contributions to their long term technology strategy. You will help shape and design solutions covering a spread of domains from migration of core enterprise applications to working with Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning technologies. The ability to learn new technology and develop industry relevant architectures and convey business value will be key to this role.

Key job responsibilities
Work as a primary member of the Account Team, identifying and driving new opportunities demonstrating a collaborative and teaming approach

Develop your own deep expertise in market relevant AWS technologies as well as broad know-how around how applications and services are constructed using the AWS platform and partner technology.

Able to build and maintain technical trusted advisor relationships with technical decision makers, supporting their adoption and deployment of AWS services and technologies in collaboration with multiple AWS teams.

Over time develop, maintain and deliver thought leading content, such as reference architectures, blog posts, white-papers and speak at internal / 3rd party events to educate our customers and/or thought lead in the industry

Support the evolution of the AWS platform and teams, such as connecting engineering to our customers or feedback, proposals of new methodologies, frameworks, tools, patents, solutions and business processes, all with the aim of accelerating customer value in the cloud

Hire, mentor and develop AWS sales and solutions architecture teams to provide expert advice to our customers

Enjoy positive and fun working environment that encourages a culture of building and experimentation

AWS Solutions Architects drive change throughout the industry, what will you change

Basic Qualifications :
. Background in any other following or related to Technology Architect, Consultant, Cloud Architect, Technical Lead, Software Developers, Engineering Lead, Sales Engineer, Pre Sales Engineer or Systems Engineers, etc.
. Will have experience and/or deeper understanding in one or more technology areas. Specific knowledge in multiple technology domain areas (e.g., software development, systems engineering, infrastructure, security, networking, data & analytics).
. Can create proof of concepts, demos, and/or scripts from scratch or leveraging reusable components.
. Understands and can articulate common architectural patterns and design principles
. Can take the lead on a complex technical project, which may require the participation of other teams to deliver.
. Able to create technical content that is easily adopted and reusable by others.
. Accommodate occasional travel
Preferred Qualifications :
. Experience architecting, migrating or transforming customer requirements to the cloud
. Professional experience architecting/operating solutions built on AWS, Azure or Google
. One or more AWS certifications, e.g. AWS Solutions Architect Associate
. Demonstrated thought leadership through public speaking and / or publications

Job Responsibilities:
Leads, participates and drives implementation of key Oracle projects in Asia Pacific MSOL Customer Care.
Participates in Sales & Sales Operations Program, perform testing with the business users, raise concerns if any and release enhancements in Oracle GQF/GSOF forms to production.
Executes list of AP and Global Oracle enhancements to improve productivity in Measurement Solution Fulfilment Process especially for Customer Care Teams.
Reviews any new Oracle enhancement requests from business and log that as a requirement with strong business justification.
Connects with all AP country Oracle superusers regularly to discuss on the Oracle issues/enhancements and training needs.
Provides support to all GQF/GSOF related issues for MSOL across all AP countries and works closely with AP IT team on the resolution, testing and releasing to production.
Supports Oracle testing request from other global sites and perform collateral testing if needed.
Works with AP IT and ASG for resolution on recurring critical issues with high business impact.
Works with Order Mgt. (including Order Entry) and Shipping leaders to optimize processes to achieve business goals.
Back To Back Products Business System Testing and Launch across AP.
Develops training materials and work procedures and conduct training to AP business users.
Job Requirements:
Degree in Engineering preferably in IT.
Strong knowledge of Oracle, JDE & CRM Cloud.
Good understanding of Measurement Solutions Products and Business Process.
With at least 2 to 3 years of hands-on experience in Quote and Order Management.
Communicates effectively, manages ambiguity, collaborates, and cultivates innovation.
Excellent planning abilities and priority management.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Very strong presentation and training skills.

column7:
Job Description :
Job summary
Would you like to be part of a new team focused on delighting Startups of all s, across a number of industries Do you have the sales acumen and technical aptitude to drive adoption of cloud services Amazon Web Services provides companies of all s with an infrastructure platform in the cloud. We are growing our Inside Sales team to help more startups make the move to AWS, and achieve their business outcomes. If you are passionate about the cloud and have the skills, the ISR role provides the opportunity to introduce the most relevant cloud solutions from AWS, to new and existing customers.

The ISR is responsible for growing consumption of current and new AWS services across a specific geography and startup segments. The ideal candidate will apply sales and technical experience to proactively engage with customers to harness the power of cloud technology to meet the customer's business objectives. A successful candidate will generate and maintain active engagements with customers and prospects, as well as consistently meet and exceed sales quotas. A single ISR might own one or more territories in conjunction with one or more account managers.

Key job responsibilities
. Responsible for prospecting and new business acquisition for assigned territory
. Ability to identify opportunities and drive full sales cycle remotely
. Understand the business development process and handle technical objections while positioning AWS services to meet customer requirements
. Ability to articulate and deliver business value that describe AWS services and pricing
. Partner with the broader country team to establish and execute the go to market strategy as well as with individual customers
. Achieve monthly business goals including but not limited to pipeline generation and closed revenue
. Maintain a prescribed cadence of activities
. Stay current on Amazon Web Services products, technology and business technical certifications
. Record all customer information and maintain detailed tele-qualification records, in the CRM on each prospective customer
Basic Qualifications :
. BS/BA degree required, Masters or MBA degree is a plus
. 4+ years of technical sales experience in a solution-sales / technology-related environment
Preferred Qualifications :
. Experience working with startups and understanding of startup ecosystem
. Ability to prospect, identify, pursue, and close new revenue opportunities Strong technical, sales, and listening skills
. Track record of meeting and exceeding established business goals
. Excellent verbal and written communication skills
. Ability to think and act independently within a fast-paced multi-task driven environment
. Experience with CRM (Salesforce.com preferred), and web-based meeting applications (e.g. Chime)

What if I'm not an expert in all the above That's okay. We hire people who have a passion for learning, and are curious to build, learn and grow. You will be supported in your career development here at AWS. You will have plenty of opportunities to build your technical, leadership, business and consulting skills. This will include formal and on the job training, and a chance to learn and upskill through AWS certification courses and mentorship. You will learn from and collaborate with some of the brightest technical minds in the industry today.

If you want to work with the best cloud technologies from the world's leading cloud provider, apply now. We can't wait to see what you build here. Come build the future with AWS.

CULTURE AND COMMITMENT TO INCLUSION, DIVERSITY & EQUITY

At AWS, we welcome all builders. We believe that technology should be built in a way that's inclusive, accessible, and equitable. We're committed to putting in the work for more equal representation

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

column7:
Job Description :
Job summary
Are you interested in help driving and overseeing a Go-to-Market (GTM) plan for Microsoft Platforms at AWS

As a Business Development (BD) leader at AWS, you will contribute to the overall performance of our Japan business, measured by revenue growth, net new customers, and reference wins. You'll have a broad role - part market maker, part operator, and part general manager - and will build a strategy focused on winning new customer segments and growing existing customer segments for the long term.

In this role, you will build and execute sales plays, content and tools to build pipeline, acting as the voice of the Microsoft customer to the AWS service teams, helping win lighthouse customers in key industries and supporting the field on the rapid close of complex deals.

Are you a motivated self-starter with an analytical mind Do you want to work on the forefront of the latest innovations and technologies Do you seek the opportunity to work with a diverse set of customers, opportunities and markets as part of a team focused on increasing adoption of Amazon Web Services for Microsoft platforms on AWS

Come build the future with us.
Basic Qualifications :
. Track record of building rapport with senior C-level stakeholders
. Business development, partner or BD experience, working in customer and partner facing roles in the Microsoft ecosystem, with focus on infrastructure or cloud platforms
. Proven ability to deliver results in a matrix organization (leveraging multiple functions and teams)
. Prior experience growing Microsoft customers
. Ability to communicate to a high standard in fluent English
Preferred Qualifications :
. Experience selling Windows Server, SQL Server or Azure
. Fluency with Microsoft Licensing, including License Mobility and Volume Licensing (such as EA)
. Experience working at Microsoft or a systems integrator partner
. Experience with data center migrations

Job Summary
Support sales as a regional pre-sale, having technical training and responding to inquiries.
Contribute to sales through solutions proposals and customization proposals.

column1: AWS Sales Strategy, Business Planning Manager for APJ
column7:
Job Description :
Job summary
Amazon Web Services provides a highly reliable, scalable, low-cost infrastructure platform in the cloud that powers more than a million businesses in 190 countries around the world. Our business is growing at rapid rates and to support this growing demand for AWS Services across the globe, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. If you have a passion for working in a fast paced, dynamic environment and provide exceptional customer service, we'd like to hear from you!

The Asia Pacific & Japan (APJ) Sales Strategy team is looking for a highly skilled Program Manager, Business Planning. This role will work towards building segmentation and coverage strategy for Commercial Sales organization and program manage all necessary steps to operationalize the strategy on field. The individual will leverage business planning cycles to collaborate with a set of stakeholders from APJ and Global Commercial Sales organization.

We seek for a candidate who is able to create simple, scalable solutions to difficult problems, have excellent project-management skills, and must be able to communicate effectively and clearly with a wide range of stakeholders, both written and verbal. This is a hands-on position the ideal candidate must be willing to roll up their sleeves.

The ideal candidate earns trust through performance and relationship building, thinks strategically and analytically about business challenges and has experience in program management or planning for a B2B Sales organization. The candidate will be a self-starter with a bias towards independent problem solving, a passion for identifying and eliminating bottlenecks, and has the foresight to anticipate business needs, make tradeoffs, and balance business dynamics despite constraints.

Basic Qualifications :
. At least 8+ years experience in Strategy, Finance, Business Operations in a mid-to-large scale company.
. Demonstrated ability to conduct sophisticated and creative analysis of complex data and translate the results into actionable deliverables, clear written summaries, and region-wide communications.
. Demonstrated ability to define, refine and implement sales strategy and planning processes, procedures and policies and cross functional collaboration skills.
. Strong written and verbal communication skills, with a track record of presenting to senior management.
. Proven experience with the systems/tools utilized for business planning and reporting. Expert level in Excel.
. Strong prioritization skills, including driving multiple initiatives at the same time.
. Able to operate successfully in a lean, fast-paced organization, and to create a vision and organization that can scale quickly.
. Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Finance, Economics, Computer Science, or related field.

Preferred Qualifications :
. MBA or other relevant advanced degree.
. Experience with annual business planning process in a high-growth, technology company. Hands on experience with planning tools like Anaplan etc.
. Familiarity with cloud product and services, and sales cycles.
. Highly organized with multi-tasking skills efficient in ambiguous situations.
. Demonstrated ability to work across organizational boundaries.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

Visit url link to know us better https://www.performance-rotors.com/about-us/

We are seeking for technically strong and grounded applicants with a solid foundation with modern web development tools to develop responsive, agile, progressive web applications that would undergo continuous development, integration, and deployment to be implemented for use in the Oil & Gas, Maritime, and Defence industries. You will be expected to work with a multidisciplinary team ranging from product to systems development.

Manage backend development, deployment, and maintenance of the company's systems
Write clean, deployable, scalable, and modular codes that could be reliable, secure, and maintainable
Develop software solutions in accordance to best practices and international standards

Prepared to go outside one's comfort zone with a strong growth mind-set

Experience with containerisation deployment with Docker
Familiar with development work with RESTful APIs
Familiar with cloud containerisation orchestration

column1: AWS Worldwide Commercial Sales Opportunity Pursuit Center of Excellence Leader, Sales Strategy, Operations & Enablement (SSOE)
column7:
Job Description :
Job summary

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the leading cloud provider, offering virtualized infrastructure, storage, networking, messaging, analytics, and other web computing services to customers all over the world. AWS operates a globally distributed environment at massive levels of scale, offering over 200 fully featured services to millions of active customers around the world, including the fastest-growing startups, largest enterprises, and leading government agencies. Worldwide Commercial Sales (WWCS) is a salesforce of more than 10,000 technical and non-technical Sellers operating around the globe, responsible for greater than half of AWS revenue.

Description

We are seeking a Senior Manager to lead the AWS Worldwide Commercial Sales Opportunity Pursuit Center of Excellence (PCoE) team to build a best-in-class Pursuit team and Win Room. This role will collaborate with Sales, Leadership and cross-functional stakeholders to define and lead the team with a mission to increase AWS win probability and add value to every opportunity and proposal AWS delivers. This role will provide leadership and direction to cross-functional teams assigned to support proposal efforts and will ensure the timely delivery of compelling, compliant proposal responses for every customer. This is a hands-on position - the ideal candidate must be willing to roll up their sleeves and dive deep.

The successful candidate earns trust through performance and relationship building, thinks strategically and analytically about our customer and business needs, and has a strong history in the proposal industry with global experience. You are a self-starter with a bias towards independent problem solving, a passion for identifying and eliminating bottlenecks, and the foresight to anticipate business needs, make tradeoffs, and balance business dynamics despite constraints. You thrive in a fast-paced environment, manage through ambiguity and complexity, and constantly seek ways to invent and simplify business processes. The ideal candidate has a demonstrated track record of building, motivating, and developing teams to deliver successful outcomes for their business and customers alike. Strategic, strong judgment and the ability to influence are essential to the success in this role.

Key Responsibilities:
. Define and lead AWS's Proposal Center of Excellence (PCOE) and Win room
. Provide leadership and direction to cross functional teams assigned to support proposal efforts
. Ensure the timely delivery of a compelling, compliant proposal responses for our customers
. Brief leadership, opportunity managers, and other stakeholders on proposals and opportunity management activities
. Manage budgets, planning, and forecasting
. Develop and manage matrixed, geographically-dispersed teams

This position can also be based in EMEA or APJ. Candidates living in these locations are encouraged to apply.

Basic Qualifications :
. BA/BS Degree required advanced degree preferred
. 10+ years of experience in proposal management, sales, and/or business development
. 5+ years of team management experience, hiring and managing high performance teams
. Strong financial, analytical, verbal and written communication skills
. Demonstrated ability to define, refine and implement sales processes, procedures and policies
. Demonstrated ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations
. Excellent cross group collaboration skills and proven ability to influence others
Preferred Qualifications :
. MBA or other relevant advanced degree
. Global experience in the proposal industry
. Technology related sales or business development experience
. Ability to articulate complex concepts to cross-functional audiences
. Highly organized, have multi-tasking skills, and efficient in ambiguous situations
. Ability to operate successfully in a rapidly changing environment
. Meets/exceeds Amazon's leadership principles requirements for this role
. Meets/exceeds Amazon's functional/technical depth and complexity for this role

column1: Partner Development Manager, SAP APJ Leader
column7:
DESCRIPTION

Job summary
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is leading the next paradigm shift in computing and is looking for an experienced Partner Development Manager (PDM) to lead one of our strategic Global System Integrators (GSI). As a PDM within AWS, you will have the exciting opportunity to deliver on our strategy to build mind share and adoption of the AWS cloud computing platform with one of our largest partners.

Responsibilities include: development and execution of SAP partner strategy owning the executive relationships with key partners, creating pipeline, driving sales execution, empowering large cloud practices and much more.

By establishing and growing business and technical relationships, along with managing the day-to-day interactions, you will be responsible for driving our SAP top line revenue growth and overall market adoption.

The ideal candidate will possess SAP business/channel sales background that enables them to engage at the MD/ VP/ CEO level, as well as a sales background that enables them to grow pipeline. The ideal candidate will also have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, products and technical challenges, with the ability to build and convey compelling value propositions.

Roles & Responsibilities:
. Experience working with enterprise large partners to develop and execute a partnering strategy, training, and joint sales and Go to Market (GTM) programs for our SAP business.
.
. Engage the partner field sales organization, channels and end customers to create and drive revenue opportunities for both parties.
.
. Define a strategic SAP Partner Plan and ensure it's in line with the AWS strategic direction. This includes developing establishing a process to track the progress toward goals.
.
. Set and manage revenue targets and work with the partners and AWS sales organizations to achieve/exceed goals.
.
. Identify specific customer segments and industry verticals to approach with a joint value proposition for using SAP on AWS.
.
. Experience with CRM systems, data warehousing and other analytic tools to establish detailed metrics for tracking purposes.
.
. Deliver strategic business reviews to the senior leadership team.
.
. Manage complex contract negotiations involving legal, marketing and business terms.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

. 10+ years of sales and/or partner development experience in the software/technology industry.
. Demonstrated ability to engage and influence C-level executives
. Influence and manage internal & external stakeholders to work together for a common goal
. Consistently exceeds quota and key performance metrics, with hands on experience negotiating enterprise contracts
. Strong language (English) public speaking and writing skills and the ability to articulate complex concepts to cross functional audiences
. Strong SAP technical and/or business solutions acumen, with a demonstrated track record of driving emerging/ disruptive technologies
. Ability to think and work creatively to develop unique joint value propositions and product strategy within AWS and in the partner's organization
. Ability to think big, be bold, set clear multi-year partnership direction

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

. Prior experience in large scale, enterprise sales, partner/channel sales and/or business development roles
. Prior experience working with/for GSIs in customer facing roles
. Understands software technologies, including SaaS and Cloud
. Experience using Salesforce.com, Excel, Tableau and other data & analytics business tool
. Post Graduate IT or MBA degrees
. AWS Certified
Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.
