column1: VP, Data Product Manager, Data Strategy Group
column6: Tableau  Machine Learning  Tibco  data engineering  Powerbi  Data Architecture  Data Science  Engineering Management  Physics  Translating  Quantitative Analysis  thought leadership  Product Management  Product Development  Data Strategy
column7:
Data Strategy Group
Data Strategy Group (DSG) harnesses and leverages on GIC's most valuable asset Data, to drive insights, results and solve real business challenges. We ingest, analyze and combine data with context across all industries and asset classes to enable investment decisions and enhance investment process. Together, we strive to build a high-performance enterprise data infrastructure, create results-driven approach with data products and strive to be a data-driven organization.
We are hiring an VP, Data Product Manager, and this role will play a key role to partner and deliver business stakeholder in delivering enterprise grade data products and solutions.
Join us if you have a passion for data and be part of a team of forward-looking data professionals in building and developing GIC's data foundation and infrastructure. You can make a difference in our data journey to shape our world of investments.
Responsibilities
You will play a key role in providing thought leadership in data engineering, tooling, architecture and infrastructure.
Establish good understanding of investment asset class specific domain knowledge and business processes.
Design effective, cost-efficient and timely data products and solutions to meet business goals.
Work closely with data architecture, engineering, management teams within Data Strategy Group to deliver data products and solutions.
Drive synergy across the solutions for similar data needs from different business units.
Develop long and medium-term roadmap or data initiatives to create sustainable and scalable data usage across the company.
Requirements
At least 8 to 10 years of relevant experience in data, finance or asset management industry.
Bachelor's in Computer Engineering/Science, Data Science or relevant disciplines
Possess good knowledge of financial instruments and markets.
Experience in data engineering and platform in one or more areas:
- Major Cloud-based Data Platforms (Snowflake, Redshift, RDS)
- Data Lake/Big Data Technology (Cloudera, Databricks, EMR)
- Data Virtualization Technology (Denodo)
- Data Streaming Technology (Kafka, TIBCO)
- Business Intelligence (Tableau, PowerBI)
- Search Technology (Solr, Fusion)
- O365 Suite
Experience with machine learning, NLP and deep learning modelling and model management is a plus
Ability to engage with business, gather requirements on business needs and translating them into data solutions.
Strong communication and people engagement skills to interact internally within team and externally across functions to design and develop solutions.
Self-driven, pro-active and great sense of purpose to relook existing data usage and implement innovation to strive for greater quality and efficiency of data solutions.
Exposure to financial services industries is a huge bonus.
You can apply directly through our recruitment portal at:
https://careers.gic.com.sg/job-invite/10863/

JOB DESCRIPTION
You will be part of the project implementation and maintenance support team. Your responsibilities include technical POC, project delivery, implementation, troubleshooting, testing, customer walk through, maintenance support and documentation. You are expected to work with our client's IT department personnel to ensure projects are delivered on time on target, much to the satisfaction of both customers & company. Managing customer's expectation is part of your job scope, which required of you to work closely with external & internal project team members. You are expected to be a fast leaner, to acquire technical implementation skill as and when needed due to business requirements. You need to have a strong analytical and problem solving skill, so as to excel in supporting our customers. Your other responsibility will include technical pre-sales support to the sales team. You are expected to participate and contribute with a feasible SOW to ensure a timely and successful project implementation.
During the first 6 months of employment to be work at Client Environment:-
Operations on VMware Horizon environment.
Manage, research, and resolve issues relating to Vmware Horizon VDI products including basic isolation of issues located in third party products that interact with VMware products.
Help to provide periodic health check report to End Customer.
Create and manage knowledge base content including problem solutions, best practices, and informational articles.

Degree in Computer Science/Information Technology/Engineering
Minimum 5 years experiences implementation and administration with one or more of the following technologies:
Citrix infrastructure
Windows Server and its networking environment
Microsoft Active Directory
VMware infrastructure
Storage infrastructure
REQUIRED SKILL-SET
System architecture including DR design experience is an advantage
Able to work effectively in a team setting
Decisive with the ability to multi-task
Relevant technical certifications, such as Citrix, VMware, and Microsoft are preferred
Overseas travelling may be needed and regional experience with neighbouring countries is a plus.

column1: Customer Engineer, Application Modernization, Public Sector, Google Cloud - Singapore
column6: Vblock  Google Cloud Platform  Application Development  Technical Sales  Virtualization  Software Development  Technical Support  Troubleshooting  Hardware  Customerfacing  Public Sector  Product Management
column7:
The area: Google Cloud
Google Cloud accelerates organizations ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google's cutting-edge technology all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.
The role: Customer Engineer, Application Modernization, Public Sector, Google Cloud - Singapore
The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and build what's next for their business all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. Our teams are dedicated to helping our customers developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies see the benefits of our technology come to life. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will play a key role in understanding the needs of our customers and help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.
Additional Role Description:
In this role, you will engage with customers to understand their business and technical requirements, and persuasively present practical and useful solutions on Google Cloud.
You will work with technical Sales teams as an enterprise hybrid cloud subject matter expert to differentiate and paint the vision of Google Cloud to our customers. You will help prospective customers and partners understand the power of Google Cloud, explaining technical features, helping customers design architectures, engage in proof of concepts, and troubleshooting potential roadblocks.
Responsibilities:
- Work with the team to identify and qualify business opportunities, understand key customer technical objections and develop a strategy to resolve technical blockers.
- Provide in-depth enterprise infrastructure/cloud modernization expertise to support the technical relationship with Google's customers, including product and solution briefings, proof-of-concept work, and partner directly with product management to prioritize solutions impacting customer adoption to Google Cloud.
- Guide customers through assessments of their existing legacy application environment(s), provide recommendations on a prioritization roadmap for application modernization, identify candidate applications for migration to hybrid-cloud computing models.
- Structure and execute prototyping workshops to prove out proposed new architectures, developing best practices, and documenting key blocking requirements for prioritization with engineering.
- Travel to customer sites, conferences, and other related events as required.
Minimum qualifications:
- 5 years of experience as a sales engineer in cloud environments or equivalent experience in a customer-facing role
- Presentation experience, including experience delivering technical pitches.
Preferred qualifications:
- Master's degree in Computer Science or other technical field.
- Regional experience in role in Asia Pacific region for technical sales or professional consulting experience in the Singapore Public Sector, Healthcare, or Education market.
- Practical experience with legacy and modern application development, cloud service delivery, and deployment.
- Practical experience with containers and associated technologies including Docker, Kubernetes, Istio, Serverless, and Microservices.
- Practical experience with converged infrastructure and virtualization systems including Nutanix, VMWare, Cisco UCS, and KVM.
- Experience with cloud-native software development methodologies and tools to support application development/deployment stages including CI/CD (i.e. Jenkins, Spinnaker, Concourse)

column6: Performance Testing  Software Engineering  Agile Methodologies  Agile  Docker  Technical Leadership  Api  Databases  Technical Standards  Mentoring  Modeling  Root Cause Analysis  Infrastructure Strategy  Team Leadership  Team Lead  Technical Design
column7:
The Company You'll Join
Fundnel Group is Southeast Asia's largest marketplace for alternative assets. We aim to expand access to and liquidity in the private capital markets with Fundnel, our private investments technology platform, and Hg Exchange (HGX), Southeast Asia's largest private digital securities exchange enabling institutions to better serve their investors. To date, the Group has created access to invest in over USD21B worth of private alternative assets.
With Fundnel and HGX, the Group's purpose is to create a sustainable marketplace with curated investment opportunities in alternative assets, that support a virtuous cycle of private capital growth including the companies, communities and stakeholders powered by it.
We are headquartered in Singapore with a growing presence in 4 countries across the Asia Pacific region.
The Team You'll Work With
As our Software Engineering Team Lead, you will be leading a small but rapidly growing team building out a scalable, flexible, blockchain-integrated exchange platform. In this hands-on leadership role, you will be able to directly contribute to our codebase while also leveraging and further developing your leadership abilities. Supported by the CTO, you will have the autonomy to make critical decisions, mentor your team and help guide the future direction of the Hg Exchange technology roadmap.
We have a varied and rapidly evolving technology stack that emphasizes flexible service-based interactions between our internal systems and external partners. As a modern, digitally-enabled exchange, we are placing the core elements of tokenized, decentralized finance at the heart of our platform. As our Lead, you will play a key role in planning and integrating blockchain-enabled settlement and tokenization processes, and determining how best to achieve our members goals through leveraging these disruptive technologies.
Operating at the intersection of traditional and decentralized finance, and working closely with both established financial institutions and some of the world's most innovative technology companies, we embrace an agile mindset that enables experimentation without compromising on security and stability.
The sorts of things you'll be doing:
Leading and mentoring a team of 2-3 engineers to start, with an opportunity to grow significantly beyond that
Alongside your team, hands-on implementation of the product roadmap
Contributing to our cloud infrastructure strategy, ensuring we are making the best use of new and existing cloud services in terms of security, efficiency, and scalability
Working closely with our technology partners, Principals, and CTO to plan the most scalable and adaptable exchange architectures
Helping the team select the tooling, frameworks, and processes that will help us maximize delivery while minimizing code
Defining and evolving our data domains, in close collaboration with both our data and product teams
Establishing secure and robust interfaces with our vendors and partners
Keeping up to date with the latest in tooling and industry best practices, ensuring that we're constantly discussing, evaluating, and implementing the best
In collaboration with the CTO and our entire team, help set the practices and mindsets that define our technology culture
As our Software Engineering Team Lead, you'll bring 5+ years of hands-on software engineering experience, with some exposure to team leadership. More specifically, we hope you'll bring strong experience with many of the following:
Service-oriented, API-driven architectures
Cloud infrastructure and security (any major cloud provider will do)
Blockchain principles, smart contract development, digital wallets and good knowledge of (or strong interest in ) defi applications and NFTs
Serverless and container-orchestrated architectures
Mentoring team members, conducting technical interviews and performance management
Agile methodologies and sprint-based workflows
A variety of OO and functionally-oriented languages
Security and performance testing and auditing, both at the code and infrastructure level
API design and specification (Swagger/OpenAPI, etc.)
Containerization and image management (Docker, etc.)
Best practices around robust CI/CD pipelines
Experience with relational databases (non-relational also an asset)
Data domain modeling
Workflow engines, such as Apache Airflow
Beyond the technology, we also hope you've got some level of experience, or at least interest, in:
Financial services, particularly the investment space
Both startup and corporate-type working environments (we're a bit of both!)
An appreciation for experimentation and designing systems/processes that accommodate business and technical agility
We are a social and cross-functional team that very much enjoys working together in person whenever possible. As such this role will be largely based in our Singapore office, although we offer a flexible working environment where delivery and outcome are more important than the number of hours.
We thank you for your interest, and we look forward to meeting you! For interested applicants, please send your resume to [HIDDEN TEXT]. Only successful applicants will be contacted.

column1: Senior Database Solutions Architect, ASEAN, World Wide Specialists, Database
column7:
DESCRIPTION

Job summary
AWS enables companies of all s to rethink their relationship with technology. If you are excited by these opportunities to unshackle customers from traditional boxes & wires, and have relevant experience, please come join our team and let's cloudify the world! Opportunity like this comes once in a generation - don't watch the history unfold from the sidelines - join us to write it!
This role helps our customers who would like to move their existing systems to AWS cloud. Specifically, this role will help customers migrate and achieve higher flexibility, scale, and resiliency inherent in cloud-based databases. Already, many customers have migrated their data to AWS cloud and enjoy greater speed of innovation, resiliency, security, and global footprint. This success of other customers and our dedication to being the best public cloud platform for running data-focused workloads inspires new customers to move their systems to AWS.
After joining our team, you will be provided with ramp-up support and a team of mentors to ensure you get off to a good start. After that, within the first six months, we will ask you to help your first large customer migrate some of their existing data onto AWS. Within first 12 months, you will have an opportunity to work with several major companies in ASEAN, present at the next AWS Summits in various parts of APAC, conduct internal training, and publish blogs and whitepapers. You will also have an opportunity to influence the direction of our products by providing actionable customer feedback to the product and engineering managers. Deep technical skills combined with strong customer obsession and ability to communicate clearly are essential to be successful in this role.
At AWS, customer obsession is in our DNA. In order to be successful in this role, you will need to become a trusted advisor to our customers and to partner with AWS sales, business development, and generalist solutions architecture to develop the internal expertise needed to help even larger number of customers realize the benefits of cloud-based virtual desktops and applications. You will be part of a great team of very supportive people who will help you be successful, but also expect a lot of you.
If you want to be part of a once in a lifetime transformation in the IT industry and achieve more than you may think you are capable of - this is a perfect place for you! Come join us in bringing the cloud revolution to ASEAN!
You should not only be passionate about delivering great customer service and deploying database solutions in AWS cloud, but should also be obsessed with accelerating the customers successful adoption of AWS.
Your other responsibilities include:
. Educate customers of all s on the value proposition of AWS, and participate in deep architectural discussions to ensure solutions are designed for successful deployment in the cloud
. Help customers establish a plan to move their databases to AWS
.
. Conduct one-to-few and one-to-many training sessions to transfer knowledge to customers considering or already using AWS
. Capture and share best-practice knowledge among the AWS solutions architect community
. Build deep relationships with senior technical individuals within customers to enable them to be cloud advocates

About the team
Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon's culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn't about how many hours you spend at home or at work it's about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we're building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

. 7+ years of Relational Database implementation, operations and/or solution deployment experience in a business-critical, high-availability context.
. Working knowledge of large-scale databases and data warehouses
. Working knowledge of relational databases
. Demonstrated ability to adapt to new technologies and learn quickly
. Strong verbal and written communications skills are a must
. Excellent presentation skills with a high degree of comfort presenting to audiences large and small
. Ability to travel within the region up to 50%
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

. At least 3 years of customer-facing experience, preferably in the enterprise space
. At least 3 years hands-on experience building/supporting distributed or large-scale databases, ideally in the cloud
. Hands-on experience with AWS in a professional context
. Experience operating on agile cross-functional teams
. An advanced degree in computer science, engineering or mathematics

We are building out a team of Inside Sales i-Specialists across Asia Pacific based in the Inside Sales Team Hubs in Singapore.
The Inside Sales i-Specialist will be a core member of the team helping to grow VMware's new businesses in the relevant solution segments. Future Ready solutions portfolio based on End User Computing, Cloud, Networking and Security areas & Customer User Case solutions. The i-Specialist will work in our Inside Sales hubs to generate demand, pipeline and revenue for our Future Ready solutions.
The i-Specialists will own a revenue quota number for a territory/region and the focus will be on net new acquisition accounts and be responsible for collaborating with our core Inside Sales teams, Partner Sales teams, and Solution Provider ecosystem. Knowledge of computer hardware and/or software sales is a must. An understanding of and passion for the Cloud or Software-as-a-Servicemarketplace is a requirement.

Key job responsibilities:
Will carry your own quota for assigned territory in addition to assisting the field sales team on some deals
Identify and establish relationships with new business prospects
Navigate org charts through outbound prospecting to identify new opportunities
Sell/Market to large audiences (1: many) utilizing web conferencing technologies
Manage and maintain accurate account and opportunity details in Salesforce.
Accountable for helping create pipeline and establish opportunities with our customers and partners.
Collaborate with Inside & Field Core sales, BU Specialists & SE's and Partner sales leaders to ensure proper engagement on these solutions centric opportunities to ensure the best customer experience with VMWare across potentially multiple solutions teams.
Drive the sales of add-on services and value services of existing customers.
Support core Inside Sales enablement activities to drive further understanding of Solution offerings

Requirements
Passionate about technology
Ability to communicate inKorean and/or English
Sales experience with VMware Horizon, Workspace ONE, Citrix Xen Desktop/XenApp and Microsoft SCCM/Intune highly desirable
Experience with Endpoint security , NGAV or EDR technology will be advantageous
Proven ability to assimilate into a team environment and works in challenging teaming situation
Excellent organizational skills and the ability to manage many diverse projects simultaneously
The ability to develop in-depth knowledge of company infrastructure, operations, contacts, and buying cycles
Experience with Salesforce preferred
The ability to interact professionally and reliably with senior level executives within and outside the company, as well as with customers, vendors etc.
Ability to work within a team environment and build rapport.
Strong sense of urgency and efficiency in completing work
Ability to take self-initiative, be proactive and ability to multitask, prioritize workload
An open mindset to new ideas and suggestions.
Demonstrates good judgment in analyzing information to make decisions.
Proficient with digital technology and social media
Exemplary verbal and written English communication skills and attention to detail
Bachelor's degree or equivalent
4-6 years of sales experience in computer hardware, software, or online services is required
SaaS selling experience is a MUST
Self-motivated with a high attention to detail and ability to multitask
Willingness to learn and attend bi-weekly solutions enablement sessions
An unwavering positive attitude, strong drive for results, and the ability to deal with ambiguity are a must
Customer Satisfaction focused
Attention to detail and understanding of subscription sales and ordering.
Need to be familiar with computers and technology and comfortable using the Microsoft Windows operating system and Microsoft Outlook
Must be open to receiving constructive criticism (feedback) and applying and integrating the feedback in an effort to improve their results


VMware Company Overview: At VMware, we believe that software has the power to unlock new opportunities for people and our planet. We look beyond the barriers of compromise to engineer new ways to make technologies work together seamlessly. Our cloud, mobility, and security software form a flexible, consistent digital foundation for securely delivering the apps, services and experiences that are transforming business innovation around the globe. At the core of what we do are our people who deeply value execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. Shape what's possible today at http://careers.vmware.com.

Job Summary
Administration, planning and implementation of Information Security solutions, projects and policies for Global sites to ensure the protection of all assets for the organization.
Responsibilities :
Planning, implementing, managing Information Security solutions and measures for the protection of Venture Group's data, systems and networks.
Manage cybersecurity projects & coordinate with global site IT and vendors to deliver security solutions and initiatives timely.
Organize penetration and vulnerability scans with external testers and internal IT teams and follow up with their remediation and closures.
Monitor, investigate and develop strategies to lead security incident responses efforts and recover from security breaches.
Plan security awareness program and conduct security awareness trainings and initiatives.
Develop and maintain documentation on security playbook, policies, procedures and ISO27001 ISMS.
Working with all Group IT Pillars & business stakeholders to define security protocols and to secure IT systems.
Part of Group IT Cybersecurity Team to work closely with managed security provider, Global Site IT teams and serve as an escalation point for all security-related issues to troubleshoot and establish root cause for continuous improvement.
Requirements :
Degree in Information Technology/Information Security.
Min. 3 years of proven work experience in a similar cybersecurity role.
Strong experience and knowledge in enterprise security solutions such as Next-Gen Firewall (Fortinet), Endpoint Protection software (TrendMicro), PAM, SIEM, Email & Cloud Security, DLP, IAM, EDR.
High proficiency in IT security governance and architecture, including a knowledge of IT network security and cloud-based technologies.
Proven understanding of the current vulnerabilities, incident response, and mitigation strategies used in cyber security.
Knowledge of vulnerability assessment tools (Nessus), computer forensic tools, security incident response and methods.
Experience in performing security solutions POC, evaluation, testing and track record of security project management for successful implementation and roll-out.
Security certification (CISSP, CISA, CEH, OSCP) is an added advantage.
Strong oral and written communication skills, including a demonstrated ability to prepare quality documentation and presentations for technical and non-technical audience
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills
Experience with ISO27001 ISMS is an added bonus.

The area: Google Cloud
Google Cloud accelerates organizations ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google's cutting-edge technology all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.
The role: Field Sales Representative, Enterprise, Financial Services, Google Cloud - Singapore
As a member of the Google Cloud team, you inspire leading companies, schools, and government agencies to work smarter with Google tools like Google Workspace, Search, and Chrome. You advocate the innovative power of our products to make organizations more productive, collaborative, and mobile. Your guiding light is doing what's right for the customer, you will meet customers exactly where they are at and provide them the best solutions for innovation. Using your passion for Google products, you help spread the magic of Google to organizations around the world.
Additional Role Description:
As a Field Sales Representative, you will act as a business partner to assigned accounts to understand the company challenges and goals. You will advocate for our products to make organizations more productive, collaborative, and mobile.
Responsibilities:
- Build relationships with enterprise customers to assist with growth. Influence strategic direction and serve as a business partner.
- Lead account strategy in generating and developing business growth opportunities. Work collaboratively with customer engineers and partners to optimize business results in territory and create opportunities with customers.
- Analyze and learn the technology footprint, strategic growth plans, business growths, and technology strategy of assigned accounts.
- Manage multiple opportunities through the entire business cycle simultaneously, work with cross-functional teams, and serve as the primary customer contact for all business/adoption-related activities, including the development of strategic agreements.
- Grow business development, forecast accurately, and achieve strategic goals by leading customers through the entire business cycle.
Minimum qualifications:
- Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
- 10 years of experience in software sales and account management at an enterprise business-to-business (B2B) software company.
Preferred qualifications:
- 10 years of experience selling infrastructure software, databases, analytic tools, or applications software.
- Experience working with and presenting to executives.
- Experience with commercial and legal discussions working with procurement, legal, and business teams.
- Experience working with and managing partners on implementation projects, including global system integrators and packaged software vendors.
- Knowledge of a specific industry.
- Ability to work with sales engineers and customer technical leads to inventory existing software estate, define migration plans, and build business cases for migrations.

column7:
Acronis is dedicated not just to cyber protection but to the general protection of its potential and current employees, interviews are being held virtually during the current global COVID-19 situation.
Acronis is a world leader in cyber protectionempowering people by providing them with cutting-edge technology that enables them to monitor, control, and protect the data that their businesses and lives depend on. We are in an exciting phase of rapid-growth and expansion and looking for a DevOps Developer who is ready to join us in creating a #CyberFit future and protecting the digital world!
We are looking to hire a DevOps Developer into Acronis DevOps team to be responsible for design and development of Continuous Delivery for full lifecycle management of our Acronis Cyber Cloud components.
Acronis Cyber Cloud is a platform that delivers data protection services across the globe with an unprecedented level of ease. With one installation, customers gain access to backup, disaster recovery, file sync and share, notarization and e-signature services, all managed from a single console.
Every member of our A-Team has an instrumental role and impact on the success of Acronis innovative and growing business, so we are looking for someone who enjoys working in dynamic, global teams and thrives in a fast-paced and rapidly changing work environment. Just like everyone at Acronis, the ideal candidate will embody all of our company values: responsive, alert, detail-oriented, makes decisions, and never gives up.
WHAT YOU'LL DO
Automate Dev/Deploy/QA/Ops processes to have possibility to release single feature/component on daily basis
Building and maintaining modern Continuous Delivery and Continuous Deployment processes and tools for Acronis R&D, Acronis Datacenters and Acronis on premise customers around the world
Visualize feature delivery pipeline and measure it (time between phases, time to deliver, success rate, etc)
WHAT YOU BRING (EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS)
2+ years experience in building commercial software
1+ years experience of building and supporting Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery systems
1+ year practical experience with Jenkins or other CD tools
Communication skills
Fluent English
Knowledge of distributed micro-services-based architectures problems and best practices
Scripting skills (Python, Bash)
DESIRED
Practical linux administration skills
Centralized monitoring (Prometheus, Zabbix, Graphite), alerting (Zabbix, Alerta) and logging (ELK, EFK) systems management experience
Experience with configuration management tools (Ansible, Puppet or Chef)
Experience with autotests design
Hands-on knowledge of virtualization layers (KVM, ESX, Virtuozzo/OpenVZ)
Experience with Docker / Kubernetes
Understanding of IaaS/PaaS practices with AWS, GCP or Azure
Experience with integration with Atlassian stack (Bitbucket, Jira)
WHO WE ARE
Acronis is revolutionizing cyber protection by integrating backup, disaster recovery, storage, next-generation anti-malware, and protection management into one solution. This all-in-one integration removes the complexity and risks associated with non-integrated solutions and offers easy, complete and reliable data protection for all workloads, applications, and systems across any environmentphysical, virtual, cloud, and mobileall at a low cost.
Founded in Singapore in 2003 and incorporated in Switzerland in 2008, Acronis is truly a global organization with more than 1,900 employees in 33 locations in 18 countries. Its solutions are trusted by more than 5.5 million consumers and 500,000 businesses, including 100% of the Fortune 1000 companies. Acronis products are available through 50,000 partners and service providers in over 150 countries in more than 30 languages. Acronis is in an exciting phase of growth and expansion, recently receiving a $250 million investment from CVC Capital Partners, bringing the total valuation to more than $2.5 billion.
Acronis is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, marital status, national origin, physical or mental disability, medical condition, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.

You will be part of a highly motivated, communicative, and productive backend team. This position implies that you will be responsible for designing, implementing, and managing the backend services that stand behind our social network and music creation features. Your work will impact millions of our users so what you build must be scalable and highly performant. You will grow in an environment passionate about knowledge-sharing and code review; experience a development culture that uses the state of the art technologies. It doesn't matter what's your level you think - you will be able to learn many things along with us.
Responsibilities:
End-to-end ownership of systems you build: estimating, designing, developing, code review, performance optimization, documentation, testing, and monitoring
Collaborate with team members on design and implementation
Communicate with other teams during the analysis and development phase
Design and build APIs
Develop and ship cloud native applications
Design and deploy cloud infrastructure
Write unit, functional and end-to-end tests
Write understandable, testable, and maintainable code
Develop new and maintain the existing features
Improve scalability and performance of the existing services
Work with a large codebase written in .NET C# and Node.js JavaScript
Requirements
At least 2 years of software engineering experience
Proficiency in at least one of .NET (C#/F#), Node.js, Go
Working experience with SQL and NoSQL databases
Understanding of RESTful web services, SOA, and microservices architecture
Understanding of software engineering best practices including unit testing, continuous integration, continuous deployment, and source control
Commitment to high-quality and maintainable software
Nice-to-haves:
Hands-on experience with serverless technologies and techniques
Experience working in high-load client/server application development
Practical experience with IaC (e.g. Azure ARM, AWS CF, Pulumi)
Understanding of CQRS and Event Sourcing
What to expect from the technical interview:
What we won't ask:
Red-black trees
How computers work
Spaces or tabs
How many golf balls can fit in a school bus
Deep knowledge of .NET, Go, or Node.js
What we would like to talk about:
Your background and what you're passionate about
How you design your applications or infrastructure
Basic things about networking and protocols
What is important for you in the development workflow

Your Team:
You will be joining our regional infrastructure team in Synpulse Asia which is responsible for new client implementations as well as new projects for their existing clients. Synpulse infrastructure team is helping our customers to implement and enhance Avaloq Core and surrounding ecosystems from technology front.
We are looking for people who are self-driven and ambitious. You will be working in a fast-paced environment which provides ample of opportunities to nurture in latest technologies.
Your responsibilities:
Act as infrastructure solution and implementation domain SME for Synpulse regional project initiatives.
Deploy Avaloq software components including Avaloq core, Avaloq front systems and Avaloq adaptors with underlying software technologies of Oracle, JBoss, MQ and other middleware components.
Work independently or as a part small team to design, build, automate and document a multi-tiered managed services platform.
Implement Unix/Windows scripting to optimize installation & operation.
Investigate / assist / resolve technical infrastructure setup issues e.g. network problems for inter-component communication, Operating System (Linux, Solaris, and Windows etc.) issues, Storage System errors etc.
Troubleshoot a wide range of technical issues related to Database, Avaloq interfaces e.g. JMS Adaptor, Active MQ , WebSphere MQ , SOPA, SFTP.
Work under project timeline pressure and onsite with customers and, focus at delivery results.

Strong in Oracle Database administration, Database build and upgrade.
Technical Infrastructure knowledge (servers , networking, storage, Bank IT operations)

CCM / Assentis (deployment/support).
UNIX scripting.
Knowledge in installing and supporting middleware technologies e.g. WebSphere MQ, Active MQ and JBoss etc.
Knowledge in cloud infrastructure implementations.

The candidate must also have:
Have excellent telephone and email communications.
Be approachable and friendly.
Be able to organize and prioritise workload.
Be able to work within a team, facilitating team interaction.
Be willing to work outside of core-hours when the need arises.
Be willing to travel overseas.
Be willing to learn and work in cross domain technologies.

Job Description
We are building out a team of Digital Sales Reps to help support our Enterprise customers across Asia Pacific based in the Digital Sales Hubs in Sydney, Tokyo, and Singapore. An exciting opportunity to work in the multi-Cloud technology space and if you are passionate about Cloud and how technology can help transform our customers and enjoy hunting for new business opportunities this is the role for you.
The Digital Sales Enterprise Sales Development is an inside driven Business Development position responsible for developing new sales pipeline for VMware's Multi-Cloud portfolio by working directly with customers, as well as by partnering with Regional Directors (RD's) and core Account Executives for strategic planning and target/prospect identification within a defined account list or territory.
Why will you enjoy this new opportunity
Drive leading edge multi-Cloud business conversations with our Enterprise customers
Be part of a dynamic and innovative team and culture
If you enjoy hunting for new opportunities and are a self-starter
Passionate about technology & Cloud solutions
If you have an unwavering positive attitude, strong drive for results, and the ability to multi-task
Teamwork and Collaboration across the VMWare organization with Enterprise Sales, Partners, Specialists, SE, PSO and Marketing to ensure maximum success and impact for our customers and partners

Success in the Role: What are the performance outcomes over the first 6-12 months you will work toward completing
As a Digital Sales Enterprise Rep you will own a pipeline target for a set of customers in a territory/region per quarter.
Your focus will be on identifying net new pipeline for our Multi-Cloud Solutions and once qualified pipeline has been identified, you will be responsible for collaborating with our core Enterprise Sales team as well as, Partner Sales teams, and Solution Provider ecosystem who will them manage the opportunity directly with the customer.
You will be working closely with your Enterprise Sales Team on defining your business development focus areas and identifying prospecting opportunities.
You will engage with your customers daily, ensuring you are connecting with the right stakeholders, understanding where the customer is on their digital and cloud journey.
You will identify short- & near-term opportunities but also longer-term areas for development and ensure we continue to nurture & engage with the customer in the technology journey to ensure VMWare is top of mind with any multi-Cloud transformational project.
Our partners are critical to our success and so working closely with your partners who manage and services these customers will also be a critical element in this role.
In your first 90 days we will have a robust onboarding and upskilling plan to help ensure you are confident in your VMWare Multi-Cloud messaging, understand the competitive landscape, understand the stakeholders and team at VMware and Partners who can support you in your role

What type of work will you be doing What assignments, requirements, or skills will you be performing on a regular basis
Engage with targeted customers on a regular basis ensuring consistent messaging, support, and ongoing opportunity discussions for VMware Multi-Cloud solutions
Ongoing customer engagement to nurture the customers short- & long-term Cloud Transformation journey
Weekly Enablement to ensure you become an expert on VMware Multi-Cloud solutions, VMware messaging and the competitive landscape and ensure you understand the partner network supporting our customers and their capabilities and relationship with each customer
Manage a Quarterly pipeline target for your assigned territory which involves Salesforce Pipeline Management, Customer profiling as well as managing a nurturing cycle of activities in each customer
Collaborate with Enterprise Core sales, BU Specialists & SE's, Marketing and Partner sales leaders to ensure proper engagement on these opportunities to ensure the best customer experience with VMWare across potentially multiple solutions teams and define next steps on every potential opportunity short or long term
Identify and establish relationships with new business prospects in your customer
Navigate org charts through outbound prospecting to identify new opportunities
Help engage/Market to large audiences (1: many) utilizing web conferencing technologies or Virtual Briefing Centres to foster & develop multi-Cloud pipeline
Manage and maintain accurate account and opportunity details in Salesforce.
Identify & engage with our Multi-Cloud Partners to further foster pipeline and opportunities into our selected Enterprise Customers

What is the leadership like for this role What is the structure and culture of the team like
The Digital Sales Leadership team are an energetic and passionate team of leaders who love technology and solving customer challenges. We are results driven, foster a rewards and recognition culture and focus on ensuring every one of our team members is confident, empowered and has all the right support and resources available to them to be successful. Your individual success, development and growth is foundational in everything we do to support you, the team and business.
You will be part of a larger Asia Pacific and Japan distributed Digital Sales team. VMware have hub offices in Bangalore, Beijing, Tokyo, Singapore, and Sydney so whilst being part of a regional team you will also gain exposure to other regions, best practices and a broad network of experience and cultural experience and dynamics. It's a very open and transparent team and we encourage and foster collaboration across regions.
Job skill requirements:
Passionate about technology, energetic and pro-active self-starter
Minimum 2 years experience in Cloud or Software-as-a-Servicemarketplace
Minimum 2 years experience in a business development and/or prospecting role in computer software, Cloud solutions or online services is required
Strong ability to identifying both short- and longer-term opportunities with customers and ability to nurture a customer in early prospecting stages
The ability to interact professionally and reliably with senior level executives within and outside the company, as well as with customers, partners etc.
Proven ability to assimilate into a team environment and works in challenging teaming situation
Excellent organizational skills and the ability to manage many diverse projects simultaneously
The ability to develop in-depth knowledge of company infrastructure, operations, contacts, and buying cycles
Experience with Salesforce preferred
Strong sense of urgency and efficiency in completing work
Ability to take self-initiative, be proactive and ability to multitask, prioritize workload with a good level of attention to detail
An open mindset to new ideas and suggestions.
Demonstrates good judgment in analyzing information to make decisions.
Proficient with digital technology and social media
Exemplary verbal and written English communication skills and attention to detail
Willingness to learn and attend bi-weekly solutions enablement sessions
An unwavering positive attitude, strong drive for results, and the ability to deal with ambiguity are a must
Customer Satisfaction focused
Need to be familiar with computers and technology and comfortable using the Microsoft Windows operating system and Microsoft Outlook
Bachelor's degree required

Where is this role located

Fixed: This role will be performed from a world-class VMware office. You will be expected to live within a daily commute of your assigned office.

What are the benefits and perks of working at VMware

You and your loved ones will be supported with a competitive and comprehensive benefits package. Below are some highlights, or you can view the complete benefits package by visiting
Employee Stock Purchase Plan
Medical Coverage, Retirement, and Parental Leave Plans for All Family Types
Generous Time Off Programs
40 hours of paid time to volunteer in your community
Rethink's Neurodiversity program to support parents raising children with learning or behaviour challenges, or developmental disabilities
Financial contributions to your ongoing development (conference participation, trainings, course work, etc.)
Wellness reimbursement and online fitness and wellbeing classes

column7:
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is seeking a highly capable, self-directed Partner Marketing Manager to own the marketing strategy and programs to drive customer adoptions of Enterprise workloads to AWS's cloud computing platform through AWS Partners. If you have a passion for the cloud, experience with marketing enterprise technology applications, love helping partners reach their full potential, and are an expert in designing and implementing joint marketing plans and partner programs at scale then we're looking for you.
AWS gives customers a secure, scalable, global cloud infrastructure while paying only for what they use. Scaling through partners is a key part of how we help customers move to cloud services that power strategic workloads.
In this role, you will be a lead as a subject matter expert on how to drive Enterprise workloads to AWS through partner marketing programs. You will monitor partner marketing performance against key metrics and be an expert resource on marketing processes and guidelines for partners. You will collaborate with peers in marketing team to build mechanisms for consistency and bar-raising delivery across strategic workloads.
The ideal candidate has a passion for technology, an entrepreneurial spirit, and a successful track record in partner marketing. They have a relentless focus on the end customer and love building and running marketing enablement programs that scale and accelerate joint marketing campaigns with partners. This is a unique opportunity to play a highly visible role in an exciting technology business.
Key Responsibilities
Collaborate with regional partner leadership and field partner marketing to identify priorities, focus partner marketing initiatives, and success metrics.
Innovate and build best-in-class partner marketing programs and motions to successfully drive migration of Oracle and relevant enterprise workloads to AWS through partners.
Develop and monitor partner marketing plans with focus partners to effectively drive customer awareness and adoption of AWS services for enterprise applications.
Market at scale by designing partner marketing programs and campaign templates that can be implemented by global and regional partners.
Drive awareness and demand to AWS partner offerings through AWS-led campaigns and messaging.
Manage inclusion and promotion of partner offerings at AWS events and AWS's strategy at alliance events.
Build and promote customer case studies with partners to provide customers with tangible results and implementation stories.
Become an expert at tracking and reporting systems and process to ensure partner marketing activities are recognized, evaluated, and optimized.
Basic qualifications
7+ years of relevant work experience in partner/enterprise marketing, demand generation in cloud and/or enterprise software space
Build co-marketing for a large global partner for 3 years or account-based enterprise marketing plans
Proven record in establishing and analyzing Return of Marketing Investment metrics and conversant with lead funnel metrics and industry CRM tools
Experience in developing compelling joint content and working knowledge of digital marketing, social media and public relations
Excel in working closely with customer segment, internal cross-functional teams, external agencies and industry associations
Degree/ MBA and equivalent industry experience.
Preferred qualifications
Exceptional writing and communication skills; ability to summarize important insights for senior leadership and cross-functional stakeholders
Demonstrates strong analytical and strategic thinking skills and the ability to translate those skills into creative, marketable programs
Be a natural team player and have a desire to work with others for broader success
The fluid ability to operate successfully in a rapidly changing, ambiguous and undefined environment
Candidate will be able to understand the technology surrounding AWS products and technologies

column1: Sr. Partner Solutions Architect, Partner Solutions Architect
column7:
DESCRIPTION

Job summary
Amazon Web Services is leading the next paradigm shift in computing and is looking for a world class candidate for the role of Sr. Partner Solutions Architect. As a Partner SA, you will have the exciting opportunity to develop and deliver solutions on new and existing AWS services to support organizations as they transition to the cloud. Partnering with other customer facing and service teams, you will work strategically with the AWS teams and, Technology & Consulting Partners to drive customer success in adoption of AWS services.

You, as the right candidate, are as comfortable white boarding complex software architectures with a room full of engineers as you are briefing an executive audience. You will get the opportunity to work with a wide array of AWS Partners, from well-established tech giants to innovative startups that were born in the cloud. You will work closely with few select partners to dive deeper on their product roadmap. You will also have the opportunity to write whitepapers, deliver technical webinars, speak at events and file patents for what could potentially be a future AWS product or feature. You will get the opportunity to work directly with senior engineers at both customers, Partners, and AWS service teams.

You should be a Cloud technology expert in the areas of Compute, Storage, AI/ML, application and data modernization. Experience working directly with customers is required, and prior experience working with partner solutions is a plus. Ability to work in a polyglot environment and flexibility around learning new AWS services and implement for various use cases across industries will be very useful.

Key job responsibilities
Key responsibilities for the role include:
. Educate customers/partners of all s on the value proposition of AWS and new, existing services
. Participate in deep architectural discussions to ensure solutions are designed for successful deployment in the cloud.
. Conduct one-to-few and one-to-many training sessions to transfer knowledge to customers considering or already using AWS.
. Capture and share best-practice knowledge amongst the AWS solutions architect community.
. Author or otherwise contribute to AWS customer-facing publications such as whitepapers, blogs.
. Nurture relationships with partners, enabling them to become cloud advocates.
. Act as a technical liaison between service engineering team, support team and our partners
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

. 10+ years of experience in design/implementation/consulting experience with distributed applications
. Experience in infrastructure, compute, storage, database, data and analytics, and networking architecture for large scale environments
. Hands-on experience in application development and modernization including micro-service, and API driven-architectures
. Working knowledge on a broad range of technologies including Serverless, Big Data and Analytics, AI, Machine learning, Containers e.g. Kubernetes, etc.
. Strong business acumen and interest to understand business problems and ability to explain the technology value proposition
. 10+ years of working with customers, preferably interfacing with senior technical leaders.
. Strong verbal and written communications skills, as well as the ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations.
. Technical degree required Computer Science or Engineering background highly desired.
. Willing to learn new technologies, develop solutions and enable partners for adoption of these new technologies
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

. Proven experience in a consultative technical sales with a proven track record of success. Ability to gain credibility and build relationships with all levels in an organization, from technical experts to senior executives.
. Track record of implementing AWS services in a variety of business environments such as large enterprises and start-ups.
. Experience working within the software development or Internet industries is highly desired.
. Technical degrees in Computer Science, Math, Engineering or equivalent is highly desired.
. AWS Professional Certification (eg., AWS Solutions Architect Professional) or other industry certification.
. Experience building sophisticated and highly automated infrastructure.

DESCRIPTION

Job summary
Do you have a passion to install, deploy, service and maintain mission critical IT infrastructure in one of the world's largest and fastest-growing cloud data centers Are you looking to expand your horizon in an exciting and dynamic work environment that encourages creativity and boundless opportunities for career development Do you enjoy solving problems and delivering value-adding results

If you answered yes to any of these questions, then Amazon Web Services Data Center is the place to be!

In this role as a Data Center Operations Engineer (DCO Engineer), you will be responsible for the on-site management of hardware lifecycle of our Singapore IT infrastructure.

You will troubleshoot technical issues on advanced hardware, ranging from servers, storage and networking devices on a 24/7 basis. Working with key technical subject matter experts, you will have the opportunity to participate in the design, implementation and commissioning of our advanced IT infrastructure. Drive & implement projects to enhance operational efficiencies with opportunities to share experiences and knowledge with our global network of technical experts.

As a successful DataCenter Systems Engineer, your day-to-day work will include:
. Installation and configurations on Data center Servers and Network systems
. Installation, troubleshooting and replacement of internal and external hardware parts of Servers and Network devices
. Perform storage media (HDD, SSD etc.) sanitization and destruction tasks
. Work within a ticket-based environment and work on systematic problem resolution
. Movement of equipment with assisted lifting machinery.
. Work on rotational shift-based schedule to maintain high system reliability by prioritizing trouble tickets
. Collaborate with internal teams (DC operations, DC Engineering, Logistics, Security, Projects etc.) sharing ideas and contribute in innovative projects to improve DC work environment and overall efficiencies.
. Participate, lead and deliver small to mid-scale projects including new Data Center rollout

About the team
The Data center Operations Teams are pivotal to ensuring the continuality and high availability of one of the world's fastest-growing cloud data centers around the world. As one of the cutting-edge data centers, we manage customers data for major MNCs and emerging companies alike, at a . Imagine the scale and the impact that could affect millions of users. Given the evolution and progression of the digital age, we are growing our infrastructure team and are looking for passionate technologist to join us!
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

. 2+ years of IT infrastructure operations experience
. Computer/Server Hardware Troubleshooting experience
. Basic understanding of Network operation / support experience
. Written & verbal communication skills
. Ability to lift & install equipment up to 20kg it may require working in narrow spaces or in elevated locations while adhering to health & safety guidelines
. This role involves covering 24x7 shift rotation

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

. LINUX Operating System, Hardware or Networking certifications.
. Knowledge in virtual/cloud computing environments.
. Understanding of IT service management
. Understanding of Data Center environment safety and security.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

Job Description :
Do you love translating data, insights, and anecdotes into actionable results Are you obsessed with customer successes and supporting sales organizations Do you share a passion to make customers successful Do you believe that a deep understanding of customer and business data can change an organization Are you excited to discover and solve thorny business challenges through simplification and creative technology solutions Do you thrive in a dynamic environment working with diverse teams cutting across functions, organizations, and cultures to achieve a common goal

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world's most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform where your career can thrive. AWS offers over 100 fully featured services to millions of active customers around the world-including the fastest-growing startups, largest enterprises, and leading government agencies-to power their infrastructure.

The Private Pricing Deal Ops (PPDO) team supports the Private Pricing organization within AWS Sales to achieve the highest standards of operational efficiency & effectiveness. As a member of this team, you will leverage analytical skills and strong business acumen to provide solutions and simplify processes to drive operational effectiveness, build mechanisms that improve leadership decision-making, and manage strategic Deal Ops initiatives and activities in support of the APJ Strategic Customer Engagements (SCE) team. The SCE team is instrumental in driving the strategy, structuring, negotiations, and closure of private pricing deals, consisting of large, strategic, complex, or highly competitive commercial deals. The broad operational responsibilities will be to establish and execute operational goals, serving as a central point of contact for the APJ SCE team focused on driving deal cycle optimization & automation efforts to reduce deal team inefficiencies, establish inspection and audit mechanisms to monitor performance and identify what's working well, inspect for defects/opportunities and provide actionable insights that help inform strategic direction of the deal APJ SCE team, support resource planning & management, manage variable compensation plans, system and tooling onboarding and access, and setup and execute programs that increase the effectiveness of the APJ SCE team.
The successful candidate must have a long-term mindset, be a fast learner, likes being continually challenged, and demonstrates sound judgment even in ambiguous situations. Communication, attention to detail, follow through, ability to coordinate across teams will be second nature for being effective. This position requires the candidate to be a hands-on problem solver, diving deep to identify blockers for the APJ SCE team, and have an uncanny ability to unpack complexity and develop simple solutions. The candidate must have demonstrated expertise in data analytics and experience in owning Sales Ops activities, be proficient in process optimization, and have a penchant for conceptualizing & implementing automated mechanisms.

Preferred location where this position can sit: APJ (Singapore)

Key responsibilities
. Ownership of operational activities related to resource planning, compensation plans, and system and tooling access
. Ownership of inspection mechanisms, business rhythm and cadences (WBR, MBR, QBR, Pipeline Reviews) to more effectively audit and manage the SCE business
. Drive process optimization and automation initiatives to improve the efficiency, velocity and quality of the deal cycle.
. Proactively identify, track, and execute opportunities to improve operational performance, reduce SCE deal team administration and achieve key goals and targets.
. Collaborate with technical and non-technical teams as required to develop business or technology solutions, conduct proof-of-concept, and obtain buy-in from key stakeholders focused on improving SCE team efficiency
. Execute chosen solutions by creating project plans, identifying resources, and organizing cross-functional teams to implement future state process & tools.
. Be integral to the change management process ensuring adoption of new processes and tools through performance measures.
. Publish project trackers and flash reports to keep stakeholders informed on the status of strategic initiatives and projects.
. Help APJ SCE Leadership to effectively manage day to day deal cycle requirements by supporting pipeline management, quota attainment, forecasting and develop other analytical models using the appropriate business logic to provide actionable insights in an easy and meaningful manner.
. Support annual Private Pricing Deal Ops planning activities to create a plan with strategic initiatives and priorities supported by data and customer anecdotes.
. Support the tracking and execution of Private Pricing Deal Ops goals and associated operational metrics required to achieve the strategic objectives of the team.

Basic Qualifications :
. 5+ years of experience in strategy, operations, project/program management and leading process improvements
. Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Finance, Economics, Engineering, Computer Science, or related field.
. Experience working and communicating with senior executives. Should possess the technical and business acumen and judgment to act as an advisor to Deal Leaders to support data driven decision making.
. Demonstrated skills and passion for problem solving and operational excellence, with a proven ability to design & implement workable solutions.
. Advanced knowledge of MS Excel and working with large data sets
. Experience writing and running SQL Queries to support data analysis
. Experience gathering business requirements and developing and managing large projects for large organizations
. Experience leading and collaborating with cross-functional teams.
. Ability to consistently meet deadlines, and provide well-vetted reporting and business recommendations.
. Ability to work in a highly ambiguous environment.
Preferred Qualifications :
. MBA with work experience in a technology company, preferably in a Sales Ops capacity
. Highly organized and detail oriented, is able to operate successfully in a lean, fast-paced environment, that can think strategically, act tactically, and execute methodically.
. Entrepreneurial mindset with an aptitude for continuous innovation and creativity to develop solutions rapidly and iteratively.
. Motivated self-starter that is action-oriented and takes the initiative to proactively address challenges, willing to flex and help where needed.
. Committed to learning and expanding leadership capabilities, professional skills, and technical knowledge of both self and the team.
. Extensive process improvement experience that can drive business and technology transformation.
. Analytics experience and data driven decision-making mentality with ability to present complex results in a clear, concise and enticing manner that encourages action. Experience with transforming data and leveraging dashboards to produce actionable insights
. Proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously and to lead and influence teams that may not be within your organization.
. Meets/exceeds Amazon's functional/technical depth and complexity for this role.
. Meets/exceeds Amazon's leadership principles requirements for this role.
. Amazon.com is an Equal Opportunity Employer - Minority / Women / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation.

The Implementation Engineer works alongside Sales and Customer Success to discover customer business challenges and build unique solution prototypes to present back to decision makers, illustrating value and benefits of the KYC solutions via an engaging story.
You will have extensive experience in KYC software solutions and provide pre-sales and post-sales technical support to customers and partners across the EMEA and Asia regions. As the SME for the RDC products, you will design usage and technical integrations covering user interfaces, batch processing and SOAP/REST API Integrations.
Your responsibilities will include:
Understand the KYC systems that provide the service at a detailed level to assist in answering customer/partner questions.
Know KYC products and services including API framework, product roadmaps, new release functionality, and be able to speak to these items at a technical and non-technical level.

-- Collaborating with sales team to understand customer requirements, to promote the sale of KYC solutions and to provide sales support
-- Generating solutions based on the prospect's needs
-- Preparing and present technical solutions to prospects that address customer inquiries relating to security, encryption, API's, integration, data strategies, etc.
-- Developing, presenting, or responding to proposal specific customer requirements, including request for proposal responses
Run post-sales initiatives and activities to improve sales by:Coordinating or assisting with delivering the solution to the client
-- Supporting the client throughout the service period over the phone, via the computer or at the client premises
-- Thoroughly documenting the technical solution in precise detail, whilst being able to summarize the solution in a concise document or presentation to a lay person
Establish rapport with clients, from C-level executives, managers, and support staff
Achieve client consensus on recommendations prior to implementation
Be a point of contact through pre-sales and post-sales deliveries until customer is live
Partner with Integration team through larger customer onboarding deliveries.
Lead all aspects of technical integration deliveries through UI, batch processes, and API (SOAP/REST)
Capture new customer requirements and work with Product teams to document features, benefits, and
Assist in technical optimization efforts with proof of concepts and test
Assist in RFI/RFP responses for technical aspects
Up to 50% travel; travel based on operation needs
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in engineering, computer science, or equivalent IT-related degree program
7-9 years experience working in a technical role, ideally within a SaaS platform. Candidates with 3-6 years of experience will be considered for Associate - Implementation Engineer.
Experience in communicating technical information clearly and concisely in non-technical terms
Strong business discernment and problem-solving skills.
Working knowledge and understanding of APIs and databases interface
Previous experience working with APIs, familiar with SOAP and REST
Knowledge of file transfer protocols, IT security, SaaS applications, Cloud Services.
Moody's is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender expression, gender identity or any other characteristic protected by law.

Marketing Specialist
Avensys is a reputed global IT professional services company headquartered in Singapore. Our service spectrum includes enterprise solution consulting, business intelligence, business process automation and managed services. Given our decade of success we have evolved to become one of the top trusted providers in Singapore and service a client base across banking and financial services, insurance, information technology, healthcare, retail, and supply chain.
We are currently looking to hire a Marketing Specialist. This is an exciting opportunity to expand your skill set, achieve job satisfaction and work-life balance. More details as below.
ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Plan/execute to-partner marketing plans
Arrange lunch and learn and/or partner business planning/account mapping workshops to update partner on Equinix solutions/offers and/or develop business/marketing plan to drive demand (ie leads and pipeline) Promote partner central portal (PCP) to partner as the digital one-stop shop for sales and marketing support and provide concierge support Encourage partners to utilize assets in PCP to drive end user customers (EUC) demand-gen (either using partners agencies to customize or use Equinix agencies)
Plan/execute through-partner and with-partner marketing plans to drive leads and pipeline to partners customers and/or joint customer accounts.
Coordinate with agency to plan, execute activities to increase EUC awareness and demand (ie. leads and conversion to pipeline etc)
Monitor and report results from activities and provide report
KPI PCP engagement metrics, deal-reg, power of 3 activities, leads/pipeline generated etc
Review performance of marketing campaigns based on campaign targets to identify areas of improvement.
REQUIREMENTS
Bachelor's degree/ Diploma in related field
Minimum of 2-5 years of experience in Marketing
Familiar with tech industry particularly in IT Networking, Cloud, Storage & Data
Demand Generation
Set strategy, propose budgets and execute tactics in go-to-market campaigns to increase awareness and revenue pipeline demand generation
Proven success in planning, executing and managing marketing initiatives to, through, and with partners
Project Management
Managed marketing plans and campaigns from conception to implementation of marketing activities while benchmarking to attain business goals with prioritized partners
Digital Marketing
Conceive, develop and execute digital marketing activities resulting in incremental online traffic, new customer prospects and additional sales
Content Marketing
Develop and execute content marketing strategy to generate awareness and leads for pipeline
WHAT'S ON OFFER
You will be remunerated with an excellent base salary and entitled to attractive company benefits. Additionally, you will get the opportunity to enjoy a fun and collaborative work environment, alongside a strong career progression.
To submit your application, please apply online or email your UPDATED CV in Microsoft Word format to [HIDDEN TEXT]. Your interest will be treated with strict confidentiality.

Reg No: R1765546

The number one goal of everyone in our team is to make our Clients exceptionally happy. The Level 3 IT Support Engineer plays an important role in making sure that happens.
The Level 3 IT Support Engineer handles escalated support requests from Level 2 Engineer where they can't handle as well as any projects that require on-site implementation.
When help is needed the L3 IT Support Engineer can turn to the Team Leads and Technical Manager for guidance and support.
JOB RESPONSIBILITIES
Responsible for Level 3 support and escalations for network and System issues;
Configure and install network devices such as routers, switches, firewalls, load balancers, etc.
Monitor network to ensure optimum performance, reliability and availability;
Work closely with internal and external teams for problem resolution;
Perform maintenance and upgrades of systems and networks;
Check on resource utilisation for trending and capacity planning purposes;
Adhere to policies on change management to ensure success of such projects;
Implement security measures and ensure that policies are followed to reach the required level of security;
Work on and resolve escalated Helpdesk Tickets
Delight our Clients with a Friendly, Quick and Helpful Experience
Provide the Client with advanced on-site troubleshooting
Provide the Client with on-site installation & removal of equipment
On-Site Hardware Maintenance and Support
Use our Ticketing System to work on and resolve Helpdesk Tickets & Service Requests
Managing and recording all work though our Ticketing System
Make sure that Client Documentation in well maintained
Split tickets that have several issues into their own individual ticket
Make sure that tickets aren't stale throughout the process
From time to time the projects team will need additional resource to help deliver projects on-site
Create and maintain documentation for on-site processes
Escalate tickets that require Team Leads or Technical Manager support
Work with Level 1 and Level 2 Engineer to communicate to the client the status of their ticket every step of the way, notify them of any changes or outages related to their issue
Identify, Communicate and Mitigate potential risks to the Technical Manager and Clients
Follow the schedule provided by the Team Leads or Technical Manager or appointed Service Coordinator / Dispatcher
Follow Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) for daily / weekly recurring tasks
Follow all our Security Procedures and Keeping a Vigilant Eye for Security Issues
Identify opportunities for improvement and make constructive suggestions for change
Contribute to the process of innovative change effectively
Undertake other duties as required by the Technical Manager
JOB REQUIREMENTS
4 to 6 years of work experience
Diploma or Degree in Engineering (Electrical & Electronic, Computer Science, Telecommunication, Information System of the equivalent) or higer
CCNA certification would be an advantage
At least 4 years of hands-on experience in network device configuration and troubleshooting, as well as system and OS support.
Proven work experience as a Network Engineer, Technical Support Engineer, Desktop Support Engineer, IT Help Desk Technician or similar role
Hands-on experience with Windows/Linux OS environments
Good understanding of computer systems, mobile devices and other tech products
Good knowledge of cloud concepts and networking
Ability to diagnose and troubleshoot basic technical issues
Familiarity with remote desktop applications
Excellent problem-solving and communication skills
Ability to provide step-by-step technical help, both written and verbal
