Strong skills in Project Management covering planning, execution, monitoring and control including budget and resource management with excellent communication and interpersonal skills
1. Program Management:
a. Develop and execute the overall project plan and analyse project proposals which impacts the schedule and budget variance which in turn contribute to meeting the overall objectives of the project.
b. Responsible to track the quality, scope, timeline, effort (co-related to estimation, CR's, complexity), resources (includes GTO, business, contractor, Professional Services resources as well as operations),
c. Identify and schedule project deliverables, milestones and required activities and tasks.
2. Stakeholder Relationship Management
a. Act as the T&O point of contact for senior stakeholders and influencers of the designated business with regard to project program.
b. Support effective business change by building relationships with Business leaders, Support Functions, Technology and Operational business partners.
3. Change Implementation Planning & Management
a. Manage project pipeline for designated business
b. Prepare Investment approval/notation decks including business case, in collaboration with Business and Technology teams
c. Anticipate the business challenges, objectives of the T&O initiatives to be undertaken, high level budgets and success criteria.
d. Undertake scoping and evaluation of new initiatives. Defining overall considerations, including scalability, maintainability, cost, operations and technology principal risk to provide a recommendation.
e. Ensures that there is a business perspective on how the new operations and technical capabilities will be delivered to the business.
f. Spot potential problems, recognize the risk impact and propose risk mitigation strategies.
g. Governance
h. Develop and maintain the required governance for the projects or program supported e.g. coordinate PSC meetings including planning, preparation and tracking of actions pre and post meetings
i. Implement governance standards across the program, including tracking, monitoring and updating status of the program deliverables
j. Report project risks and issues proactively with transparency and help PSC to make informed decision. Identify emerging issues and resolve conflicts within the program
4. Sustainable Improvements
a. Improve quality of delivery and timelines aligned to business priorities which provide the highest ROI.
b. Reduce transaction cost by constantly looking to automate operational processes while designing, delivering change.
c. Build a sustainable process for measuring benefits to ensure projects are delivered on time (within contingency) and commercialized.
Requirement
Significant experience in managing large Transformation Program / Projects in a banking environment, preferably in HR Domain.
Minimum 15 years of relevant banking and project management experience
Experience of working with top consulting firms will be an added advantage
Complete understanding of project life cycle and Technology development models
Excellent stakeholder management and communication skills
Strategic forward thinking approach to challenges with outstanding influencing, negotiating and persuasion skills
Passionate, diligent individual with ability to thrive in ambiguity
Resourceful team player
Strong quantitative, analytical, problem solving and process design skills that can translate analysis into actions that meet business objectives
Understanding of technology and operational processes across functions / departments in the bank/market.
Experience in scoping and evaluation Defining overall considerations, including scalability, maintainability, cost, operations and technology principal risk to provide a recommendation
Familiar with implementation of Cloud HCM solutions will be advantageous

column7:
JOB DESCRIPTION: SENIOR ASSOCIATE (GENERAL COMMERCIAL, ADVISORY & TMT)
Collyer Law LLC is looking for a Senior Legal Associate to undertake a heady mix of legal work involving General Commercial, Advisory & TMT matters, to join a boutique Singapore law firm. The team includes 2 Directors with experience at leading international law firms, and 8 fee-earners.
Key responsibilities include:
In this role you will provide legal support to the existing clients of Collyer Law LLC with responsibility for drafting, reviewing and negotiating a broad range of technology-related agreements, including software licensing, SAAS/ PAAS, website terms of use, privacy policies, franchising, distribution, reseller, procurement and outsourcing agreements, as well as on general TMT matters such as data protection, and intellectual property advisory.
You will also have the opportunity to contribute to new business development and growth initiatives through participation in strategic projects with high business impact and visibility.
Key requirements include:
At least 5+ years PQE in top-tier Singapore or international law firm, or solid experience in-house at a technology company.
Professional admission in at least one of the following jurisdictions: Singapore, Malaysia, England & Wales, Hong Kong, Australia, New Zealand, or Canada.
Excellent academic background.
Good knowledge and understanding of commercial and technology-related matters.
Experience reviewing, drafting, and negotiating technology and commercial transactions, including for IT outsourcing, cloud services, and procurement.
Excellent English communication, both verbal as well as written
Ability to work in a multi-cultural and collegiate law-firm environment, and to work both autonomously and as part of a team as and when required.
Excellent technical skills with a practical approach to problem-solving.
Ability to handle pressure and work to challenging deadlines.
A desire and ability to grow, both as a specialist in the area and to assume a leading role within the firm.
We are ideally looking for a full-time lawyer, however, we are open to supporting flexibility, and would be happy to discuss what arrangements would work best for you.
ABOUT COLLYER LAW
Collyer Law LLC is a boutique Singapore law firm founded and staffed by experienced Big Law lawyers, with a particular focus on representing emerging growth companies and the innovation economy. We are best known for our idea-to-exit support for technology companies and venture investors, much like a Silicon Valley law firm, but in Asia.
Our goal is to offer legal services (and related support services) to clients in the most efficient manner possible consistent with maintaining a traditional attorney-client relationship and delivering high-quality work.
We act for clients across a range of Industry Sectors and have developed sector-focused groups which have invested in understanding the business models, opportunities, and challenges specific to such sectors, especially for technology-influenced sectors such as FINTECH, LIFESCIENCES & HEALTHTECH, DIGITAL COMMERCE & PLATFORMS, DIGITAL MEDIA, and SHARING ECONOMY.
Our current lawyers also have extensive Practice Area specialisms from their prior roles with Big Law and in-house. The firm has significant capabilities across practice areas such as MERGERS & ACQUISITIONS, PRIVATE EQUITY, VENTURE CAPITAL, BANKING & FINANCE, COMMERCIAL CONTRACTS, REGULATORY ADVICE, and TECHNOLOGY TRANSACTIONS.
In a short span of time, Collyer Law has received numerous awards and accolades, including from reputable legal directories and international legal industry publications, such as Legal 500, Chambers & Partners (Asia Pacific), Asian Legal Business, Asian Business Law Journal, Indian Business Law Journal and Global Law Experts (for TMT).

column2: Amazon Web Services Singapore Private Limited
column6: Saas  Negotiation  Account Management  Leadership  Analytical Skills  Problem Solving  Selling  Written Communication  Strategy  Presentation Skills  Business Development  Stakeholder Management
column7:
As AWS continues its exponential growth, we seek an experienced sales professional adept at building and managing relationships with c-level executives of highly visible customers in Singapore, working closely with customer teams to drive measurable business outcomes, and generating enthusiasm for the adoption of the most advanced cloud services available. This person will build a strong working relationship with the AWS senior leadership team for executive sponsorship, executive business reviews, and shaping go-to-market opportunities. The right leader is customer-obsessed, innovative, highly confident with hyperscale cloud, and capable of inspiring a diverse group of resources.

In our rapidly growing, fast-paced environment, our sales leaders demonstrate an ability to think strategically and analytically about sales, business, product, and technical challenges. They leverage creativity to build and convey compelling value propositions and work cross-organizationally to foster alignment and eliminate obstacles. The ideal candidates will have both a business background that enables them to drive an engagement and interact at the CxO/VP level, as well as a technical understanding that enables them to easily interact with developers and architects.

Responsibilities: The Global Account Manager is responsible for teaming with all aspects of the customer's organization, which includes executives, engineering, business owners, legal, and others. Skills required to build relationships across an account include creative thinking, articulating a clear vision and generating enthusiasm, to impact all business groups. The Global Account Manager is responsible for selling at the most strategic level within the account and implementing a broad strategy for earning customer acceptance and service implementation. This person works with all appropriate AWS resources (Executives, Solution Architects, Business Development, Marketing, Partners, Support, Service teams and Professional Services), including those that may be geographically distributed, to support customer interests, and will understand how to strongly advocate for their customer and balance that with the business needs of AWS.

You will join a team dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we're building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

Additionally, the Global Account Manager will:
Have the ability to earn trust with and influence CXOs and Top Executive with some of AWS largest accounts.
Partner closely with ASEAN Sales Leadership Team, field sales organization and Global Account Teams to develop and execute account strategies and identify opportunities to drive business expansion.
Engage, orchestrate, guide and coach extended account team members
Maintain robust sales pipeline. Develop and manage large, complex opportunities at all stages of the sales cycle.
Develop case studies and other forms of references highlighting activity and workloads running on AWS
Effectively leverage and communicate with internal executive resources WW Sales and Service Team leadership to advocate for customer interests.
Possess demonstrated decision-making, creative problem solving and negotiation skill. Resolve deal escalations.
Have experience working with large global organizations as the primary account relationship manager.
Demonstrate excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication, analytical skills and presentation skills.
Have the ability to keep pace in a rapidly changing environment, which requires prioritization, constant learning, juggling multiple responsibilities at once, and taking calculated risks
Basic Qualifications
Several years of enterprise technology sales as the lead account and relationship manager of a large global organization.
Track record of consistent business and sales performance in complex, direct/field enterprise sales
A bachelor's degree in business or technology or equivalent work experience.
Experience with and knowledge of Singapore based global enterprise companies
Industry knowledge in either Life Sciences, Consumer Goods Industrial, High-Tech, Manufacturing companies will be preferred.
Preferred Qualifications
15+ years of complex, field sales leadership experience in cloud, enterprise software or IT Services
Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication, analytical and presentation skills are required.
Experience as the primary account manager of a global federated enterprise working with multiple business units and influencing governance and policy is a plus.
BA or BS degree in computer science, engineering, business, marketing, or related field (MBA preferred)
Experience in large complex deal negotiations with a successful track record; establishing credibility quickly with senior level executives across the organizations.
Strong understanding of AWS and/or technology as a service (Iaas,SaaS,PaaS) would be preferred but not required.
Working knowledge of software development practices and internet-related technologies highly desired but not required.
Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

DESCRIPTION

Job summary
At Amazon.com, we're working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. Cloud Computing is revolutionizing Information Technology. Since early 2006, Amazon Web Services (AWS) has provided companies of all s with an infrastructure web services platform in the cloud. With AWS customers can requisition compute power, storage, and other services-gaining access to a suite of elastic IT infrastructure services as their business demands them. Customers pay only for what they use, with no up-front expenses or long-term commitments, making AWS the most cost-effective, flexible way to deliver their applications to their customers and clients. Since 2006 AWS is the leader in the global IaaS cloud computing space and is continually growing.

Would you like to be a central part of a recruiting team that is responsible for fueling the rapid growth of AWS globally Are you a builder Do you thrive in high growth ambiguous environments Are you a process oriented data driven recruiting leader that loves to dive deep to fix complex operational challenges allowing for greater scalability and global impact

The Amazon Web Services (AWS) Recruiting team is seeking a talented, customer-focused recruiting expert to join our global recruiting organization supporting AWS. This role will be responsible for working closely with various business stakeholders to define the sourcing strategy, generate high caliber talents and close top candidates all within a fast-moving and super dynamic environment. You will have the opportunity to draw on your extensive knowledge of Talent Acquisition and functional areas of the business and forge dynamic relationships with business leaders, hiring managers and HR business partners.

Core Responsibilities:
. Work closely with business in order to deeply understand teams organization structure, responsibilities, strengths/weaknesses and key business drivers. Utilize this information to develop most effective recruiting strategies.
. Build and maintain network of potential candidates through proactive market research and on-going relationship management, gauging chemistry of candidates for fit and motivation rather than simply sell a role. Meanwhile, manage to ensure all sourcing channels are sufficiently utilized, including but not limited to employee referrals, career portals, search firms, job fairs, etc.
. Consult on ideas and strategies related to recruitment that will contribute to the long-range growth of the company, implementing any new processes and fine tuning standard processes for recruiting that fits within Amazon's mission to deliver the highest quality results to the customer. Also, articulated in writing recruiting plans with deliverables, timelines and a formal tracking process.
. Active participation in the full cycle recruiting efforts, including emphasis on the capability of assessment skills to help evaluating candidates and ensuring the highest bar. Lead final assessment and selection process.
. In charge of the offer proposal and negotiation process.
. Manage well on all the data associated with the recruitment process. Data-driven thinking and systematic approaches in achieving the operation excellence.
. Emphasis on continuous improvement, as such it is expected that you will spend time to ensure ongoing education of hiring managers and interviews on recruitment best practice and interview skills training.
. Implement the recruitment tools/systems in region through active collaboration with global contacts.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

. Solid track record/experience in a search firm progressive recruiting experience, with a heavy focus on sourcing and candidate generation
. Experience building and utilizing a variety of sourcing plans and tools, including proactive phone and internet research.
. Experience managing and prioritizing multiple searches, projects and client relationships.
. Strong client focus and commitment to continuous improvement ability to proactively network and establish effective working relationships, continually seek new sourcing options, and develop creative approaches to delivering candidates to the customer.
. Excellent written and verbal communication skills
. Ability to execute recruiting strategy, including employer promotion in the marketplace, candidate management, and diversity sourcing.
. Independant and able to work with little direct supervision.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

. Analytic skills with ability to create, measure, and scale the right workflow between candidates, hiring managers, and the recruiting team.
. Strong consulting skills and demonstrated ability to work in a team environment
. Experience in recruiting in the region

Here at Amazon -
We embrace our differences and are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion.
Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment.
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we're building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

SOS provides a number of standard externally available compliance tools (Application Security, SIEM, Vulnerability Scanning) in an integrated portal that is developed in house.

SOS security specialist at IBM are the backbone of our strategic initiatives to protect IBM properties , IBM E&TS, provide completely compliance and audit solution for IBM customer and IBM. Security Operational Service team is providing asset of security and compliance tools for regulation and audit. We are looking for talent for delivery solution of source code protection to IBM development team for IBM product and service. At IBM, you will use the latest software development tools, techniques and approaches and work with leading minds in the industry to build solutions you can be proud of.

Provide daily support for source code protection solution include code signing and scanning tools.
Work solution delivery on application security like code scanning and code signing
Consultant and develop CI/CD pipeline solution
Technical support for business development
Co-ordinate extensively with extended SOS teams (networking, infrastructure and leadership) to maintain, establish and deliver the application security services for our clients

Development skill with Java or other related language.

Interest in Security and compliance.

CI/CD pipeline, like Jenkins
Open source project

column7:
Allegis Global Solutions is the exclusive Contingent HR services provider for one of the world's leading banks.
At Allegis Global Solutions we're proud to be the leader in global talent solutions. We draw upon decades of industry expertise to develop innovative tools, products, processes and strategies focused on outcome. Moreover, we're incredibly proud to have built a culture that empowers our people to make their mark while making deep connections that will last a lifetime. With our passion and culture for talent, we are truly transforming the way the World acquires talent.
Our Client is one of the world's most international banks with over 1,100 branches, offices and outlets in 67 countries. They operate in some of the world's most dynamic markets and have been for over 150 years. More than 90 per cent of their income and profits are derived from Asia, Africa and the Middle East. Their brand promise, Here for good, underlines their distinctive approach.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Strategy
Review the implementation of controls to improve Security posture for Cloud Native applications (including but not limited to microservices based architecture) conforming to the Bank's Global Information Security Policies and Standards
Work with various security service lines, product owners and Public Cloud Infrastructure services providers to evaluate various security solutions to be implemented for the Bank's cloud and container environments
Business
Create seamless development experience for our developers working with application and engineering team
Facilitate the implementation of container platform services with adequate security
Provide guidance on implementation of container service designs conforming to SCB Global Information Security Policies and Standards
Processes
Responsible for building and operationalizing security review of Cloud Native and Containerized Applications utilizing Public Cloud Infrastructure (IaaS and PaaS services from AWS and Azure) as well on-premises microservice based platforms
Perform the Threat Modelling for critical Cloud Applications, including Crown Jewels, using MITRE ATT&CK Framework or STRIDE as applicable.
Support internal and external audits
Support cloud delivery teams in building security controls delivered as code
Support security architecture and design reviews for Cloud Native applications, including microservices based architecture
Support the validation of service design implementation for containerized and non-containerized services
Support the review and onboarding of security monitoring use cases for various security events
Have a good understanding of Network Connectivity for Hybrid and Multi-Cloud environments
Have good understanding of Cloud and On-premise Network Patterns, resiliency models, and high availability
Have a good understanding of end-to-end Network Security for defence in depth
People and Talent
Provide thought leadership in supporting the Bank's cloud security requirements and providing suitable solutions
Risk Management
This role has key responsibility for continuous improvements in the Domain(s)s approach to risk identification and mitigation, control management and audit engagement within the framework set out by the relevant authorities.
Governance
Process includes the procedures and protocols on Domain Risk Meetings, MOM Templates, Audit Engagements, Risk Approvals, Risk Extensions, Risk Assessments and Risk reviews done by UORM's and ensure consistency across domains.
Maintain central data pertaining to Applications Support Risk & Control.
Ensure Awareness of Rules of Engagement w.r.t Risk Management to all PSS Managers, stakeholders either directly or through UORM's and Leadership to ensure consistency across domains Work with internal and external auditors support auditing requirements
Regulatory & Business Conduct
Display exemplary conduct and live by the Group's Values and Code of Conduct.
Take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of ethics, including regulatory and business conduct, across Standard Chartered Bank. This includes understanding and ensuring compliance with, in letter and spirit, all applicable laws, regulations, guidelines and the Group Code of Conduct.
Lead the Cloud and Container Security to achieve the outcomes set out in the Bank's Conduct Principles: Align with Bank's Cloud First and Secure by Design Strategy *
Effectively and collaboratively identify, escalate, mitigate and resolve risk, conduct and compliance matters.
Key Stakeholders
INTERNAL
SCB Security Engineering, Cloud Engineering, Cloud Operations Teams and Container Engineering Team
Cloud Security Management Team, Security Monitoring and Analytics
Technology Services Portfolio Manager
Service domain heads within Security Technology Services and Cyber Security Services
Support function departments needed to execute projects
EXTERNAL
Cloud Service Providers
Product vendors
Regulators
Special Interests Group
Other Responsibilities
Critical thinking and problem-solving skills
Decision-making
Communication skills
Influencing and leading
Teamwork
Conflict management
Adaptability
QUALIFICATIONS: Training, licenses, memberships and certifications
At least 10 years of professional experience working on Cyber Security and cloud domain
Must have - Certifications in AWS or Azure cloud
Container Certifications CKA, CKS, CKAD Desirable
Security certifications like CISSP, CCSP, CISM, CISA, SANS, etc Preferred
Substantial experience in the banking industry, including demonstrated success in a similar role.
Must possess sharp technical acumen, excellent interpersonal skills and multi-cultural awareness and sensitivity.
Ability to work with geographically dispersed and highly varied stakeholders

column7:
Overview:
Network Engineering is a global organisation that is part of the Foundational Infrastructure business unit and is based in multiple locations around the world. We engineer technologies, products and solutions across the entire network infrastructure. This includes networks hosting critical market data, exchange connectivity and e-commerce services, cloud connectivity, the global core backbone, the design of the physical network supporting campus-based users, inter-connectivity to regional offices. We are also involved in the development of software solutions to support all aspects of network automation. The team ensures that knowledge best practices and expertise are shared between regions promoting teamwork and collaboration.
Responsibilities (70% Engineering / 30% Support):
Design/development of strategic networking technologies to provide additional scalability and functionality.
Provide subject matter expertise in enterprise networking when collaborating on cross-platform projects with other infra and application teams
Owning the delivery of a variety of concurrent projects in varying scales from small to very large
Produce quality documentation
Hold a governance responsibility to ensure the design produced meets the standard
Take an active role in the product lifecycle; new technology introduction through to the demise
Working with networking product vendors and telecom service providers with regards to all of the above
Take an active role in the day-to-day and the stability of the platform by providing L3 operational support for business impacting and complex problems.
Participate actively in the Change & Problem management processes.
Take an active role in the lifecycle of the network environment; ensure hardware & software replacement on time to manage the operational risk.
Deliver training/knowledge sharing to the L1/L2 operations
Skills and Experiences:
Extensive technical experience in engineering and implementing networking technologies within large Enterprises, preferably within the financial sector.
In-depth knowledge of enterprise network topologies, protocols and networking technologies.
In-depth knowledge of design principles, products, technologies for data centers, user offices & network connectivity transport
Extensive technical and hands-on experience on Cisco Routers, Switches, Nexus, ASR, ISR product lines, Layer4-7 switching
High Availability (Citrix Netscaler preferred), Cisco IOS, IOS-XE, NX-OS, IOS-XR, Juniper JunOS, Arista EOS
Good appreciation of network security architectures, models and methodologies, authentication schemes, encryption techniques and standards, products
Excellent analytical, problem-solving and decision-making skills. Experience in analyzing packet capture is a plus.
Extensive experience with inter-networking design and implementation
Good communication skills are required as this person will be working in a multi-cultural environment.
Good project management experience
Appreciation of neighboring technologies: Market Data, Voice, Computing and Voice/Video
Appreciation of network programming experience in using netconf/restconf/YAML is a plus
Preferred Skills:
Team player who is able to work in a fast-paced, environment
Experience with network programming and automation
Experience with cloud-based network solution deployment
Experience working with and management of enterprise DNS/DHCP and IPAM solution

column1: Strategic Sales Lead, Enterprise Migrations and Transformation
column2: Amazon Web Services Singapore Private Limited
column6: Information Technology  Saas  Negotiation  Leadership  Strategy  Program Management  Written Communications  Project Management  virtual teams  Consulting  Commercials  Decision Making  Business Transformation
column7:
AWS is one of Amazon's fastest growing businesses, servicing customers in more than 190 countries, reshaping the way global enterprises consume information technology and powering the developers who are building the next generation of global industry leaders. AWS customers include some of the most innovative startups like Netflix, Pinterest, Spotify, Airbnb, and Instagram as well as some of the largest global enterprises like Shell International, Unilever, Hitachi, Sharp, Bristol-Myers Squibb, and Samsung. We help global and local enterprises to use cloud to remediate their legacy technology and build new innovative businesses.

The ASEAN Strategic Sales Team engages with selected Enterprise customers on strategic opportunities, delivering market-moving engagements predicated on exceptional customer business outcomes. They will use a consultative sales approach, resulting in a multi-dimensional business case demonstrating the distinctive business value of AWS, a strong board-level customer commitment, and compelling commercials and delivery model.

The Strategic Sales Lead will own a small number of strategic engagements. The successful candidate has a deep experience in selling large, complex, business outcome led proposals in the enterprise. S/he speaks the language of C-level executives, quickly grasps the unique challenges of an enterprise regardless of industry, and can frame the distinctive value of AWS in the specific context of the customer. S/he understands how to drive complex engagements to closure.

This position is based in Singapore.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
10+ years of experience in enterprise sales, consulting, business development, or other related fields
Proven ability to earn trust of business executives, engaging on business value level
Proven ability to rapidly build effective relationships across levels and functions within an enterprise, and within relevant partners (SIs / ISVs)
Deep understanding of complex decision making processes & dynamics in large enterprises
Exceptional commercial acumen and negotiation skills
Experienced dealing with typical procurement/legal/compliance processes & requirements
Strong analytical and financial skills, able to create compelling multi-dimensional business cases
Accustomed to deciphering dynamics in complex decision making processes, read (and effectively address) unarticulated concerns that hold back commitment to change
Able to operate successfully in a lean, fast-paced, high growth organization
Strong verbal and written communications skills are a must, as well as the ability to work effectively and deliver results across cross-functional, remote and virtual teams
A keen sense of ownership, drive, and scrappiness is a must this is a hands-on role
Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Finance, Economics, Computer Science, or related field
Experience operating within ASEAN context
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Experience in business transformation / consulting programs, change and program management; and advising customer on people and process implications
MBA or equivalent relevant business experience
Prior experience working in or with cloud service providers, SaaS providers, managed service providers
Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

column7:
Overall Purpose Of The Job
We are currently recruiting an EUC Solutions Expert to join our global End User Computing team. As part of an established team you will be responsible for envisioning and developing the technical solutions that meets the organization's End User Computing needs, advising on business transformation with the aim of aligning people, processes, and technology while fostering a relationship with our business partners as a trusted advisor.
You will work in close collaboration with the Enterprise Architecture team and will interface with multiple teams such as Infrastructure, Operations, Security and Application Development to design productivity platforms for end-users.
Responsibilities
Establish a globally deployed, supported and flexible Desktop infrastructure to allow Operation Teams:
1. to optimize and deploy images with necessary regional support
2. to operate patch management and anti-malware management
3. to secure and enforce data policies
4. to centrally manage licensing compliance
Engineer and support globally available end user solutions (e.g. Active Directory, SCCM, MDM, M365, Lync, Analytics, etc)
Provide technical and operational governance on the End User Computing environment
Identify and drive areas for service improvements in conjunction with the managed service provider
Expertise in Cloud technology (Azure/AWS), Mobility, end user experience monitoring tools, Operating Systems and software distribution technologies
Keep abreast of developments within the IT Industry that End User Computing Services are kept in line with defined or emerging industry standards.
Understand and apply knowledge of International SOS environment in order to deliver solutions that meet the needs of the business.
Orchestrate and work with key vendors and partners.
Conduct performance assessments in accordance with International SOS process.
Actively seek improvements to the team's process.
Actively participate in operational ITIL processes i.e. Incident, Change Management (CAB), Release Management, Problem Management, and Availability Management.
Communicate necessary information to all levels of the organization.
Requirements
Candidate must possess at least a Diploma, Advanced/Higher/Graduate Diploma, Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree, Master's Degree, Computer Science/Information Technology, Engineering (Computer/Telecommunication), Engineering (Others), Science & Technology or equivalent.
Tertiary qualifications in Computer Science/Engineering or a related discipline.
At least 5 to 7 years in enterprise infrastructure operations
Familiar with End User Computing technologies
Preferably Senior Executives specializing in IT/Computer - Network/System/Database Admin or equivalent.
Full-Time position(s) available.
Must have ability to work in a fast pace environment demonstrating autonomy in conforming to strategic intent while adhering to team values at all times.
Relevant IT experience, including desktop management, backup, patch management, monitoring, security, performance and capacity.
EUC engineering SME experience within an IT service provider or internal IT organization.
Experiencing in deploying and managing SaaS based end-user services such as O365, Cloud backup, Okta, MDM.
Strong knowledge of engineering, designing and deploying End User Computing products or solutions.
Demonstrated project leadership experience.
Excellent communications and interpersonal and presentation skills.
Excellent communication and reporting skills.

DESCRIPTION

Job summary
Would you like to be part of a team focused on driving adoption of Amazon Web Services (AWS) with prospective customers and partners Do you have the business savvy and the technical acumen necessary to help establish Amazon Web Services as the premier cloud provider

As an Inside Sales Representative, Thailand with Amazon Web Services (AWS), you will be an important member of the sales organization. You will play a critical role in driving the full sales process from prospecting for new customer acquisition to driving expanded cloud adoption within the existing customer base.

Working in collaboration with marketing, solution architects, field sales, and the partner teams, the Inside Sales Representative's primary objectives is to deliver revenue performance, support customer adoption of AWS services, and deliver a world-class customer experience.

Roles & Responsibilities:

. Responsible for prospecting and new business acquisition for assigned territory
. Ability to identify opportunities during the tele-qualification process and drive full sales process to resolution
. Understand the business development process and is able to overcome competitive and technical objections while positioning AWS services products correctly to satisfy customer requirements
. Ability to articulate and deliver prepared business content that describe AWS services and pricing in order to persuade potential customers to adopt AWS
. Achieve monthly business goals including but not limited to pipeline generation and closed revenue
. Maintain a prescribed cadence of out-bound activity
. Stay current on Amazon Web Services products, technology and business technical certifications
. Partner with the broader country team to establish and execute the go to market strategy as well as with individual customers
. Record all customer information and maintain detailed tele-qualification records, in the CRM on each prospective customer
. Serve as internal business support and field questions from prospective and existing customers
. Must be proficient in English and Thai Language.

#awsthailand

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

. Fluent in English and native proficiency level in Thai language
. 4+ years of high tech sales experience
. Track record of meeting and exceeding established business goals

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

. Professional, ambitious, determined and results oriented mind set
. Positive attitude, team oriented, self-starter who can work alone and in a collaborative manner to achieve team goals
. Basic knowledge of cloud technology
. Knowledge of CRM
. BS/BA degree required, Masters or MBA degree is a plus
. Previous experience in high technology or B2B space

As an IBM Application Architect, you directly help clients transform their business and solve complex problems. You will define the scope and vision for projects that deliver customized solutions using your knowledge of IBM platforms. You are a technical leader, serving as a liaison among business partners, technical resources, and project stakeholders.
Your Role and Responsibilities
As an OpenShift Developer Specialist, you would design and develop technical solutions for Cloud migration & applications modernization efforts. You will have proven coding and hands-on experience in containerization of applications leveraging OpenShift and Kubernetes.

You directly help clients transform their business and solve complex problems, develop solutions for modernizing existing architecture (cloud or non-cloud) to hybrid cloud architecture leveraging RedHat OpenShift. You are a technical SME, serving as a liaison among business partners, technical resources, and project stakeholders.
Implement Cloud Container Re-platform and Refactor Modernization Architecture & Technology
Provide technical definition in containerization of applications leveraging OpenShift and Kubernetes
Apply technical, functional knowledge to convert application code into container through modular design.
Known as the Cloud Developer/ Specialist in your organization, with proven track record driving pattern identification and estimation of the application workloads, migrated & modernized to the target Cloud environment
Perform application-level discovery, acts as a Trusted advisor for the client by listening to their pain points and considering the industry the client sits in
SME on RedHat OpenShift migration and modernization tools including install, configure and optimize as per engagement requirement.
Engages the client (at the technical level) and IBM team to create the application design, including containerization, API, Microservices creation, or other forms of Modernization
Main development interface with client executive(s) to clarify technical program status in a clear and concise manner
Promotes innovation across the solution and delivery phases by leading the Design thinking workshops leveraging Agile methodologies and DevSecOps, including continuous integration, continuous testing and continuous delivery
Co-leads with the Program Manager by providing significant contribution on Technical elements of WBS/Sprint planning, estimation, risk, dependencies and Minimum viable product (MVP)
Responsible for full stack security design
Required Technical and Professional Expertise
7+ years of experience with developing cloud-native applications using a microservices architecture
3+ years of working experience with AWS, Azure, IBM Cloud or RedHat OpenShift
3+ years of experience with developing applications using containers (Docker), Kubernetes, EKS/AKS/GKE
Knowledge on legacy modernization code refactoring.
Knowledge on application code conversion (Engineering to Cloud - Micro services, API)
SME on building microservices, APIs, convert workloads into RedHat OpenShift Container Platform from legacy application code base.
Hands on experience with at least one enterprise development tools (Java or Node.js, dotnet), Front-end/UI frameworks such as Angular or React.
Experience developing with a database (RDMS or NoSQL)
Experience leading agile teams as a Squad Lead or Senior Developer
Hands on experience in applying DevOps/DevSecOps/Systems Reliability Engineering and creating/using a CI/CD pipeline
Preferred Technical and Professional Experience
Experience with Java Spring Boot
Experience with Cloud Foundry
Experience with event-based architectures
Experience with leading agile teams in a large project requiring coordination between teams/squads
Experience with working with Product Owners/Managers
Experience with Extreme Programming or SCRUM
Experience with Test-Driven Development (TDD) and/or Behavior-Driven Development (BDD)

column7:
The Role
A highly qualified analytics professional with experience optimizing multiple digital marketing channels, as well as leading projects & analysts to greatness, the Analytics Director is tasked with taking media & marketing analytics to the next level.
The ideal candidate will demonstrate a real passion not just for data, data management and technology but also for creative story-telling that scales understanding and results in tangible actions.
The Analytics Director will be responsible for defining the advanced analytics road map for Asia Pacific markets with proven expertise in the field. The candidate must be hands-on with leading digital analytic tools to: provide insights on customer journeys across various digital platforms, analyze and optimize ROI on digital campaigns, conceptualize A/B testing, build digital specific segmentations on channel/purchase preferences, dashboard development, and collaborate on attribution methodologies.
Candidate must be client facing, have proficiency with Google Marketing Cloud and Adobe tech stack components, and have exposure to data visualization tools like Datastudio, Tableau or Datorama.
Key Responsibilities:
Design & implement an Analytics and Insights roadmap, specifically relating to data driven strategy and activation with a focus on the productization of analytics as well as the technology and data infrastructure to deliver best in class analytics solutions.
Architect group level solutions that drive excellence and efficiency within our analytics and reporting capability and which leverage best in class technology and software to drive results.
Work with internal stakeholders to enhance analytic processes and develop new capabilities to increase real-time media allocation optimization.
Own the analytics relationship with clients and agency teams for all aspects of standard and advanced analytics including attribution, media effectiveness measurement and digital reporting.
Present to clients (and possibly prospective clients) on the value of analytics while exploring opportunities for the monetization of analytics products.
Provide support in developing analytic responses to client strategic issues. Topics may include media mix modeling, cross-channel attribution, and strategic budgeting decisions, digital KPIs.
Manage the Analytics team to ensure that objectives are being met in a timely and cost-efficient manner and manage resources effectively.
Job Requirements:
10+ years of relevant experience using analytical methodologies to solve business, marketing, and media challenges
Working knowledge in a statistical programming language (such as R, Python, Knime)
Working knowledge with AWS and/or Google Cloud is highly desirable
Experience in relational databases and high proficiency in using data querying tools (such as SQL)
Understanding of digital media channels (such as programmatic, search, social)
Experience designing and measuring media- and audience-based tests using test & control, A/B testing or multivariate testing approaches
Expertise with advanced analytic techniques, such as multivariate regression analysis, Bayesian shrinkage, predictive modeling, logistic regression, factor analysis, sales forecasting, response prediction, advertising effectiveness, market mix and ROI measurement, data visualization, simulation and optimization.
Comprehensive understanding of metrics: Media (e.g., impression, GRP, CPV etc.), Measurement analytics, Quantitative business measures (LTV, ROI, Effectiveness, etc.), Statistics (Correlations, sample sizing, t-value VIF etc.).
Working experience with visualization platforms such as Tableau, Microsoft PowerBI or DataStudio
Able to lead complex multi-dimensional engagements that combine agency services, data management and consulting
Able to think strategically and articulate complex challenges and solutions to non-technical audiences
Organized, structured and able to work against clear objectives and timelines. You are known for an optimistic can-do attitude
Skilled at influencing without authority while navigating siloed organizational structures

Description
We are looking for an experienced Delivery Manager in Singapore to make the team stronger.
We Value
Value the individuals We encourage and motivate people to grow. We perceive our people as a source of our success.
Strive for excellence We strive for the highest standards of excellence and continuously learn. We take pride in our engineering and accomplishments.
Act as a team We treat one another with respect and encourage the best ideas to come from anywhere within the organization. We value our diversity.
Focus on Customers We build long term customer relationships, as we strive to always understand our customers business and needs.
Act with integrity We operate legally, honestly and ethically. We take responsibility for our actions.
We Offer
Friendly team and enjoyable working environment
Work-life balance and flexible schedule
Online training library, mentoring, career development and potential partial grant of certification
Unlimited access to LinkedIn learning solutions
Referral bonuses
Compensation for sick leave and paid time off
Opportunities for self-realization
Responsibilities
Drive projects, sub-projects or streams with average team size of 15+ FTEs. Responsible for end to end delivery of modules and/or solutions, communication with the customer, and handling all the project-related delivery matters
Take a proactive part in suggesting technologies, tools, and approaches, advocates the best engineering practices and tools for effective use.
Responsible for the technical aspects of delivery including but not limited to solutioning, architecture, DevOps.
Responsible for technical staffing and resources allocation, matching people for successful project delivery.
Contribute to the presales: estimations, architecture proposals, and documentation.
Introduce best practices & processes as well as delivery management knowledge to the team and to the project.
Responsible for developing and executing the succession plan of the project.
Take a proactive role in contributing to the best delivery management practices and processes within the company.
Lead the team by example, creates a learning environment, and manages people performance in production setup.
Recognize and understand the agenda and perspective of others and balances the interests of all parties involved.
Identify problems, actively works to resolve issues by focusing on listening and understanding. Escalate timely if help is needed.
Handle direct line communication with the client on behalf of a team or project deliverables.
Requirements
Master's degree or above in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Information Technology, or related majors
At least 10-13 years of IT experience with at least 5 years of experience in Agile/Scrum

Solid skills on Software Engineering practices. Experience in cloud and micro-service technologies. Experience in DevOps tools and practices
Experience in AnyLogic simulation tool, ADF Oracle framework, Oracle BPM

Able to analyze, design and deliver a full stack technical solution to the client.
Able to translate architecture into detailed implementation plan. Can read and comprehend code and architecture of full stack technical solution respectively to project objectives.
Able to setup and follow the project process based on a real need. Strong in effort estimation, planning and scheduling delivery.
Skilled in the development of enterprise applications in Banking, Retail or Life Science business domains
Team player with good time management skills
Experience in multinational, multilanguage and multicultural environments
Excellent communication ability

About Us
Contour is looking for motivated and highly talented individuals to help grow the company and achieve its hugely ambitious goal. Contour prides itself on having an excellent internal culture, where we strive hard to create the best possible working environment: a healthy mix of change, fast pace, supportive atmosphere, ecosystem collaboration and of course, fun.
Contour hires team members of excellent calibre in every role. While a lot will be asked of you, you will benefit greatly from working in open, collaborative team, with colleagues who excel. Working at Contour is fast-paced and team-oriented with an emphasis in delivering the highest quality work in every field to ensure our own and our member's success as we reshape the industry.
Context of the role:
Reporting to the Chief Product Officer, the Head of Engineering is responsible setting the technical strategy and managing the teams responsible for building our decentralised network. You will work closely with the Product team to define future requirements, with the engineering leads for their implementation and the operations team to ensure a successful rollout and implementation. You will be hands-on where required to demonstrate your deep technical understanding and commitment to quality. You will also be expected to maintain knowledge of the latest application technology trends (Web 3, Defi) and collaborate with our partners and customers on industry-transforming solutions.
Key Responsibilities:
Maintain an active understanding of the latest technology trends and their potential use within to Contour, reporting regularly to senior management
Formulate and deliver the technical strategy for the company aligned to the business objectives
Ownership of all delivery against agreed scope and plans.
Collaborate closely with the People team for day to day management of the engineering team and 3rd party vendors.
Drive continuous improvement within the team - increasing delivery efficiency, improving quality and team happiness.
Represent engineering strategy and interests when partnering with the Product Team to plan the product roadmap
Work with Contour's partners and customers to design multi-company/system architectures.
Job requirements
Key Requirements
5+ years of relevant experience in leading high performing engineering teams using the latest technology stacks.
7-10 years experience as a senior software engineer in at least 1 programming language (Java, JavaScript, Python, Go, etc), with hands-on experience in many others.
Solid understanding of Web 3.0 and blockchain/DLT architectures.
Track record of inspiring, leading and growing high performing teams across geographies
Be hands-on where required to resolve conflicts with the team or to support production incidents
Hands on experience with modern development tooling (IDE's, build and deployment pipelines, git, etc)
Hands on experience with public cloud providers like AWS, Azure, GCP
Strong understanding on how web application work and the fundamentals behind them (i.e. HTTP, DNS, Web Servers, etc)
Proven experience in analysing and decision making for both technical and non-technical decisions
Confident and comfortable presenting and facilitating meetings for large audiences
Strong analytical skills to question architecture and product decisions
Able to demonstrate a strong understanding of modern SDLC methodologies
Effective communication with cross functional team members, business stakeholders and external parties
Nice to havePublishing of Technica papers / participation in technology forms, seminars
Hands-on experience with blockchain technologies
Financial / Trade finance domain knowledge

Responsibilities:
Support IT infrastructure service lifecycle and information security strategy management
Duties include but not limited to:
Cybersecurity:
Identifying and managing Cyber Security risks for the organization.
Establish and maintain an information security strategy in alignment with organization goals and objectives.
Review and enhance IT policies, standards, guidelines and best practices
Ensure effective implementation and compliance to the Cyber Security policies, standards and procedures.
Provide security consultancy and architecture review to ensure compliance in the area of information security polices and guidelines.
Promote IT risk management, governance and compliance culture across the organization.
Perform IT Security audits and risk assessments as well as implement risk mitigations measures.
Carry out monitoring of systems for security anomalies and detection of breaches.
Conduct IT security awareness training to improve cybersecurity knowledge of users and IT staff.
Review and enhance organization's BCP and disaster recovery plan.
Recommend and implement cybersecurity-related improvements.
Continuous enhancement of information security against new threads.
Ensue server, network systems and end-user PCs are well secured and protected.
IT Infrastructure:
Streamline IT processes to improve the business operation and efficiency in man-power usage.
Drive automation in suitable IT processes and recommend new technologies.
Perform and participate in capacity planning, redundancy planning and execution of Disaster Recovery Plan.
Ensure high availability of IT services and perform regular backup of business data and application systems.
Analyze critical logs, investigate and troubleshoot technical issues.
Evaluate and prioritize improvements to the organization's IT infrastructure.
Setup, configure and troubleshoot server systems in Windows and Ubuntu platform.
Design, setup, configure and troubleshoot network systems .

Knowledge in hybrid-cloud environment and AWS.

Degree in Computer Engineering, Information Systems, or related field.
At least Cyber Security certification such as CEH, CISM or CISSP or CISA .
Possess three (3) years of relevant working experience.
Keen interest and experienced in managing enterprise-level cybersecurity solutions .
Experience in Windows and Linux Servers.
Knowledge in DMZ, VLAN, server hardening and firewall administration.
Strong IT Technical understanding and aptitude for analytical problem solving.
Enthusiasm for problem-solving and able to work in fast-pace environment.
Team player with high initiative, self-motivation and results-oriented mind-set.
Experience in complex secured network design, VPN and WLAN implementation.
Familiar with data storage systems, NAS devices and server virtualization.
Good communication, documentation, organizational and interpersonal skills.
Experience with networking, system administration and infrastructure architecture.
Candidates with more years of experience may be considered for manager position.
Other Information
Working Locations: Toa Payoh
Working hour:
Monday to Fridays: 9.00 am to 6.00 pm
Alt Sat: 9.00 am to 1.00pm

On the Job Training will be provided
Conducive working environment
Great Career Progression

column7:
We are looking for a passionate and professional Automation Specialist to join our team and assist with our digital initiatives.
Based in Singapore and reporting into the Section Head, the incumbent will responsible for the overall quality of products in Digital Factory.
However, we also recognize that each individual has a unique blend of skills. Whether your strength is in test cases or in automation, we want to talk to you.
What You'll Do
You will analyze test case specifications and create automated test cases for the project, compile and organize automated test cases so that specific testing scenarios can be run without intervention
You will be responsible for breaking down the test plan into individual test cases, run the test cases during testing, and ensure that all bugs are reported to the project team and accurately communicated the impact of the bugs
You will document individual test cases in the testing platform, review past test cases periodically for optimization, test code for enhancements/bug fixes to ensure compliance quality assurance policy requirements and best practices and in accordance with business requirements
You will work closely with the project team to report bugs from the projects/enhancement, ensure resolution of the bugs, conduct prioritization of bugs, leveraging business understanding and technical comprehension of the issue
You will develop and maintain manual and/or automated test suites, communicate with project members on requirements, issues, and improvements, drive and improve quality-related processes, share knowledge and keep up to date with existing and upcoming technologies
Who You Are
You will need a degree in Computer Science/Engineering, Information Science/Related IT Discipline
You will need at least 2-3 years of experience with experience in software testing
You should have knowledge of software testing processes, test automation, build and testing frameworks, and continuous integration pipelines for enterprise web applications
You should have experience in coding and software development of any kind, working with Agile, Lean and/or Continuous Delivery approaches and best practices, such as Continuous Integration, TDD, BDD, Infrastructure as Code, and e2e Test Automations.
You should have experience in test case management using Testrail, Xray or similar tools; Selenium, Appium or other test automation tools; Postman or other API testing tools; UI or UX design; understanding of, and interest in digital trends and new technologies
You should have knowledge of AWS cloud infrastructure and services and in-depth knowledge of new and established technologies and programming languages such as Reactjs, Kotlin, Angular, Typescript, Node, Terraform
You should be proficient in Software Development Best Practices (SCM / Unit Tests)
You should have experience in deploying customer-facing software into a production environment and a comprehensive knowledge of digital products, services and platforms
You should have excellent communication skills with stakeholders and colleagues, a great attention to detail
You should be self-motivated and likes to take initiatives
Benefits
Competitive salaries
Flexi Benefits
Staggered working hours
Medical Insurance
Corporate Mobile Plans
Singapore Pools welcomes you not for how you look, where you come from, or differences you may have. We want you here for who you are. Diversity at the company helps us see a greater picture represented by different voices, helping us in contributing back to the society. So, feel free to express who you are, and be proud of your heritage and personal experience as you begin your journey with us!
Singapore Pools was established by the Government on 23 May 1968 to provide safe and trusted betting to counter illegal gambling. As a not-for-profit organisation, all of Singapore Pools surplus is channeled to Tote Board to fund a wide range of causes in social service, community development, sports, the arts, education and health. Currently, Singapore Pools contributes about $2 billion annually to the Government in the form of taxes and duties, and for the funding of good causes.

About NTT Data Singapore
We are a top 6 global IT services company with operations in 50+ countries. We offer an advanced portfolio of application, business process, cloud, and infrastructure services to businesses and governments worldwide.
NTT DATA Singapore PTE Ltd is a wholly-owned subsidiary of NTT DATA Corp, a part of NTT Group, the world's 65th Largest Company according to Fortune Magazine. The Singapore entity of NTT DATA is an S10 government-registered supplier and forms the core of NTT DATA's APAC operations and is positioned as a gateway of our global capabilities in Singapore and the APAC region.
At NTT DATA SINGAPORE, we pride ourselves on being an inclusive and equal opportunity employer that puts our people and clients first. We welcome different ideas, backgrounds and passionate individuals to join us in our inclusive environment to achieve stronger and better results through teamwork, foresight, and innovation. We pledge to create a harmonious and nurturing culture, where all individuals feel a sense of pride and belonging, regardless of age, gender identity, race, sexual orientation, physical or mental ability, ethnicity.
Responsibilities:
Sales of our identified IT solutions, like Microsoft, SAP, Oracle, and so on, to the Japanese Multi-National Companies in the Singapore enterprise sector.
Develop business opportunities pipelines, identify new leads, expand current clientele base and achieve sales targets.
Build strong customer relationships and continuous engagement of existing customers.
Work closely with relevant departments to ensure customers satisfaction.
Pre and post-sales account management.
Accelerate our business and market share.
Requirements:
Ideally, 5+ years of IT experience in a similar-level role in consultancy/advisory.
Experience in sales or pre-sales to the Japanese Multi-National Companies in the Singapore enterprise sector.
Understanding of sales, solution development, and knowledge or experience with multiple solution integration.
Experienced in developing implementation plans, statements of work, solution and architecture diagrams or project deliverables.
End to end delivery of any solutions.
Fluent in Japanese language proficiency is an added advantage, as this position requires handling Japanese-speaking stakeholders.
Only shortlisted applicants will be contacted.

column7:
We are a top 8 global IT services company with operations in 50+ countries. We offer an advanced portfolio of application, business process, cloud, and infrastructure services to businesses and governments worldwide.
NTT DATA Singapore PTE Ltd is a wholly-owned subsidiary of NTT DATA Corp, a part of NTT Group, the world's 65th Largest Company according to Fortune Magazine. The Singapore entity of NTT DATA is an S10 government-registered supplier and forms the core of NTT DATA's APAC operations and is positioned as a gateway of our global capabilities in Singapore and the APAC region.
At NTT DATA SINGAPORE, we pride ourselves on being an inclusive and equal opportunity employer that puts our people and clients first. We welcome different ideas, backgrounds and passionate individuals to join us in our inclusive environment to achieve stronger and better results through teamwork, foresight, and innovation. We pledge to create a harmonious and nurturing culture, where all individuals feel a sense of pride and belonging, regardless of age, gender identity, race, sexual orientation, physical or mental ability, ethnicity.
Description:
What do we offer
Direct Contract for 12 MONTHS, Renewable subjected to performance
Work Location: Changi
Salary: $3000 to $9000
Requirements
At least 4-7 years of relevant Infrastructure support and OS administration
Minimum 3 years hands-on working experience managing production application support
Knowledge in MQ, Elastic Search, AWS would be preferred
Hands-on experience in RHEL 6/7 OS patching, administration and shell scripting.
Good command in Microsoft Office products
Experience in monitoring tools like Dynatrace would be handy.
Must have good communication and writing skills. Able to drive meetings and coordinate different stakeholders.
Responsbilities
Drive infra project life cycle Server provisioning to Cutover
Work with infra and app teams on requirement gathering to implementation.
Review and analyze infrastructure architecture and identify the gaps.
Expertise on Infrastructure Project builds / Management.
Expertise in OS Administration ( Windows + Linux + AIX ), Apache, JBOSS, IBM WebSphere , IBM IHS , IIS Administration.
Expertise in administering AWS Cloud, containerization technologies (Kubernetes, Docker, ECS, EKS).
Skilful knowledge on CHAOS Engineering.
Candidate with operational experience, preferably in support of critical application systems will have an advantage.
The candidate should have strong infrastructure/technical background with knowledge on Open Systems platform, Firewall and load balancer, and moderate information security knowledge
Have good leadership skills in working with application teams and service providers in defining infrastructure deployment plan, cutover/migration strategy and test plan.
Have a good understanding of ITIL processes
Perform RHEL OS patching and other administration tasks for cloud projects
Guide app team to troubleshoot infra related issues.
Be the SME for Linux administration and automation.
Operation & Process:
Prepares technical project plans for new initiatives in BAU
Collaborates with Application teams and other infra teams to develop technical solutions and enhancements.
Drive the on boarding of new applications on to the production environment.
Maintain Security:
In accordance with Bank's security directives, assists to deploy, maintain, and enhance the security of all infrastructure systems through administrative, preventive, detective, and reactive controls, such as change and configuration management, anti-virus measures, patch management, and system scans.
Perks and Benefits
14 days Annual Leave
14 days Medical Leave
Medical Insurance Coverage
Interested candidates, please email your resume to [HIDDEN TEXT]

DESCRIPTION

Are you energized to create new markets for Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning (ML), and Deep Learning (DL) technology Do you love building new businesses

AWS is seeking an AI/ML GTM Specialist to define, build and lead the business development efforts at AWS to commercialize the AWS AI/ML platform. As an AI/ML Specialist you will be responsible for defining, building and deploying effective and targeted programs to accelerate broad based sales and business development activities for the AWS ML platform.

You will work directly with customers on a daily basis to help them select the right AWS AI/ML technologies. Your work will define and drive the process that the organization follows to accelerate sales and partner engagements of the AWS AI/ML portfolio in your region and you will synthe data and information gathered from these customers and partners into the AWS GTM strategy for machine learning to successfully commercialize the platform in the local market. This entails deriving succinct findings, developing strategic insights, and persuasively communicating those findings and perspectives from customer engagements to product and sales teams, including senior management.

You will be the outward face of AWS AI/ML across APJ and will define and execute the market development activities for key AI/ML services including Amazon SageMaker and Amazon Fraud Detector. You will leverage worldwide programs or campaigns and work closely with AWS Specialists for other technologies (Containers, Serverless, Analytics), sales, marketing, solutions architects, and partner teams, to position the AWS AI services for customers and partners. You will also be helping AWS Sales become more comfortable with AI/ML use cases and technologies.

The ideal candidate will possess a business and machine learning or data analytics background, and will have a foundation of having directly driven customer engagements and interactions at the highest levels of large enterprises and technology partners. The candidate will have the technical depth and business experience to easily communicate the benefits of AI/ML services, platforms and frameworks in the AWS cloud to IT architects, engineering teams, and C-Level executives.

Additionally, the ideal candidate will have a demonstrated ability to think strategically and long-term in an ambiguous environment. The ideal candidate will be deeply familiar with complex legacy IT environments, managed enterprise IT infrastructure services, enterprise applications, and will have performed market analysis, deal negotiation and construction, field readiness, and business operations. Finally, the candidate will have a background that enables them to create scalable programs that apply holistic approaches to selling to enterprises and enterprise partners.

Knowledge across payments fraud, promotions abuse, account takeovers, faked accounts / reviews would be an advantage in this role.

Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have twelve employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon's culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn't about how many hours you spend at home or at work it's about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we're building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Our senior members enjoy one-on-one mentoring and thorough, but kind, code reviews. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded engineer and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

Basic qualifications
. 10+ years of technology related sales or business development experience
. BA/BS degree or equivalent experience required
. 10+ years experience in enterprise selling, outsourcing, management consulting or managed services (preferably cloud)
. 3+ years working domain experience in machine learning, artificial intelligence, or related technologies
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

Preferred qualifications
. Graduate degree in a highly quantitative field (Computer Science, Machine Learning, Operations Research, Statistics, Mathematics, etc.)
. 5+ years of industry experience in predictive modeling and analysis . Ability to develop experimental and analytic plans for data modeling processes, use of strong baselines, ability to accurately determine cause and effect relationships
. Consulting experience and track record of helping customers with their ML/AI needs
. Publications or presentation in recognized Machine Learning, Deep Learning and Data Mining journals/conferences
. Past and current experience writing and speaking about complex technical concepts to broad audiences in a simplified format
. Experience giving public presentations

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us

DESCRIPTION

Job summary
Do you have a passion to install, deploy, service and maintain mission critical IT infrastructure in one of the world's largest and fastest-growing cloud data centers Are you looking to expand your horizon in an exciting and dynamic work environment that encourages creativity and boundless opportunities for career development Do you enjoy solving problems and delivering value-adding results

If you answered yes to any of these questions, then Amazon Web Services Data Center is the place to be!

In this role as a Data Center Operations Engineer (DCO Engineer), you will be responsible for the on-site management of hardware lifecycle of our Singapore IT infrastructure.

You will troubleshoot technical issues on advanced hardware, ranging from servers, storage and networking devices on a 24/7 basis. Working with key technical subject matter experts, you will have the opportunity to participate in the design, implementation and commissioning of our advanced IT infrastructure. Drive & implement projects to enhance operational efficiencies with opportunities to share experiences and knowledge with our global network of technical experts.

As a successful DataCenter Systems Engineer, your day-to-day work will include:
. Installation and configurations on Data center Servers and Network systems
. Installation, troubleshooting and replacement of internal and external hardware parts of Servers and Network devices
. Perform storage media (HDD, SSD etc.) sanitization and destruction tasks
. Work within a ticket-based environment and work on systematic problem resolution
. Movement of equipment with assisted lifting machinery.
. Work on rotational shift-based schedule to maintain high system reliability by prioritizing trouble tickets
. Collaborate with internal teams (DC operations, DC Engineering, Logistics, Security, Projects etc.) sharing ideas and contribute in innovative projects to improve DC work environment and overall efficiencies.
. Participate, lead and deliver small to mid-scale projects including new Data Center rollout

About the team
The Data center Operations Teams are pivotal to ensuring the continuality and high availability of one of the world's fastest-growing cloud data centers around the world. As one of the cutting-edge data centers, we manage customers data for major MNCs and emerging companies alike, at a . Imagine the scale and the impact that could affect millions of users. Given the evolution and progression of the digital age, we are growing our infrastructure team and are looking for passionate technologist to join us!
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

. 2+ years of IT infrastructure operations experience
. Computer/Server Hardware Troubleshooting experience
. Basic understanding of Network operation / support experience
. Written & verbal communication skills
. Ability to lift & install equipment up to 20kg it may require working in narrow spaces or in elevated locations while adhering to health & safety guidelines
. This role involves covering 24x7 shift rotation

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

. LINUX Operating System, Hardware or Networking certifications.
. Knowledge in virtual/cloud computing environments.
. Understanding of IT service management
. Understanding of Data Center environment safety and security.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.
